choices: Far away, in a distant place
1.content:
The story?

Your story is not about the promising life you had once had all to yourself, the dreams of becoming the Pokemon League Champion and beating all of the gym leaders in a battle. No, although that was not a bad goal for yourself, it turned out that the real story of your life involved something different.

Entirely different.

It all began the day that you finally graduated from Pokemon school. It was a happy day, as much as you tried to be unsentimental. You were done with school for the rest of your life, as you had decided to take the trainer's path and skip college. You were busy celebrating with friends, counting down the hours until you would receive your first pokemon as a gift from your parents for all your hard work in school.

Ironic. Heh.

The very thing that you were dying to get was actually going to become the worst plummet your life would ever take. If only you had known then.

You returned home that evening--that fateful evening--to find your parents waiting excitedly for you in the living room. Your mom had the most delighted, wide smile you had ever seen. Your dad simply nodded at you, gently caressing the stubble on his jaw. Out on the table before you was a small, gray box. Inside of it, as you soon discovered, was the pokeball containing your future. You were still trying to act like it wasn't a big deal, that this entire day was overrated and blown out of proportion, at that point. As such, you told your parents thank you and said you would officially start tomorrow morning. They were a little disappointed, which was to be expected, but they wizened up to your convincing. Pokeball in hand, you quietly went up to your room.

That's when it all began.

As you laid on your bed, you smiled to yourself, secretly knowing your true intentions. This was, of course, not something you were willing to put off until tomorrow. You wanted to see your pokemon now! You held it in both hands, looking down at it, and then reached to press the release button on the ball.

Wow.

Even now, it’s still hard to believe what really happened just then and there.

You only faintly remember that the beam from the ball struck you, paralyzing your body in an instant. You do remember that sudden fear you had the moment you realized that your parents had made a mistake. This pokeball did not contain a Pokemon at all! In fact--little did you know--this specific pokeball was an experiment that had accidentally found its way into the public’s hands. The researchers had not wanted it to get out to anyone, but a mix-up had now put you into the way of this strange poke ball’s new effects.

You recall blacking out very quickly.

Then, you woke up, and nothing was the same. You were strangely soaked, out in the dark, and and beside you was a discarded soda can, taller than you. At first, you thought you were dreaming. This had to be a mistake! But then, you began to find out for yourself about your new life. There had been a change of plans for you, leaving you shrunken and powerless to every human and pokemon around you. It was no longer about winning it big and becoming wealthy, famous, and incredible. No, now it was all just about survival, all about getting to the next day while trying to return to your normal life before ending up in the gut of a pokemon or on the bottom of a human’s shoe.

Hm… It feels like it’s been a long time. Where exactly did you find out that you were, again?
1.title: Background

11.content:
You were lucky. You had not fallen too far away from your most helpful place.

At least, that's what you thought as you pushed yourself up from the moist dirt.

Your family was definitely asleep this late at night. Either your dad or mom would be the best choice for help, but they would be hard to get to with their busy schedules and quick paces. One of your sisters, sixteen-year-old Laynee or ten-year-old Haley, could suffice if you could not get your parents' help. Then again, they had never showed any interest in you. They didn't even go to your graduation. You had never gotten along very well with them, but this kind of a situation could change that around. Unfortunately, it could also tilt the relationship even further the other way, leaving you vulnerable in the hands of one of your own sisters.

Or, with the consideration of every option available, you could always attempt to get help from one of the family pokemon. They had usually been friendly with you, but that could've easily been a front from pokemon that were angry at being reduced to simple pets. Also, it would be much easier to have a little snack on you rather than help you.

It's all up to you.

"Oh my goodness," she exclaims," it's you!"
Her booming voice forced you to cover your ears.
"Oh no," she said more quietly," I'm sorry sweetheart, I didn't realize your ears must be much more sensitive now." She lowered her hand to let you climb on.
Hesitant at first due to the sheer hugeness of her body, you do so. You were comforted by the warmth and softness of her palm. She brings you up to her face.
"Now, what exactly happened to you?"
You relay all that had happened to you.
"I see," she appears deep in thought, " Ah yes," she recalled," I think I saw something on TV that might have to do with this."
You feel a sigh of relief. All your life, your mother had been the one to solve any problem you could not.
She began to explain how a recent news station covered a story where several Pokemon professors had attempted to capture pokemon moves inside of Poke balls. She guessed it was likely the Pokemon move Minimize.
"Your starter pokemon must have been switched with one of their balls," She cocked her head to one side and smiled.
"How do we get me back to normal, then?"
"Well, I suppose we'll have to check in with those Pokemon professors. They'll know what to do. We'll head out tomorrow morning."
Your mother glided to her room, carrying you close to her bosom.
She places you on your father's pillow.
"Goodnight sweetie."
You both close your eyes and drift off.

113.content:
After careful consideration, you decided that Laynee was definitely your best choice for help. Your mom and dad probably would be too busy to notice you and Haley might not realize the full extent of the danger in your situation. Laynee was a good balance between the two extremes, which made her the most favorable to your mind.

But, as you started moving towards the house, you noticed that something was up. The lights were still on in the house, plus the dim sound of loud music being played came from within. High above you was the moon and the stars, obviously nighttime, yet your family was up partying this late?

When you reached the sliding glass door on the back porch, you peered in and confirmed your suspicions. They seemed to be having an extravaganza, despite all what had happened to you. The place was packed with punch bowls, empty cups laying scattered on the floor, plates of food on various surfaces... They were really enjoying themselves.

Then, you saw your family come into view. There was your mom, the girl-woman who would never let herself fall into the stereotypical housewife and mother type of person. She was dancing away, flaunting her remarkably trim body and curvy appeals. With her was Laynee, who seemed to be competing with Mom on who had the better body and moves. Laynee had your mom's long, dark hair and the curls that came along with it. Haley, on the other hand, was a bold blonde. She stood beside Dad, who had given her the blonde hair, and shouted at Laynee and Mom excitedly. Haley was always trying to be older than she really was, which always came off as obvious faking, especially when she forgot to act her way and allowed her inner child to push through. You and Dad had never really talked much. He was the silent type that seemed only to nod to you when you did something correct or watch you menacingly when you screwed up.

It felt lonely for you, standing out with a barrier blocking you from your family. Plus, with your current size, things just didn't seem like they would ever return to normal.

You glanced around for an entrance into the house and noticed that they had left the sliding door open, just a crack. You ran over and squeezed inside, returning to your own home. Now, though, your stomach churned and butterflies flounced inside of you. You were nervous. What would happen if you got stepped on? Obviously, it wouldn't be good, but would it be enough to actually kill you?

Then you received your answer.

Mom walked into the kitchen (which was the room you were in, also the room just beside the living room where they were at) and she collected some punch from the table. She was far enough away that you didn't need to worry--at least, not yet--but you witnessed for the first time the true horror that creatures your size had in the company of giantesses like her. An unfortunate little beetle got caught up trying to get through the kitchen. As your mom turned to head back to the living room, she unknowingly walked right on top of the helpless beetle. You heard the crunch of its body being broken beneath the sole of her foot, the snap of its exoskeleton, and the smoosh that its insides gave upon being smashed. The beetle was annihilated. And, Mom didn't even notice.

You gulped.

That could be you.

You needed to do something, or it would be you!
113.title: Get Laynee's (16 y.o.) help

1133.content:
Seriously? You really considered the options of going straight to the source of all of their drinks AND walking the same dumb path as the beetle did BEFORE thinking to choose the hallway path?

Well, at least you chose correctly.

You avoided the path that only someone who really wanted you to die at the feet, teeth, or butt of one of your family members would take. You chose to evade the obvious threats.

But, as you entered the hallway, you heard a sound. You quickly discovered what the source was: Your cousin Heather was running down the stairs at the end of the hallway. You had not heard that she was planning on coming, but you didn't want to wait to be greeted by her. Her feet were stampeding towards you, one in a white sock and the other in a fully-pink sock. She was a pretty, light-brown haired girl--a sophomore--but you didn't really want to be smashed dead under her feet, no matter how enticing that fate sounded.

Heather was coming fast. You had to move!
1133.title: Leave the kitchen and head down the hallway

11331.content:
You try to avoid her oncoming feet by jumping left. You dive to the side, rolling around, but when you look up, you see your cousin's right foot dropping down upon you. Beyond it was her face, with her brown eyes on you. She seemed to have seen you, but was too far in stride to stop before she stepped on you. Unfortunately, her white-socked foot landed down on top of you and almost instantly caused you to explode across the sole of her foot. She walked right over you, but stopped and looked back at the end of the hallway. She gulped.

"Did I really just see my cousin there on the floor?" she asked herself. She was too afraid to look at the bottom of her foot. "No, it couldn't have been... But it looked so much like..."

She turned away without discovering for sure, but the thought of your frightened expression before she had accidentally stepped on you never left her dreams. She later learned that you turned up missing, never to return, but she kept the secret to herself. She rationed with her own guilt. If it was an accident, then it didn't matter, right? Plus, I didn't really step on him... That was just a hallucination... Of course. Who accidentally steps on their shrunken cousin?

It took you a few minutes just to reach the stairs. When you arrived, you looked up. It would be a long trip, leaving you vulnerable on the white-carpeted stairs. But, then again, if you stayed to the side, you should be safe.

You began to climb, but as you began, you found out that it was going to be impossible to climb from the side. It was an odd bit of architectural work, something you had never noticed before. For some reason, the sides of the stairs were made to curve upwards towards the wall, putting them out of the reach of you jump. In order to climb from one step to another, you would have to climb up in the middle of the stair, where it was the lowest. That would easily leave you vulnerable if someone came running up the stairs, but there was no other choice.

Each step took nearly a minute just to climb one. Often, you missed your grab, slipped from the hold, or just didn't jump high enough. Then, it was tough just to pull yourself up.

You laughed, remembering P.E. Who would've thought that things you could've learned in that class would be useful? Now you wished you had paid attention during the climbing drills and such.

1133221112.content:
You decided to wait patiently for her to come to you rather than the other way around. You sat down and watched the door. Several minutes passed by without a sound or movement, but you continued waiting patiently. You thought you heard some shuffling around, but with your tiny ears it was hard to tell what it was or where it was coming from.

You yawned, tired.

Your eyes blinked and in the next second, you were floating up in the skies. The lower half of your body was gone, replaced with a strange wisp. You looked above you and saw that you had a halo floating over your head, and that you were soaring towards the clouds.

Then you realized it.

You had died.

-----------------------------

In the last few seconds of your life, you had heard some kind of sound nearby. You had thought little of it, but it was actually your own mom coming up the stairs. With your ears, you couldn't hear her bare feet walking up soft carpeted stairs. Plus, because of the carpet, you didn't feel her coming towards you. Your eyes were focused the opposite way of the stairs, towards your sister's bedroom door.

Unfortunately, that combination of a lack of senses towards the stairs allowed your mom to sneak up behind you as she came up the stairs. She was just as much in the dark as you were, though. She had no idea that her first step upstairs was on her shrunken son. She thought she felt something breaking below her, but she didn't really care. She continued to walk you off of her sole until, when she finally looked down at the floor, there was no telling the difference between you and anything else that had been stepped on at your size.
1133221112.title: Stay put until she comes out

"Well, I'll just leave him on my sock and teach him a good lesson."

You moaned. Her next step finished you off completely, but you remained on the bottom of Heather's foot as she danced with your family, slept that night, and then went to school the next day. You almost became one with her sock as she participated in gym class and kept you locked inside her shoes. When she finally peeled off her socks the next night, she looked at her pink sock and smiled.

"Good," she said when you were interlaced with the threads of the sock. "I cremated you."

11513112.content:
You stayed put, hoping to figure things out. Trying to outrun Delcatty would be futile in the open living room. She would have you inside of her in an instant.

"Delcatty, it's me. Don't you recognize my voice?" you asked.

It was quiet for a moment. Delcatty stopped moving. Then, to your surprise, she responded in clear English.

"Oh, so it is you," she replied.

"What? You really speak our language, Delcatty?"

"No, I'm still meowing, you just think I'm talking in English," she said. "Of course I'm speaking English, moron."

"How?"

"Maybe I have just been hiding it from you all, playing dumb," Delcatty told you. "Or maybe all us pokemon are doing that to you. Who knows?"

"Hey, I was shrunken somehow, can you please help me out?"

"Oh, I knew that you were shrunken. In fact, I was hoping I'd have the chance to meet you after you became shrunken."

"How did you know?"

"The humans. Your family," she said. "They planned it from the very beginning. They wanted to quietly get rid of you. The best way, they discovered, was to simply use a new type of pokeball that could shrink you down. Your dad got it from a friend who works in some big fancy human company. They said they thought you wouldn't last a minute before one of them accidentally stepped on you."

You couldn't believe it. Your own family did this to you...

Delcatty smiled in the darkness.

"It was all pretty cruel, if you ask me."

"So, will you help me out?"

"Maybe," she said.

"Huh? Why just maybe? I could die!"

"Well, if you survive a little game with me, I'll consider helping you out."

"A game? What game?"

"How about 'Cat and Mouse?'" she said. "I'll be the hungry cat, and you'll be the soon-to-be-eaten mouse. If you don't end up in my stomach, I'll help you."

"You're going to try to eat me?" you asked. You were shocked. Delcatty didn't really seem to care after all. This was all just fun to her.

"Well, if you don't want to play, we can skip the formalities," she replied. "I'm kinda tired anyway, and a quick snack like you would get me by for the rest of the night. So, what do you say?"

You soon felt a pounding rumbling through its body, it must have started walking again, because you felt a slight sway. You began to hope that where ever these three Pokémon where taking you, you would get there sooner rather than later.

As time went on, you noticed Mightynea’s mouth would move from time to time, at one point as the amount of its saliva almost drowned you, its tongue lifts you up. After that little episode everything went back the way it was before, until out of nowhere you felt a powerful thud underneath you, it sounded like a branch snapping back. Before you knew it, another surge pulled back down into the Mightyena’s throat, you were too shocked to react, but even if you could there was nothing you could do, but go with the flow. You first thought is that Eevee was evolving into Espeon, but as soon as the light of evolution vanished, you found a rather angry looking Sylveon, wiping its ribbons furiously at the wild Sentret.

The wild Sentret started a mega punch, but Sylveon leaps out of the way, before it can land a hit. You are soon held in front of its head, you try to say something, but Sylveon opens its mouth and licks you.

Delcatty says something in Pokémon, and Sylveon seems to reply with something. Your Pokémon, lifts you up onto its head and puts you between its ears and to the side of its bow. It then begins to walk again, you cannot see where Delcatty is, but you see Mightyena following just behind Sylveon.

As you lay between Sylveon’s ears, you think how lucky you are, Eevee does not ‘just’ evolve into Sylveon. It takes a whole lot of trust and friendship between both its master and the Pokémon for it to evolve into a Sylveon. It makes you wonder why Eevee has always been so much trouble.

Sylveon looks at you with a smile and says something you cannot understand, before it begins to drink from the river. You see Mightyena and Delcatty, nearby doing the same. You are not thirsty, and hope that your Pokémon dose not dunk you into the water.

As it catches up, Sylveon places you back between its ears. Mightyena seems to say something that you can’t understand, and Sylveon responds, you wonder if it might have something to do with the fact, that the whole time you where upside down, or that you did not get a drink.

Delcatty takes a few steps forward towards the Ninetales, leaving the fruit and leaves on the cave floor, before returning back to where it was before.

All the Pokémon remained silent, until the Ninetales stared at Delcatty. The Ninetales seem to say something you couldn’t understand, and Delcatty seemed to be answering to this Pokémon.

After a short while of Ninetales and Delcatty talking, the Ninetales looked at you with a cold stare, you then hear what the Pokemon has to say with telepathy.

“Human, I have cruse you, under the wishes from another human. This Delcatty has argued in your defence. I have made it so, you will return to your size, if you can survive until night fall two days from now”

You had so many questions rushing through your mind, one wasn’t that this Pokemon had spoken to you, with telepathy, you had already came across a tame Pokémon who could also use telepathy in the same manner.

Before you had a chance to ask one of the many questions you had flooding your mind, the Ninetales said something to the Pokémon, this caused Sylveon, Mightyena and Delcatty to turn around and go back the way they came in. You attempted to protest them leaving, as you looked up at Mightyena, you could see that it wasn’t happy about leaving.

Once everyone was back out in the open, Delcatty said something to Mightyena, before leaping into a nearby tree, it then began leaping from one tree to another, in what you guessed was the direction of home.

1152111211222111211211111.content:
Sylveon looks over at Mightyena, and the canine walks over, wondering what the fairy wants. Once it is close, Sylveon raises you up to the canine's face, just an inch in front of its snout, and holds you there. Mightyena looks at you and cocks its head to the side before looking past you at Sylveon, confused as to what the fairy is trying to do.

"Mightyena," you say, and the canine looks back at you. "I think Sylveon thinks I want to go inside your mouth again."

The dark type Pokemon takes a step back, surprised. Even though it had held you inside its mouth once before, and avoided eating you, it clearly is surprised that you would want to go back in. It's a dangerous thing to do, of course, and it does not want to hurt you.

"To be honest, I did enjoy being in your mouth," you say, "but I don't know if I want to go back in right now."

You look back and forth between the two Pokemon, trying to decide what to do. It's tempting to go back inside Mightyena's mouth, but at the same time, you don't know if that would be safe. You survived last time, but this time could go differently.

Sylveon continues to hold you right in front of Mightyena, and the dark type does not move, staying just a few inches from you.

They are waiting for your choice.

What do you want to do?

However your vision was fixed on what your Pokémon was doing, once Sylveon’s jaws had stretched to their limit, you felt yourself being pulled back and then thrown forward.

You were lucky to have your head land in the Pokémon’s gullet, as your chest landed on its tongue. For a second you seem to have bounced, the same kind of bounce, when you jump into bed. You found that Sylveon would swallow you in lumps, each lump was followed by loud swallowing sound, you didn’t count them yourself, but it took your Pokémon only five attempts, before completely consuming you. You then felt a sudden shudder and snap, coming from behind you, as it closed its mouth. For the next few moments, you could see nothing, but felt your Pokémon’s crushing organ force you along a path you always dream of taking, each time you had given your Pokémon something to eat. Its heart beat was lost to your eats, but easily felt by your body.

All of a sudden, you felt your head press into the Pokémon’s closed muscle, the sphincter as its known. It stretched open as your body pasted through into the chamber leading off from its esophagus.
At first you sit up, but find it hard to keep yourself up right, as the fleshy chamber bludges and squeezes around you. For now you remain frozen, taking in the random movements of its stomach and the sounds, a light heart beating light heart beating sound, and just under that, you could hear and feel through your hands and feet, its voice. Sylveon had been saying something, you didn't know to who, but it was talking.

As time went on, you were tossed about inside its belly. It felt as if you’re Pokémon was moving around while talking to another Pokémon, you guessed it was Mightyena, but who or whatever it was, Sylveon wasn't standing still.

You thought that this was the end. You felt your skin burn as the acids dissolved your body. It was a slow, painful way to go.

But then you woke up.

You found yourself in a small chamber, your body curled up tight. You can't move at all, and you feel something connected to your naval. What was going on? Didn't you die?

Suddenly you start to move forward, through a small, tight passageway. At the end of the tunnel, you see a light, and once through, you can't help but cry.

No, you literally can't help it. You don't know why you're crying, you just can't stop. You can't open your eyes either, which confuses you, and your body feels weird, which confuses you more. What was going on?

Something lifts you up, which you do not like, and seems to examine you.

"It's a boy!" An unfamiliar voice says. Then, your set back down, next to something that feels warm and safe. You unintentionally let out little yips, like the barks of a small Pokemon. Something responds to these yips by grabbing you by the scruff of your neck and bringing you closer. This same thing then begins to lick you, but it's not tasting you, more like cleaning you. What was it?

The Fairy Pokémon giggled, as it said, “O come on, I was only joking” it took a few steps towards Mightyena, while using one of its ribbons to pat the bite Pokémon on its head, “My master seem to enjoy you eating him, so why not with me” It asked.
