"... I'm alright," you say, assuming that the question was ‘Are you alright?’

Soon, you find the giantess' short paw reaching out for you. Her three fingers gently wrap around your waist as she brings you upwards, pressing you against her furry chest. Her other paw joins in her hug as well.

You happily hug back. Mew made many efforts to rescue you, this is the least you can do to thank her.

But you can't help but glance at the fainted Weavile. She had called you her friend...

Feeling things shaking, you glance back at Mew, discovering her getting up. The pink giantess unsuccessfully tries to hover a few times, before actually managing to fly in midair properly.

Two huge, sapphire eyes gaze down to you.
‘Le-Let's go back...’ Mew speaks in your mind, having recovered enough to use telepathy.

You nod your head, before glancing at Weavile again...

"Wait, Mew," you say, causing the legendary to halt and look back down at you. She gives you a curious stare.

"She... she was actually being nice to me," you slowly admit, freeing one of your arms from Mew's hug and pointing at Weavile.

Mew looks at her, then back at you, this time wearing a confused stare upon her visage.
"Yeah... I think we should move her somewhere else. Some other pokemon could easily eat her right now..." you reason.

Again, Mew glances at the unconscious Weavile, feeling a little guilty.

The pink giantess hovers to her earlier opponent, her eyes glowing blue as she performs Miracle Eye. Psychic didn't affect dark types, and Mew didn't really want to drag a fainted pokemon throughout the forest.

Type disadvantage gone, Mew lifts Weavile and starts hovering deeper into the forest.

--

Mew suddenly halts as she spots a small cave.
‘It'll work...’ she says in your mind, before moving inside of the cavern.

You recognize it as the same cave where Weavile tried to make you her next prey. However, you decide to keep quiet about it.

Mew gently places the fainted pokemon onto the ground, before flying out of the cave.

"Well... that was one crazy adventure..." you mumble, making Mew giggle.
‘You can say that. Just look at us,’ she chimes.

You do as she told. And you feel a lump in your throat upon doing so.

You don't quite know what both you and Mew are going to tell Celebi: your arm is partially scratched and covered in dried blood, while your whole body is soaked in saliva;

Mew's pink fur is covered in a mess of dust, soil, small branches and leaves, while her palm is still bleeding from the slash she received. Luckily, that was the only thing that Weavile's claws touched.

"Uh..." Mew giggles again.
‘That Weavile put up quite a fight...’ she says, before sighing.
‘Let's go back. I bet Celebi is awake by now...’

You nod, and the giantess resumes flying in direction of the shrine where she left her sleeping friend.

--

Mew was actually right.

Celebi has awoken from her slumber shortly ago. She felt much better now, thanks to the human's care. She made a mental note to thank him later and started looking around for him and Mew.

However, the forest's patroness couldn't find them anywhere around...

A sudden noise draws the legendary fairy's attention. She looks around, noticing a bush shaking. And she watches as a familiar pink tail comes out of it.

Celebi smiles.
"Hi the-" she chokes back her sentence to let out a gasp: Mew is holding her little human... both of them are in a pitiful state!

Mew nervously giggles.
"Hi Celebi," she says as her friend flutters closer.
"Mew... what...?" Celebi mutters incredulously as her gaze travels down to you in Mew's paws.

Quietly, the green fairy picks you in her own paws. She feels your body soaked.
"Hey Celebi..." you mutter, giving a small smile.
"Poor my little cutie..." she says, hugging you, before looking back at Mew.
"Mew... what happened to you? How did you end up like this...?" she asks.

Mew giggles again.
"Hehe, you see..."
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.title: A not-for-nothing legend

choices: ... the Weavile from earlier looking right at you!
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.content:
"So? What happened to you both?" Celebi briefly rises her head to look at Mew. Though her paw doesn't stop rubbing your tiny form as the grass type fairy vigorously wipes the sticky saliva off your body.

"Ow! Slow down Celebi!" you exclaim, closing your eyes to prevent three large fingers causing irreversible damage to them.

The three fingers suddenly stop. Celebi's gaze falls down upon your arm as she notices one particular.

The fairy gently picks your left arm in her paw, noticing it's wounded. Though it's just a mere scratch, it's covered in dried blood.

Your eyes open, and you look up, noticing the legendary fairy examining your wounded arm.

"... Mew?" Celebi asks, rising her head again. Mew gives a nervous shrug, inadvertently exposing her palm.

Celebi's eyes widen as a horrified expression takes place on her visage.

Mew too is scratched, small drops of blood running down her open wound.
"... Seriously, what happened to you?" Celebi asks, growing more and more worried.
"You look like you were hit by a Hyper Beam..."

"Trust me, that would have been nicer..." Mew mumbles.
"Come again?"
"Nothing!"

Celebi's gaze falls on you again as she holds you in front of her huge blue eyes.
"Wh-Why are you looking at me like that?" you ask.

"I just want to know what happened to you both, cutie..." Celebi responds, even though she knows you cannot understand her.

"Uh..." as you try to figure out what she just said, a very familiar voice speaks in your mind:
‘Not a word of what happened!’

Visibly startled, you look back at Mew, who stares at you intently.
‘Don't say anything about it...’ Mew repeats pleadingly.

You nod in understanding. However, Celebi knows that Mew is talking to you through telepathy.
"Okay, just what are you two hiding?" she cries in annoyance.

"Nothing!" Mew hurries to exclaim. And, before her friend can further complain, Mew snatches you from her.
"Hehe, look at us! Me and this little one need a bath!" she exclaims, desperately trying to change topic.

Luckily, it seems to work as Celebi suddenly nods, once again looking at the state you and Mew are in.
"There's no denying that." she says, before floating in front of her pink friend and smiling.
"Follow me. I know where you two can bathe,"

Mew internally sighs in relief as she looks at you.
‘We've just dodged a...’
‘... Bullet?’ you complete with a smile. Mew sighs, before giggling.
‘Yeah. That.’

--

Celebi suddenly stops.
"There," she says, pointing to a small lake. Mew nods, while you understand what the giantesses are up to.
"W-Wait..." you say, getting Mew to giggle.

‘We DO need a bath, no?’ she says in your mind.

Before you can even think of arguing, Mew floats forward, towards the lake. You barely have the time to hold your breath as the giantess splashes into the water.

Mew surfaces again, and you along with her.

But, before you can grab your first breath of fresh air, another splash of water hits you and her.

You look to see Celebi surfacing from the water.
"Might as well join the fun~" she says, picking you from Mew and hugging you.

Although wet, the grass type fairy's skin maintains its warmth, which is somewhat comforting in the cold water. You sigh as you watch the two giantesses merrily starting to play in the water...

--

Celebi and Mew get out of the water.

Mew's fur was finally rid of dirt, while her paw stopped bleeding;

The saliva was finally removed from your body, and the dried blood was washed away by the water.

Both Mew and Celebi look at each other, before shaking themselves dry. You, who are still solidly held by Celebi, are shook back and forth, feeling dizzy as a result.

"That was really nice!" Mew cheers as she and Celebi starts to fly back to Ilex Forest's shrine.
"Yep. Right, cutie?" the patroness of the forest chimes while looking at you.
"Uh..." you respond, not quite sure of what she said, and not really caring right now.

Eventually, the giantesses get back to the shrine.

You suddenly catch Celebi lowering herself to ground level, gently letting you down, before hovering upwards, plucking a few berries from a tree, before descending back down.

The giantess tossed a berry at Mew, before sitting down beside you, making the ground shake beneath your feet. Celebi sets a single berry in from of you; it's roughly your size.

"Eat up!"

--

Night fully descended into Ilex Forest when you, Mew and Celebi finally finish eating.

You notice Celebi yawning.
"Well, today sure was tiring!" she exclaims.
"I've got a cutie for myself, then he was kidnapped by a Zoroark, then you ate him," Celebi giggles.

"Then he was kidnapped by a Weavile..." Mew thinks out loud.
"What?"
"Nothing!"

Celebi huffs.
"Mew, you've been acting weird for a while..." she remarks.

Mew freezes. Celebi yawns again.
"Well, bedtime I guess," she says, causing Mew to sigh in relief.

The legendary fairy then turns to you.
"Time to sleep, cutie!" she says cheerfully, reaching for you.

"Guess where you're sleeping~"

The next minutes pass too quickly for you to figure out what just happened.

In a second, you found yourself laying down on top of Celebi's chest, her paws holding you down and a massive blush upon your face after she kissed your head.

Now, the grass type and Mew are currently asleep beside each other, while you try to recollect your thoughts. However, you are pretty tired.

Yawning, you decide to sleep on it, and lay your head on Celebi's chest. Your eyes close as you enjoy the warmth and the smoothness of Celebi.

Soon, your consciousness starts to fade, and you do nothing to oppose as sleep claims your head...

...

You wake up and yawn, feeling like a really short time passed since you fell asleep.
Your eyes open as you drowsily glance around, not quite making out things in the darkness of the night.

Your eyes soon adjust to the darkness of the forest as you notice...
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.title: Dodged a bullet...

choices: Celebi's going to be pretty pissed, better check in with her first
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.content:
Like a vision of hell, the blood-soaked Weavile is staring down at you. You inhale sharply to scream, but before you can make a sound she expertly snatches you from out of Celebi's grasp and shoves you straight into her mouth.

Confusion. Heat. And most of all, a truly dreadful stench surrounds you as your new world oozes death. Much like earlier the rapid heartbeat is deafening and you're thrown around like a ragdoll inside the wet cavern, the large red muscle beneath manipulating you and making sure you don't end up on the wrong end of a razor-sharp fang. The saliva sticks to your body, and eventually you're trapped in a glob so heavy you can't imagine moving anywhere but down into the abyss of the Weavile's stomach.

An eternity of you pinching yourself to try and wake up passes before it all hits you at once. Cold, a hasty fall, and the noise of a giant spitting. The glob of saliva carries you out into further darkness and breaks your fall as you land on a patch of grass, though it your size it was more like down below the strands. Wiping the gunk from your face, you see Weavile hunched over you to try and see if you're still alive.

"Ahh, fucking hell!" the Weavile yells exasperated as she sits down, her butt causing enough of a tremor to rattle you around, "Why would you scream!? If Celebi had woken up... I almost had a heart attack!"

"... Why would I not scream!?" you yell back, feeling quite exhausted after the trip and lack of sleep, "You almost ate me!"

"That's the thanks I get for saving you!?" the Weavile replies with annoyance, "You're lucky I didn't shove you somewhere else to shut you up!"

You fall silent as the Weavile puts her claw to her chest in an attempt to calm down. Seeing her giant body move makes you realize you had just been in there, and her heart had most definitively been working overtime.

"Save me?" you repeat, feeling confused for a moment. Then you remembered what you had told her earlier.

"Yeah," the Weavile mutters as she looks away, almost appearing somewhat embarassed, "We're friends, remember? What kind of friend would leave the other to die?"

"You..." you start, not sure how to feel about this. Was she mocking you? Was she angry that you had left her behind to die from her wounds or starvation? Was she just instilling you with a false sense of security before dropping you back into that pit of death, this time to never return?

"It wasn't my decision, Mew just took me away!" you shout. It really wasn't your decision. Nothing is really your decision anymore. If you're not being carried around like a doll, you're being sucked on like a piece of candy. Waiting for the day that you'll be devoured and broken down to fuel one of the many giantesses this forest had to offer.

"Hey..." the Weavile speaks up carefully, as you stand up defiantly and stare right at her. Her stature made you feel completely insignificant, and it felt fitting somehow. You're the size of an ant and the way others treat you you might as well be one.

"Just get it over with," you groan as you hold your arms out in submission, "Do what you must. Eat me, or whatever makes you happy. I'm sick of living like this!"

The evening chill blew past you as the Weavile looked down at you. With a sigh of resignation, she bends over and picks you up, holding you in front of her face.

"Are you still asleep?" she asks with a frustrated expression, "I said I SAVED you. Do you think I'd risk fighting two legendaries over a bite-sized morsel like you?"

"... Wha...?" you say sheepishly.

"I've already eaten. I killed a Caterpie after you two left," she explains, and you remember that scent of death inside her oral cavity. Something you could still smell now that you were being held so close to her mouth.

"I'm sorry. I was too weak," she continues before closing her eyes in determination, "But I won't let them take you again. I'll protect you."

"... Protect me? From what?" you ask quietly. The Weavile snorts.

"Dude, you're the size of my..." she chuckles before suddenly adopting a very blank expression, "... You're very small. So everything."

"But... Celebi and I..." you try to muster up a sentence in this shocking turn of events.

"You said she ate you," the Weavile interjects.

"So did you!" you reply vehemently before losing steam, remembering you wouldn't even be here if not for her mercy, "... Kind of?"

"See? Your situation is improving!" the Weavile laughs as you shake around in her grip, "Heck, I'll even do you one better. We'll find a way to get you back to your original size."

"You... You will!?" you suddenly burst out in surprise. You feared that this was some kind of trick, but felt your hopes rising regardless.

"Of course! No offense but small guy = big liability," as the Weavile gently sets you down between her legs, "If you went back to the way you were we could do lots of things, like hunt together!"

"You know of a way to help me?" you ask skeptically, feeling like this was somehow too good to be true.

"Nope!" she replies cheerfully. Figures. Though you had to admit to yourself, that this Weavile appeared more eager in finding a solution than both Celebi and Mew, who seemed to be enjoying you at this size. And a far better option than trying to go at it alone.
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.title: A night inside of the Weavile

choices: Weavile is still hungry - she goes hunting, bringing you along
You're still tired - ask Weavile to let you sleep for a while
Back at Celebi - she wakes up noticing you missing...
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.content:
"Alright Weavile - I'm in." you respond to the dark type giantess, whose grin widens, becoming less of a smirk and more like a gentle smile.
"Nice!" she exclaims cheerfully.

"ON one condition though," you continue. The Weavile's smile fades, and her eyebrow rises as she stares at you curiously.
"I want to be nowhere near your mouth... or the other places you mentioned before..." you say, blushing vaguely.

Weavile lets your words sink in, before smirking again.
"That's debatable..." she retorts. You freeze up.
"... Why?" you ask, before starting to tense up.
"... You aren't planning to eat me again, are you?"

Weavile snickers.
"Perhaps I am," she laughs, before seeing your face, deprived of color, with your mouth hanging open.
"Aw come on - I was kidding!" she exclaims playfully, placing her claws down in between her legs as she bends over you.

"No, seriously, just imagine what would happen if me and you ran into Celebi and Mew at some point," she then explains with a serious expression, which she hardly maintains as she witnesses you pale and speechless.

"Think about what would happen if they find you with me... I wouldn't be able to fight them back for long - just see what happened with Mew..." she recalls, instinctively bringing a claw to her face, where Mew slapped her with her tail.

You look up as your face regains a bit of color.
"... Just what are you trying to say?" you ask, your vocal chords working again.

"... I'm saying, if they happens, I'll have to run at some point, no? And, unless you want to be left with them again, I'll have to carry you..." she nervously gestures for her mouth.

Whatever little bit of color your face managed to regain fades again.
"No way!" you shout, recalling how you were almost killed while Mew and the Weavile fought while you were still in her mouth. You almost got a close meeting with one of her fangs, and you were mercifully thrown out of her mouth.

You don't want to experience such thing again.

The dark weasel frowns.
"Look, remember what happened earlier with my claws?" she asks. You instinctively touch your left arm, the one she scratched while running from Mew.

"... I-I... what would happen if you swallowed me?" you reason.

Weavile brings a single claw up to her temple as she nervously scratches her head.
"Well... I'll be extra careful I guess..." she responds.
"Though if that happens, I'll have to spit you back out..."

The promise made you a little bit more comfortable. However...

"And what if... what if you don't manage to...?" you ask, dreading the scenario of yourself slowly melting in a pool of gastric acid. You have already experienced that twice. Sadly, Weavile hasn't the ability to travel through time, nor she hasn't any psychic powers which she could use to bring you back up...

To your surprise, Weavile blushes as she starts laughing nervously.
"Well..." she awkwardly says.
"Then your only option would be to take the... ‘natural route’..."

You blush massively as your face contorts into an expression of sheer disgust.
"Oh God..." you mumble as you try to shake off the image from your mind.

Weavile keeps snickering to herself.
"Anymore questions?" she asks.
"Which don't involve my intestines?"

You wildly shake your head in embarrassment, causing the Weavile to snicker again. You then look up at her.
"Well... about me regaining my original size..." you say, getting back on topic.
"... How do we do that?"

"Hm..." Weavile responds as she suddenly quiets down, placing a claw under her chin.

She thinks for a few minutes, before giving a defeated sigh.
"I'm clueless." she admits, closing her eyes and holding her claws up.

Your expression becomes one of annoyance as you huff. Just your luck, you guess.

"Hey, relax," the giantess says, attempting to comfort you. Gently, her claw grips the back of your shirt, and the ground starts receding as she lifts you up.

Soon, you are dangling in front of her face.
"We'll do it somehow. We might even have to leave the forest but... I promise we'll find a way to grow you back. In the meantime, I'll protect and feed you," she says, her mouth cracking up in a small smile.

You sigh, before smiling a bit yourself.
"That's... nice, I guess..." you respond, causing her to snicker as she begins to get up.

"Might not be the best friendship ever... but I guess it'll go just fine..." she chimes.
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.title: An awkward talking with the Weavile

choices: Celebi calmed down and listened to you carefully...
No need for an explanation, things were clear enough!
Before anything, Weavile snatched you and fled!
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.content:
A drowsy yawn escaped through your mouth, reminding you that you didn't catch too much sleep tonight.

"Well... thanks, Weavile," you chimed,
"Now I think I'll just return to sl-"

"Oh no, no no no, you gotta stay awake!" Weavile interrupted, a frown appearing on her face.

"Wha- why?" you asked as two of her claws closed around the back of your shirt, letting you dangle in front of the giantess.

"What do I do if you sleep? Night's sill young, y'know!" she stated, looking at the moon.

By its position, you judged that it couldn't be later than 2 or 3 AM.

You yawned again.

"C'mon, can't we do something in the morning?" you insisted.

Weavile raised an eyebrow.

And you realized how dumb your question was. As a nocturnal predator, Weavile slept during the bright part of the day.

"Oh..." you blushed.

"Yeah," Weavile said, her smile returning as she noted your resigned expression,
"Now, since bug-types aren't that filling... or tasty..." Weavile assumed a disgusted expression, her tongue stuck out and her body shivered.

"... I'm going to hunt again," she continued with a sigh, making you remember that she was one predator that didn't like hunting.

"And you're coming along!" her tone was much brighter now.

"W-What?" you asked, recalling the disastrous results of you going with her earlier.
"... Am I going into your mouth again?"

"Of course!" Weavile chimed,
"I told that earlier too, remember? Unless you want to try that other option I mentioned..." her cheeks flared up at this, but you paid the last comment no mind.

"NO way!" you retorted, flailing your legs and waving your arms,
"You almost killed me last time!"

The dark-type snickered.

"Hehehe, will be extra careful now!" she chimed, stomach growling in hunger.
"Hear that? Let's hurry."

You opened your mouth to oppose again, to remind Weavile that Celebi or Mew could be searching for you, that she might risk another fight in which you or her (or both of you) could be killed.

But then, you remembered that the two legendaries were asleep, unaware of what happened to you while they slept, and your mouth fell back into place.

You simply adopted an expression of annoyance as you waved an arm in agreement.

"Great! Hold on!" Weavile said happily, once again opening that dreadful, fang-filled cavern that smelled like death... not yours, hopefully.

The two claws holding you hovered closer to the giantess' oral cavity and gently slid you past her razor-sharp teeth, placing you on top of the tongue.

A few drops of saliva fell from her palate as he claw retracted, causing you to get hit by the sticky liquid.

Darkness fell as Weavile's lips returned back in place.

The giantess took a moment to enjoy your taste, before she moved towards the nearest tree.

Her stomach growled again. From your position dangerously close to the giantess' stomach, it felt like a thunderstorm.

It eventually ceased, and the only sounds that could be heard were your captor's heartbeat and her scaling the tree outside, although you couldn't possibly know; you were trapped in darkness, left unable to see anything of what was going on outside while you were thrown to and fro in the mouth as Weavile moved.

Eventually, the weasel climbed up to a high branch, much like she had done earlier. There, she stood up and started leaping from branch to branch, from tree to tree with masterful agility.

You groaned as the movements increased, you being thrown around more as a consequence. Plus, you had to bear through the occasional rumble coming from downwards and you had to constantly hold on to the giant tongue in order to not end up impaled on one of the many, many fangs that formed a solid, deadly wall of white in front of you.

Eventually, it all came to an end as Weavile leaped to one last branch, before she spotted something green peeking out of a bush.

She couldn't tell what pokemon it was though... well, she was about to find out soon, she thought dejectedly as she raised one of her claws.

Whatever pokemon it was, it looked like it wasn't moving, so Weavile assumed it was sleeping.

Reluctantly, she climbed down.

--

Nothing.

She felt tears in her eyes as she turned around and scanned the ground with more attention.

Celebi had woken up from her sleep because of a bad dream, in which she had lost her precious little human; waking up, she had found that her nightmare came true: the little human she was so fond of was gone.

Needless to say, Celebi had immediately left Mew to wander around in her own forest in search of the human.

It wasn't a particularly hard task, she knew the forest like her wings, she could find him easily; but each minute that passed without him squeezed in her hug made her worry increase.

She had to find him, and soon, or he might have ended up as food for some predator. The forest was full of those.

Each time she heard the cry of a pokemon in distance, Celebi's heart leaped within her chest.

Then, just as she was about to move on to another place, she heard paw-steps right behind her.

And she barely had time to turn around to see a set of claws darting direction of her chest.

Celebi had less than a split second to step aside, the claws passing her and hitting the air, before retreating.

At first, Celebi thought she was unharmed, but the sudden drop of something sticky and warm on her foot told her that the claw touched her, opening a small cut in her green skin.

With horror, Celebi realized that someone just attempted to kill her.

Hastily, she rose to her full height to face whoever's claws those were.

And she found face-to-face with a Weavile, who backed up, horrified.

Celebi had woken up, and she just attacked her!

"Bii..." the green legendary hovered in mid-air and out of the bush, menacingly close to the startled Weavile, whose jaw opened so suddenly that you couldn't help but tumble down and out of it, one of the sharp fangs partially scratching your arm in the process.

You fell down and screamed, drawing the attention of both giantesses.

Luckily, something gripped you, and you found yourself going up instead of down.

You opened your eyes with reluctance, finding Celebi's glowing as she held with psychic, regarding your saliva-coated body.

Celebi stared at you for a couple minutes, in which Weavile backed up, terrified.

Then, Celebi's face contorted into an expression of pure rage.

"BI!" she screamed, glaring daggers at Weavile, obviously having jumped to the wrong conclusion that Weavile wanted to eat you.

It wasn't hard to come to such conclusion, you thought, you literally fell from her mouth.

Damn it, why was Celebi even awake?

The furious legendary started hovering closer to the utterly scared Weavile, you in tow, ready to make the weasel face her wrath.

Celebi glowed green and, for a moment, your mind saw Zoroark where Weavile was.

You remembered what end the vixen faced, sent in another era by Celebi's time-traveling abilities.

Time itself seemed to stand still as a green aura began enveloping Weavile.

"No!"

Like it all had been just a nightmare, the aura faded, a small breeze blew through the woods, and Celebi looked down at you questioningly.

You couldn't move, held by psychic, but you could at least speak,

"Celebi, I know you're angry, but this is ALL a huge misunderstanding!" you stated. Coming from your mouth, it sounded quite ironic.

Celebi cocked her head, while Weavile smiled in your direction, silently thanking you for avoiding her a horrible fate.

"Bi?!" Celebi asked while glaring at Weavile once again.

"Please! You need to let me explain, you might do something you might regret!" you said, and you felt like you were back in the cave with the same weasel that was currently shaking in front of you, back when she wanted to make a snack out of you.

Again Celebi's gaze traveled back to you.

"Bi." she said quite coldly, though you couldn't understand her and simply opted to ask once more,

"Please Celebi..."
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.title: Repeated mistake

choices: Celebi simply carried you away, leaving Weavile alone...
Celebi glared angrily at Weavile... uh-oh...
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.content:
Celebi stared at you with an agitated, though mostly angered expression.

Seeing you tumbling down from the mouth of a foreign (and a girl, too!) pokemon had been a shocking sight to see.

But her human spoke, telling that this was all a misunderstanding... and what if it really was?

"Bi..." Celebi muttered to herself.

Moved by her mind, you levitated in between the legendary and the startled Weavile; Celebi's tiny fingers sank into your sides as the Psychic faded, and you were forced to look in those two lakes of blue that were the eyes of the fairy.

"Bi." she said, or perhaps repeated: it was hard to tell what she was saying since you couldn't understand poke-speech.

Noticing your confused expression, Weavile hastily chimed in,

"E-Explain..." she timidly stuttered, earning a brief glance from Celebi, before the legendary focused on you again.

"Ehm... y'see, I know what it looked like, but Weavile wasn't trying to eat me..." you started. At least, you BELIEVED that Weavile wasn't going to eat you...

"I... she was hunting-" Celebi glared disdainfully at Weavile,
"And I... she brought me along. Because we're friends." you hastily said, noticing Celebi's attentive look.

The green giantess blinked several times.

"Bi bi bi." she said, oddly quiet given the situation, but her voice was quite cold.

"Ehm..."

"‘You're friends with a pokemon who had you in her mouth.’..." Weavile translated behind you, before adopting an offended expression,
"And yeah, that's true. We're friends."

Celebi finally looked at her, anger and confusion on her face.

"How do you two even know each other?" she asked, struggling to not jump to conclusions.

But it seemed odd that a predator snatched the human from her just because she wanted to be friends; such line of thinking was given particular emphasis by the fact that the human was in the Weavile's mouth.

Celebi frowned.

But then, why was the human trying to defend the Weavile? What if their version was true? Again, it seemed so improbable...

Celebi snapped out of her own mind to see that Weavile was blushing; she looked down at you, but avoided her gaze, having found an extremely interesting rock on the ground by the feet of the legendary.

The mythical pokemon looked back at the dark-type in front of her.

"Answer me." she demanded, but Weavile still didn't respond.

It was getting on Celebi's nerves, she was about to forget this and attack, when...

"Re-Remember when Zoroark knocked you out?" you suddenly asked, looking up and staring at the green giantess who was holding you.

Celebi looked confused. Of course she remembered that fiendish vixen that kidnapped her human, hurt her and Mew before she was unceremoniously sent somewhen back in time; Celebi didn't know for sure when she had sent her, but she didn't care.

All she had to know right now was if this new dark-type was going to suffer the same fate as the first or not.

You watched as Celebi nodded slowly, her gigantic head (which was several times your height) rising and falling, a small breeze caused by the movement blowing past you.

"Um... yeah. Ehm..." this was a delicate part of the story,
"You see, Weavile... uh... brought me away from Mew..." you admitted, looking down; almost immediately, your ears registered a loud gasp.

"Bi!"

"I was saving him!" Weavile hastily explained, holding her claws up as she attempted to justify herself,
"Your friend attacked me - what else should I have done? I didn't even notice him before he talked to me!"

"Mew attacked...?" Celebi repeated breathlessly.

That didn't seem like her friend. Mew never attacked unless she was in danger... or unless her friends were in danger.

"She attacked because you were bringing the human away!" she exclaimed.

"No! I... God, I was sleeping, okay? I didn't even realize he was with me!" Weavile explained and for a moment you remembered the cut on your arm, shivering lightly.

The part that followed was going to make Celebi really angry...

"When I realized I had him I... he told me he was being chased and..."
"... Mew lost her tracks," you continued while Weavile inhaled and exhaled deeply.
"... I kinda lied to her." you bluntly admitted, shivering; instead, for the briefest moment, Weavile snickered lowly, earning an irritated glares from your green protector.

You glared too.

"Yeah... and things got real nasty then... Weavile believed my lie... far too much, and tried to eat me for real..."

The moment those words left your lips, two things happened: Weavile's smirk faded and Celebi snarled, a long, murderous, high-pitched ‘Biiii!’ escaping her mouth.

Once again, Weavile held her claws up.

"H-Hey, I was delirious, I didn't eat or sleep in whole day! We... the human talked his way out and managed to convince me go got hunting instead," Weavile said without breathing between each word.

As a result, she had to pause to inhale deeply and for several times before being able to speak again,

"And that's when we re-encountered Mew," instinctively, the dark-type brought a paw to her cheek, feeling the skin under her fur prickling where Mew slapped her with her tail.

"... Who brought me back to you. Then, Weavile took me again," you finished.
"And here we are... talking about this. Seriously," you continued, despite the glare that had formed upon Celebi's face,
"Weavile wasn't trying to hurt me." this was the truth... okay, she may have TRIED to hurt you at first, but then decided against it.

And you discovered that, after having gotten used to her dark sarcasm, she was a good friend.

"That's... that's true," the still startled weasel agreed,
"I don't like... I don't like hunting... or killing. I would have never tried to eat the human if I wasn't that hungry, believe me." she continued in an apologetic manner, but you couldn't tell if she was apologizing to you or Celebi.

Probably to both.

Celebi listened to every word in silence, with a cold stare on her face.

And when neither you or Weavile added anything else to the concluded story, she acted.
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.title: An explanation

choices: Mew didn't notice you and left...
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.content:
A loud yawn erupted from your mouth as you tried to reply. You felt your eyelids heavy.

"Hey," you said, suddenly remembering the lack of sleep you were currently being subjected to,
"I'm kinda tired... I need to sleep."

Weavile's playful smile fell.

"What?!" she exclaimed,
"No! No no no, what do I do if you sleep?"

You sighed, knowing why she was acting like this: Weavile are predators of the night that sleep during the bright hours of the day.

"I know, but I need to sleep Weavile. Just a few hours... please?" you asked, causing the giantess to sign loudly.

"B-But... I'm still hungry! I need to hunt!" she complained. By some coincidence (or she could do it at will?), her stomach growled in that moment.
"See?... I have an idea!" she then chimed, drawing what little attention you managed to muster.

"Hm?"

"I can put you in my mouth and you could rest there while I hunt!" she suggested, causing you to go white as a sheet.

"Are you crazy?" you retorted,
"Even if I managed to sleep in there with all the moving around, I'd be swallowed with all the moving around!" you reasoned, the previous talk about an absolutely unwanted trip through her intestines emerging in your mind.

Weavile huffed, having nothing to counter your logic with.

"Fine." she resigned.
"I'll let you sleep. But you'll have to match your times with mine."

"Eventually... and only until we find out how to grow me back up." you clarified, making the dark-furred giantess snicker.

"That might take years, you know," she said as she started walking with you held in a claw.

You shivered at the perspective.

"... Let's just hope not."

For the rest of the trip to a small cave you recognized, you and Weavile were silent.

The giantess placed you on the stone floor, before laying down beside you, claws stretched above her head.

"Happy now? I could be eating right now, y'know..." she pointed out, causing you to smirk.

"Correction: you would be killing right now. You want that?"

Weavile huffed.

"Point taken." she admitted as you too laid down on the stone floor; maybe it was because you had gotten used to sleeping on Celebi pretty quick or because you were laying on stone, but the ground felt really uncomfortable.

You sighed.

"What?" Weavile asked instantly.

"I'm not used to sleep on the ground..." you explained.

The giant dark-type snickered.

"Hey, if you're uncomfortable, you can come laying against me. After all, we'll be sticking together for quite a while..." she said.

"Are you serious? You'd crush me in your sleep!"

Another snicker.

"Well... there's always the alternative..."

Twenty minutes and an awkward discussion later, you discovered that, despite her being an ice-type, Weavile's belly could be a really soft and warm bed; the fur didn't even surround you completely, but it still worked as a wonderful blanket. And, luckily, her claws were at a safety distance from you.

That was your last thought before you slid into a deep slumber, with the immense blush slowly fading from your face.

Noticing that you finally fell asleep, the giantess you were resting on snickered.

"Good night, then. See ya in the morning..."

--

"BIIIIIIIIIII!"

The scream echoed around in the forest for a while, waking up several pokemon... and you.

Your head and upper body hastily sped upwards as you sat up, startled.

The first thing you noticed was that the cave was now enlightened by sunlight.

It must have been morning, you judged.

Also, you noticed that you were still laying not on Celebi, but on the Weavile you met yesterday.

So, you thought to yourself, that wasn't a dream.

She was really going to help you regaining your size!

Yawning, you walked to the edge of her belly and looked down: not too much of a fall, but it was still high enough to break both your legs if you were stupid enough to jump.

And you definitely weren't.

Carefully, grabbing the strands of the thin, black fur you started climbing down to the floor of the cavern.

Weavile was probably going to sleep until the sun set, you thought, unless you woke her up... in which case she probably wasn't going to be too pleased.

You sat down beside the sleeping giantess and sighed, while your stomach growled, asking to be filled. Hopefully with something different from berries of any size and shape.

"BIII!"

You instinctively looked down, taking several moments to realize that it wasn't a particularly loud growl of your stomach that resounded in the whole forest.

You did have a clue of what it was, but you hoped that it wasn't her.

Slowly, you walked towards the entrance of the cave and peeked out, right in time to see each green blur flying past the cavern at supersonic speed before stopping nearby.

Celebi looked heartbroken as she lowered herself to ground level, scanning each inch of the ground with tears rolling down her cheeks.

The sight alone made you feel guilty.

You exactly knew that the legendary was searching for you: you imagined her waking up expecting to find you still cuddled to her, looking around when she noted that you weren't; and when she finally figured out that you were missing...

"Mew mew!"

Hidden behind a corner, you noted a pink pokemon coming into view as well.

Mew didn't look as desperate as her friend did, but had a look of determination on her face.

"Mew!" she spoke, causing Celebi's face to drop onto the hard floor as she cried.

Now you felt even more guilty.

Even when both had eaten you, they treated you with kindness; and now, you were running away from them, causing both legendaries to worry while also causing Celebi, who had proclaimed her love for you, to be heartbroken.

Maybe you should have just-

No.

You shook your head to rid it of such line of thinking; you weren't sure where that even came from.

Getting your size back was more important than anything else right now, and if sticking to Weavile meant that you were going to stop being a snack to every pokemon you met, you were going to stay with her.

Sadly, your perfect schemes were ruined as Mew suddenly looked away from her crying friend to look at the cavern you were currently hiding in.

"Mew..." she muttered as she hovered towards it.

A chill traveled down your spine as you disappeared behind the corner, pressing yourself against the stone wall, hoping it could just swallow you and spit you out when Mew realized that you weren't there.

The pink giantess floated inside the cave, not noticing you right under her nose. The corner provided you with a little bit of shade, but any more accurate exam would have blown your cover.

Mew began inspecting around the cave, when she noticed the sleeping Weavile.

For a moment, Mew stood still: yesterday, the human was kidnapped by a Weavile, and was brought in the same cave!

It couldn't be a coincidence.

The first thought Mew had was that the human was eaten; but then, she remembered his words, ‘She was actually very nice to me’.

Was the human in the cave? Maybe hiding from the Weavile herself?

She discarded the possibility, but kept it in mind: after all, it was still a possibility.

Mew inspected the area around the sleeping pokemon, then proceeded to examine the entire cave.

You watched her, backing up against the wall even more.

Once she was done examining the whole cave, Mew looked at the sleeping Weavile again, remembering that time when she had knocked her out with her tail.

She felt vaguely guilty, had the Weavile been sleeping since she left her in the same came she was in now?

She shook her head; if the Weavile really wanted to eat the human, he wouldn't have told her to save the weasel.

Resigned, Mew was about to leave the cave empty-handed, when a particularly interesting corner drew her attention: she was sure she had seen something moving.

Your heart, and whole being, stood completely still as you felt Mew's gaze on you.

Did she notice you? It seemed like it, judging by the way she was narrowing her eyes, trying to see better.
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.title: Forest panic

choices: "I'm sorry... but you have to come with me. We need you." Mew said firmly
"If... If that's really what you wish..." Mew said brokenly
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.content:
Despite your very tiny body, the shadow the corner offered was too thin to offer a full protection from sight.

As she spotted a very familiar tiny human hiding there, Mew's eyes widened.

‘Human?’

The voice rang in your head for a second, before you found yourself being gripped by something invisible; before you could process that you were discovered, you were drawn out of your hiding spot by Mew's Psychic and went flying straight into her stubby pink paws.

Six tiny fingers the size your upper body wrapped around you as the floating pink giantess smiled in relief.

‘We thought we lost you!’ she telepathically said, and you suddenly found yourself shoved forward, right into the soft chest of Mew.

‘We thought that you were eaten by someone, or worse! But you were here all the time!... With...’ Mew trailed off to glance at the sleeping Weavile, then back at you, recalling an exhausted herself hearing from the human's mouth that the dark-type was nice to him.

"Ehm… Mew?" you whispered, trying to pull back.

The giantess shot you a dejected look.

‘Did you... come here by yourself?’ she asked, uncertain.

"Wh- no! Weavile..." you shut your mouth before you could formulate your sentence, wanting to avoid the ice-type any more troubles; ‘Little late for that.’ your mind mentioned, but you were too focused on Mew to listen to it.

The sapphire-eyed giantess seemed to have caught the gist of what you were about to say, you judged by the way she glared at the snoring pokemon.

‘She brought you here, right? She took you again,’ her voice sounded gentle, but firm.

No point denying it, you thought.

"Yeah..." you however had a point in preventing Weavile's death before it happened,
"B-B-But she didn't hurt me! She was nice like I told, remember? We're friends Mew!" you hastily explained, earning a second look from Mew.

She stared at you for an eternal minute, in which the only sound that could be heard was the crying of the green legendary just out of this cave.

But then, Mew spoke in your mind again,

‘... But then, why were you hiding?’ she mused.

You felt a lump in your throat and couldn't immediately respond.

Could you really tell this? How would have Mew reacted?... How would have Celebi reacted if Mew told her, which was a sure thing?

"I-I... h-huh?" you feigned confusion.

‘Please do answer me.’

You sighed.

"I... was hiding from you, Mew..." you admitted as a look of true confusion painted itself on Mew's face.

You looked up and began explaining,

"... Weavile took me, alright; she thought I was in danger or something, I don't know, but she wanted to ‘save’ me, because we're friends..."

Mew seemed even more confused.

‘I-In danger? With us? That's ridic-’

"I know," you interrupted,
"But Weavile also wanted to help me, alright? With my size, I mean," you added as you noticed the curious expression Mew adopted.

Another, deep sigh escaped your mouth.

"I hate this size Mew, I really do. I hate being helpless, I hate being at everyone's mercy, I hate being food!" it was a miracle if Weavile didn't wake up or Celebi didn't come to check the cave as well by the way you were shouting now.

Mew looked at you pitifully, and her grip tightened around you.

‘... Let's go.’ she mentally said, her voice silky smooth in your head.

A small giggle escaped the giantess as she began hovering towards the outside of the cave.

‘There's someone who really wants to see you...’ she said cheerfully;

You, however, were all but cheerful right now.

"Wait, Mew!" you exclaimed, causing the legendary to stop to look at you again.
"I... I don't want to come Mew. I want my size back, I told you!"

Mew looked taken aback. A look of sadness replaced the cheerful one.

‘Y-You want to stay here...?’ she asked, dumbfounded,
‘B-But... Celebi...’

"Tell her you didn't find me." you said, before looking at the giantess pleadingly.

"Please Mew. It's not like I don't like you or anything, no, you're a wonderful friend... and Celebi too, but I really want my size back... maybe I can come find you when I'm big again! But for now... please..."

The pink giantess stared at you without talking for several minutes, unable to believe that her tiny human friend was there, pleading her to let him go with some random, dangerous pokemon.

Weren't you realizing that you could have died at any moment with the the Weavile?

And what about Celebi? She was going to be heartbroken for good.

Did she really have the heart to let you take such risk, to shatter the heart of her friend?

No, she didn't.

But when she pointed those sapphire eyes on you, ready to explain you why she had to take you away, you looked at her with pleading eyes.

"Please Mew... it's... I can't live like this, I'm sick of it." you said, and Mew felt a knot around her heart.

The human wasn't happy.

But then, what did she have to do?

Mew felt conflicted.
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.title: Two friends for one?

choices: Mew decided to tell Celebi the truth. Who knew, she might take it well...
Mew decided to keep quiet, you didn't need any more troubles
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.content:
Mew adopted a sorrowful stare as she regarded your tiny body firmly held in her paw.

‘I'm sorry,’ she mentally stated,
‘But I can't let you go. Celebi needs you... and I do too. We're friends too, remember? I can't just leave you here knowing that you're in constant danger! What kind of friend does that?’

"You remind me of someone..." you mumbled as your face contorted into a pleading expression.

"Please Mew... just let me go, if you really care about me..." you tried once more, feeling like it was going to be useless. If the giant legendary had made up her mind, there was little you could do to convince her to change it.

In fact, Mew shot an even sadder stare,

‘It's because I care about you that I cannot let you go, you understand me?’ she said.

The paw holding you rose up to her face, the other joined it as the pink giantess pulled you in an embrace to her cheek.

‘I... I like you a lot, human. And Celebi's got an even deeper feeling. I... I simply can't. Forgive me.’

You pulled back a bit, adopting a serious look while in reality you felt the need to cry.

"Mew, you've been a truly wonderful friend so far. I can forgive you alright, I do forgive you, but know that I won't forget this." you simply said.

Mew pulled back, holding you onto her cupped palms. Her gigantic her moved up and down as she nodded, her eyes sparkling with repressed tears.

‘Neither will I.’ she replied as she began hovering to the exit of the cave while pushing you back to the familiar place of her furry chest.

"Oh, one thing though: let's not tell Celebi."

The giantess stopped upon hearing your words and looked at you.

‘... Why? I think we SHOULD tell her...’ she said, but you shook your head.

"We'd break her heart, and she'd break my back if she knew all of this. Do you want any of that?" you said, eerily quiet while on such line of thinking.

Mew pondered your suggestion for a second, but hovered out of the cavern to face a certain green fairy, who was crying face-down on the forest floor.

"Celebi..." she called, causing her friend to perk up.

You felt a lump in your throat as you were invaded by a strong sense of guilt: the time-traveler had completely red eyes, probably from the crying she had been doing, more tears rolling down her cheeks and falling into what was a lake of tears to you.

But Celebi's reddened eyes immediately fell on you.

You made eye contact, adopting a dejected expression as Celebi stared at you.

But it was just for a few seconds, before the green giantess got up and shakily flew in mid-air, before slowly levitating towards Mew; the pink legendary released you from her embrace and gingerly extended her paws forward to let her green friend take you in hers.

You were immediately embraced again though as the giantess that currently held you sobbed.

"Wh-Where w-were y-you...!?" she exclaimed,
"I-I th-thought someone a-ate you!"

You couldn't understand her, but that did nothing to alleviate your guilt.

"I'm sorry..." you muttered, feeling like it was the right thing to say while you simply rested against the green wall that was the fairy's chest; her heart was beating like a drum played by a madman, it was totally erratic.

And this all for you being gone. You wondered how she would have reacted if you were actually dead...

Celebi slowly broke the hug to lower her face to your position - or were her paws raising? - so you soon found yourself in front of the twin, reddened lakes that were her eyes.

"... Why did you run away?" she asked you, though she knew she wasn't going to get any answer unless Mew stepped in.

Which she did.

"He did-" she trailed off, remembering what you told her, but Celebi looked at her.

"What?" the fairy asked, hovering closer to her friend.

Mew avoided her gaze.

"Mew, if you know why the human was here instead of being with us, tell me... please..." Celebi begged, instinctively embracing you again.

Mew finally met Celebi's gaze with a long sigh and a hidden, painful expression.
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.title: Unwilling reunion

choices: Celebi remained asleep, allowing Weavile to take you again
Celebi remained asleep... but Mew suddenly woke up...
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.content:
Mew mustered the courage to look at Celebi in the eye; however, the time-traveler's tearful gaze was enough to strike sadness into her.

The two were friends, Mew was supposed to tell Celebi what the human wanted, for his own good too. If he wanted to leave so badly, Celebi could agree... right?

Mew began having second thoughts.

What if Celebi didn't take it well at all? What if she-

Mew shook off dreadful thoughts of your dead body before hurrying to answer,

"I... I don't know..." she lied in a convincingly resigned tone,
"I can't think of why he would want to leave."

Celebi looked skeptical for a second, before her gaze fell on you, who were still held in her paws.

"Why did you leave, human?" she asked, trying to adopt a firm voice.

Despite Celebi's shaky tone, you felt intimidated. You would have really loved to answer to whatever question she asked you, but there was that annoying language barrier that kept you from understanding the giant time-traveler.

Luckily, Mew was there to offer proper translation,

‘She asked why you left... come up with something, quick!’ she mentally encouraged you, causing you to feel flabbergasted.

Mew was covering you? Yet another example of how much of a good friend she was to you, you mused as you shot her a feeble smile. Which you dropped as you turned back to Celebi.

"You asked why I left?" you repeated the question you were made.

Celebi nodded while she stared at you intently.

"I-I..." you trailed off.

What could you tell this legendary to avoid further suspicion?

Your hesitation didn't escape the green legendary, who muttered something incomprehensible as she rose her arms a bit, lifting you right in front of those blue oceans that were her eyes.

‘Tell the truth, please,’ Mew's voice spoke in your head.

Once again, you turned back to the pink legendary with a surprised expression.

Didn't she just say-

‘That's what Celebi said,’ she clarified, offering an unreadable smile, causing you to sigh in relief.

Mew was still on your side, you were safe... if you could think of something smart to say quickly.

But what?

...

Finally, something sprang up in your mind, causing your expression to brighten for a second, before you adopted a more ashamed look as you turned to face the expectant Celebi.

"I-I..." you stuttered in a convincingly sorrowful tone,
"I didn't leave!"

The statement took the giantess aback - what?

"Bi?" she asked. She and Mew found you at kilometers from were you previously were, how was that not leaving?

"Y'see, I was... I was thirsty..." you hastily explained, following what your brain told you,
"I went to search for some water, but I kinda met a hungry pokemon... I had to hide, do you understand? That's why I was in there," you clarified while pointing back to the cave,
"I... I'm sorry..."

Celebi blinked, while your heart began beating faster as you mentally cursed yourself.

What mistake have you made!

If Celebi decided to check the cave and found Weavile, you'd be doomed!

You mustered the courage to look at the fairy in the eye, noting that she was staring at you skeptically.

The time-traveler glanced back at Mew, feeling like she knew more about this than she showed.

The human's story looked clean, however...

Meeting Celebi's gaze, Mew offered a shrug,

"Seems plausible..." she said with relief while mentally praising her little human friend,
"He was lucky he managed to hide..."

The statement marked the end of Celebi's suspicion as worry seeped in her.

With a sigh, the time-traveler embraced you again.

"Next time just ask me," she said with a mix of exasperation and sadness,
"You shouldn't wander around alone."

You felt relieved as you heard the green giantess speaking in a much calmer tone. You weren't sure if she was scolding or praising you, and you didn't care one bit.

By pure luck, Celebi hadn't checked the cavern, that's what mattered.

The look on the green legendary's face made you feel slightly guilty, but you couldn't help it.

You really wanted your size back, and if Celebi meant to stop you from regaining it, then she was an obstacle.

You couldn't let her stop you.

For today though, you had to stay with Celebi and Mew again. It was fine.

You just had to wait until nighttime...

--

After your morning ‘adventure’ with the two legendaries and their return to the shrine, the day went on quietly.

You felt like you were under surveillance; Celebi kept you glued to her and didn't let go of you one moment, not even when she and Mew ate.

After what seemed an eternity of just watching the two giantesses doing nothing particularly amusing, sunlight finally faded, letting moonlight replace it.

After a quick meal of berries, your two legendary guardians declared their intention to hit the hay.

"Please... don't leave without me knowing again," Celebi incomprehensibly said while she laid down, enclosing you in a hug.

"Yeah... you too Celebi..." you muttered, only able to guess what she said.

Mew giggled, before she shot you a pleading look.

You met her gaze,

"What?" you asked.

The pink legendary turned away for a moment, before she looked back at you,

‘... Please, don't leave again.’ she literally begged, causing you to smile.

"... Whatever." you replied, knowing it was a lie.

It broke your heart to do so, but you had to.

Mew nodded slightly as she emulated Celebi and laid down, wrapping her tail around her belly.

You just laid there on top of Celebi, hearing - and feeling - the two pokemon snoring soon enough.

Only then you dared to sigh.

Now you only had to wait...

--

You must have fallen asleep at some point, because you were awakened by a voice calling for you in a whisper.

You opened your eyes, finding a very familiar Weavile standing beside Celebi with an upset glare.

"Oh," you yawned,
"Hey..."

"Dude, what gives!?" Weavile hissed while throwing her claws forward in indignation,

"Relax. They-" you glanced at you green ‘bed’ and her pink friend,
"... They found me. I covered you."

That was a lie, you mused, but you weren't sure how Weavile would take it if she knew Mew was aware of what she had done last night.

Weavile sighed.

"And I thought-" she interrupted herself as she shook her head.

"... How did you know I was back here?" you inquired.

The dark-type shrugged, but shut up as Celebi began muttering something in her sleep.

Only when the incomprehensible flow of words ceased and the snoring resumed, Weavile spoke,

"I guessed." she said, before looking away for a second, a pink shade crossing her cheeks,
"Or better, I hoped you were here. I thought someone came in the cave and ate you!"

The declaration made you shiver. You've already had your fair share of being in a stomach, and you definitely didn't want to experience it again.

The whole thing was traumatizing.

To delete such line of thinking from your mind, you focused on on your dark-type friend again.

"... So? Here to ‘save’ me again?" you asked.

Weavile gave a small grin.

"Of course!" she whispered,
"Just stay still for a moment..." she said, her grin fading as she began lowering herself towards Celebi, ready to snatch you out from under her paws...
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.title: Separated from Weavile

choices: Weavile hastily jumps behind a bush as Celebi comes by...
Too late! Celebi notices her jumping and approaches!
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.content:
Celebi was sleeping quietly at the feet of her shrine. The patroness of the forest was having good dreams - somehow, the presence of the human improved those as well!

Sadly, the fairy's dream suddenly changes into a nightmare. About the pokemon who was more than a fiend.

Zoroark.

Zoroark... the human... blood rivering from a body bitten in half...

With a gasp, Celebi wakes up, realizing that she was just dreaming.

The fairy shakes her head to rid it of the nightmare before looking up.

"Human...?" she mumbles as her gaze falls upon her chest.

The human is gone.

"B-Bi...?" Celebi stutters as her mind starts racing, while her heart starts beating faster.

Quietly, the legendary looks around. Maybe... she just rolled on her side while she slept and the human must've fell off...

She looks around, but all she manages to spot is the sleeping Mew.

"Mew..." Celebi quietly says, pondering if she should wake Mew up and get her help to find the human or if she should just let her sleep.

After all, Mew was a heavy sleeper...

Deciding that she shouldn't lose time trying to wake Mew up, Celebi slowly gets up. Her feet lift off the ground as she hovers in midair, before slowly starting to venture into the dark depths of Ilex Forest. The human couldn't have gotten too far...

With the darkness, along with the human's size, she had to look carefully in every spot to find him. So she lowers herself to ground level as she proceeds, scanning each inch of the grassy forest.

While doing so, Celebi tries to think of the reasons that might've made him leave her in the middle of the night.

A horrible thought finds its way inside her mind.

"What if... what if her ran off...? He ran off because I ate him yesterday..." she mumbles to herself, starting to tear up.
"Or maybe... some pokemon took him and ate him..."

Celebi was starting to feel heartbroken.

But she quickly shakes the thoughts off, deciding instead that the human must have been thirsty or something. It sounded like a reasonable explanation...

"Please cutie... just be okay... I'm coming..." she whispers to herself as she continues her quest.

--

"Come on!" Weavile complains upon hearing your suggestion.
"What do I do if you sleep?"

"I dunno, but I need to sleep Weavile." you bluntly reply.

She huffs.
"Look." you say.
"I get it: nocturnal predator. But I am not! I spend the night sleeping!"

Weavile sighs.
"You'll have to match your times with mine..." she mumbles to herself, before signing as she sits down.
"But... fine I guess... I'll give you a few ho-" she stops in mid sentence as a cry echoes through the quiet forest.

"Biii...?"

The color leaves your face as Weavile's eyes widen.

"Celebi..." you mumble. Weavile nods, jumping to her feet, shaking your world.
"Yup. And she's searching for you, ‘Human...?’..." she repeats while fidgeting nervously, hastily looking around to find somewhere to hide.

Meanwhile, the cries of Celebi grow louder as she gets closer.

"Hide!" you exclaim while looking at Weavile, who stares down at you nervously.

"I'm trying to!" she hisses.
"She'll look around - I have to find an appropriate spot..."

"Hurry up then..." you respond as another incomprehensible cry echoes.

--

Celebi was proceeding rather slowly as she had to carefully scan the ground.

The human climbing a tree sounded improbable, and hiding... why would he hide from her anyway?

...

Maybe... he was hiding from some predator...?

Celebi gulps, starting to check the nearby bushes while regretting not doing it before.

Was her human around? Or was he not? And if he was around, why didn't he respond to her? The voice of the patroness should have been enough to scare off any predator... Although her human couldn't understand her, he would surely recognize her and approach once he was free to do so, no?

Celebi keeps searching the ground and plants, carefully examining bushes and the roots of trees.

But, the more she searched, the more grew the idea that her human was either eaten, or he left her because of what she did or he was hiding from some predator.

"Please be okay..." Celebi mumbles to herself, starting to feel tears in her eyes as she moves on.

--

Another cry. Another step back from Weavile. Another pound from your heart.

"She's... She's approaching..." Weavile gulps while desperately looking around to find some hiding spot.

"Hurry..." you mumble again.

Finally, as a very familiar pokemon starts to come out from a few bushes, Weavile seems to find a hiding place...
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.title: Celebi's nighttime quest

choices: You slip your way past Celebi and return to the shrine...
Celebi causally looks down and spots you...
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.content:
Hastily, the dark giantess holding you leaps behind a few bushes. A quite predictable hiding spot, you figure, but it's better than nothing.

Unfortunately, the sudden movement didn't escape the patroness of the forest, who was just coming in the area.

"Bi...?" she called out as she approached the bushes, hoping to find her little human behind them.

"Damn..." Weavile mumbles in fear trough gritted teeth.
"She noticed me..."

You place a hand over your mouth in order to keep yourself from saying horrible words of human vocabulary.

From the other side of the bushes, Celebi talks,
"Human...?" she calls, though you can't understand her.

She figures that just reveal herself might scare her precious little one, so she decides to let him walk out himself... if it was him behind the bushes anyway.

"It's just me - Celebi! Come on out..." she says encouragingly as she floats back a bit, hoping to see the tiny silhouette of the human walking out of the bush.

However, nothing happened, and silence descends in the area.

"What do we do...?" Weavile whispers as she holds you close to her chest. You could literally hear her heart beating unnaturally fast.

"I don't know..." you whisper, defeated.

Celebi is going to find you with Weavile.

Celebi won't be pleased.

Celebi is most probably going to eat you again...

...

Unless...

"I think I've got it..." you mumble to a terrorized Weavile.
"She was calling for me before, right?" you ask.

Weavile nods.

"Okay, if I am right, she's giving me the chance to walk out. But, not seeing me doing so, she'll check the bush - there's nothing we can do about it..." you say.

Weavile gives you a dejected stare.

"But," you continue.
"I suggest we split up... for now at least. I'll try to slip past Celebi and get back to the shrine. That way, she'll only find you in here, and you'll tell her you're hunting."

Weavile nods silently.

"Come on sweetie... It's just me..." Celebi's voice comes from outside, and you detect the impatience in it.

It won't be long before she checks inside this bush...

"... What about you?" Weavile asks.
"She won't be exactly pleased with you... I mean, you left her in the middle of the night?"

You sigh.
"I'll tell her I was thirsty or something." you reply.
"And you come pick me up later on."

Weavile stares at you in silence for a moment, before nodding.

"Okay. Now put me down." you instruct.

She does as told and gently places you on the soft grass.
"Be careful..." she whispers as you slowly start to move to another bush.

Just then, the leaves of the bush part.

Celebi peers inside.

--

Weavile stares with fear at the green fairy in front of her.

That was literally the most powerful pokemon in the forest, the deity of it.

You briefly stop to hide behind a leaf as you glance at the two giantesses, who stare at each other in silence for a minute.

Before Celebi gives a dejected sigh.

"A Weavile..." she mumbles, before looking at the dark type dejectedly.
"What are you doing in here...?" she simply had to ask.

Weavile gulps.
"I'm... I'm hunting..." she mumbles, following the plan.

You take your chances; Celebi is distracted, so you walk out of the bush and start walking in direction of the shrine, hoping to not catch the fairy's attention.

However, much to your terror, the green giantess suddenly floats over you, crafting a huge shadow onto you.

You cower, waiting for one of her three-fingered paws to come down on you and end this charade... but, you discover, Celebi didn't notice you.

In fact, she's still gazing at Weavile.

"May... May I know if you perhaps saw - or ate - a tiny human?" she asks with growing worry.

Weavile's heart skips a beat.

"A tiny human...?" she asks with a convincingly surprised voice.
"... I've done none of those things..." she replies.

Celebi sighs in dejection as you tiptoe beneath her, trying to get away unnoticed.

"I lost him..." the fairy sadly mumbles.

You desperately hope she doesn't look down.
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.title: Temporary separation

choices: The Weavile returns again during the night...
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.content:
Celebi luckily kept gazing forward as she kept talking to Weavile.

Relieved, you started moving again, hoping that the intimidating legendary hovering above you didn't look down.

Soon enough, you were out of Celebi's shadow and glanced back at the towering fairy - you felt oddly guilty. Celebi looked absolutely tired and desperate, most probably because she was searching for you and couldn't find you anywhere, not knowing that you were actually under her metaphorical nose. As for Weavile, she was playing her part well as she answered to Celebi's questions... although you could detect the nervousness in her voice...

You shook your head - this wasn't any good time for guilt or second thoughts. You had to get back to the shrine.

You started moving again. Soon, Weavile and the legendary disappeared from your sight as you walked past a few plants and looked forward to see the forest... the big, dark, dangerous forest which was full of predators...

The mere thought of it made you feel sick as you considered turning back and throwing yourself straight into the arms of the giantess seeking for you.

But it was too late now - Celebi would piece it together... and she wouldn't be exactly happy to find you alone with a predator... and telling that Weavile was a friend would be a mistake - what Celebi would think if she discovered you in the middle of the night, alone with another female pokemon that claimed to be your friend?

You shivered. Facing the forest's dangers or facing the wrath of a jealous legendary?

You had more chances in the forest...

So you bit the bullet and started running through the dark forest.

If you were normal-sized, you would have gotten lost for sure; at your current size, Ilex Forest was an endless maze of green, darkness and dangers full of predators.

And you didn't get very far, you discovered when you heard the voices of the two giantesses you left behind, still talking to each other. Then, you heard a desperate cry and the sound of leaves shaking... Celebi was moving again! You had to get back to the shrine before she did...

You sighed as you jumped behind a bush, opting for a safer route - running out in the open would make as much sense as inviting the nocturnal predators of the forest to eat you...

Soon, you had to stop to catch your breath.

But you didn't have any time to do so, you discovered when the ground started trembling, the vibrations causing you to lose your balance and fall on your butt.

The tremors stopped.

Your mind screamed you to stay still and wait for whatever was out there to get lost before starting to move again... but curiosity was too strong.

You got back on your feet as you peered from the bush you were hiding in.

You paled.

It was a gigantic, bipedal bear.

An Ursaring.

You tried to ignore its sharp claws, the sharp fangs exposed from its open mouth and the absolutely terrifying expression on its face.

You had to make a mental struggle to not run off in fear.

But you soon regretted not doing so as the Ursaring started smelling the air, probably having picked on a foreign scent... you! It smelt you!

You watched in fear as the huge bear started looking around, trying to locate you. And your heart started galloping within your chest as the Ursaring turned its head to look straight down at you.

You felt sick as you closed your eyes, waiting for a claw to grab you, throw you inside of the Ursaring's mouth and end your torment. Just when you were so close to finding help getting back to your original size...

However, fate decided to lend a hand... almost as if it realized how cruel it has been to you so far and was trying to make it up.

The Ursaring turned its head away as it started walking off, not having seen you in darkness.

Only when the large bear was fully gone, you dared to sigh in relief, feeling like your legs were melting as you fell out of your hiding spot, hitting the ground with your knees. Your heart was racing, beating like a drum. You were quite certain that, against any logic, it was going to break out of your ribcage and pop out from your chest.

But, at least you were sa-

Pressure.

Two large paws grabbed you by your sides and lifted you off the ground. Startled, you looked up... but your vision got eclipsed by a pair of equally large lips, which made contact with part of your face, smooching you. Your limbs went limp.

This was-

You were briefly pulled back, before being shoved in a wide, smooth surface and being rubbed up and down against it.

"Bi!" Celebi chimed happily as she nuzzled you.

She had finally found her precious little human.

Your breath cut short by the affectionate fairy, you shove both your hands on the fairy's cheek and pushed yourself back.

Immediately, you noticed her blue eyes staring straight at you. Next thing you noted was her expression - she didn't look pleased at all.

"Bi?!" she cried, almost deafening you and causing a lingering pain in your ears.

Even to you, her first question was clear.

"Ehm Celebi... y'see, I was..." you paused to gulp. You didn't know if it was the fear you felt earlier - and that you're currently feeling - or the exhaustive run you made... but your throat was practically dry. But that gave you the perfect excuse.

"... Thirsty." you said.

The giant fairy looked at you, skeptical.

She wanted to believe you... but it didn't make any sense. Why risk your life in a forest full of dangers, in the middle of the night, for some water? When you could simply have woken her up?

"... Why are you looking at me like that? I didn't even drink - I got lost..." you lied, before looking to the side.
"... Thanks."

The fairy sighed, convinced.

"Wake me up the next time, silly," she incomprehensibly said, before smiling a bit.
"As for your drink..." she mumbled, starting to fly somewhere.

You briefly wondered where the fairy was headed.

But you were soon answered as she flew past a few trees and stopped in front of a small lake you recognize, having already seen and bathed in it earlier.

Celebi flew above the water and gently started lowering her paws, which were clasped around your stomach. Celebi was holding you so you could drink safely without falling into the water.

"... Thank you, Celebi." you said, before turning your attention to the water, seeing your reflection... and the one of the giant fairy holding you. She was looking expectantly...

You HAD to drink after all...

Slowly, you took a few sips, the water sliding down your throat and into your stomach.

You drank until your thirst was quenched, before raising your head from the water, small drops of the liquid falling from your lips and back into the lake.

"I'm done."

Immediately, you were pulled backwards as Celebi stood up in midair and smiled at you.

"Thanks." you mumbled.

The fairy leaned closer to peck you... before opening her mouth wide as a wave of humid, berry-smelling air blew past you.

She just impolitely yawned in your face.

You groaned, while the giantess giggled.
"Sorry!" she said cheerfully, pecking you like she originally intended.
"And now, back to sleep..." she drowsily added as she started hovering away from the lake.

--

Either she had a phenomenal sense of orientation or she knew the forest like her wings, because Celebi got back to the shrine in less than five minutes.

A pink figure was sleeping at the foot of it, tail coiled around her waist.

Mew sure slept heavily, you thought.

Celebi quickly laid beside her friend, pulling you in a hug. Her lips briefly landed on your head.

"Good night, cutie..." she said with a yawn, hugging you tightly.

You sighed, but yawned too, recalling the argument with Weavile about spending the dark hours...

Thinking about her, you figure you should really catch some sleep before she gets back to pick you up...

So, you close your eyes, letting darkness take you as you slide into sleep...
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.title: Green, dark and dangerous

choices: The fairy simply yawned and proceeded to wake Mew up as well...
The fairy smirked at you, spreading her legs in the meantime...
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.content:
From her perch on top of a high tree branch, Weavile looked down into the clearing where the famous shrine of Ilex Forest was. There, she saw them: the patroness of the forest Celebi, one of the most powerful legendaries, Mew, that had her knocked out without even using her powers - it still stung where her tail slapped her - and, sleeping on Celebi's chest, the tiny human she befriended earlier.

The human. It was for him she came back.

The huntress sighed - there was no way of getting him back now. Him and Mew were asleep, but Celebi had her eyes half open, her left paw caressing the small creature.

Apparently, she loved him... Weavile looked at the scene in silence, taking it as a confirm to the human's words.

Vibrations in her ears - any predator worthy of that name has to be equipped with a good hearing.

Celebi yawned, her paws clasping around the human and her eyes closing. Weavile sighed - she had to wait for the green legendary to be in a state of deep sleep before getting the human. It wasn't a problem - a hunter also needs to be patient and wait for its prey. Such process can go on for hours.

Weavile snickered.

The human had his taste of hunting... and she had her taste of him: he was inside of her mouth throughout the whole thing and Weavile ended up attacking Mew, too hungry to think straight...

Obviously, that ended quite poorly.

She looked down again, Celebi seemed to be asleep now... she gulped. She hated that part - the human had almost screamed when she did this for the first time...

She prepared to climb down... but gave a yawn, before hastily covering her mouth with a claw.

Then, a new light shined.

Weavile looked around, choking back a groan. The sun was starting to rise over the horizon.

The huntress sighed. She had no choice but to retreat now - nocturnal predators didn't like sunlight too much. So, she decided to relent for now... it'd be harder to grab the human with the sun bothering her anyway.
