"Please..." she said one last time, but it was useless.

You had no intention of coming out, and you couldn't understand what Celebi was saying anyway. You could only assume that she was apologizing or something, but you didn't care.

She was a wild card, and you couldn't risk your own life sticking with her.

But then, a second voice spoke,

"Mew mew?"

Mew bad woken up, apparently.

"Bi!" Celebi responded.

--

"The human is hiding in that hole?" Mew repeated, confused.
"Why?"

She had woken up, only to find Celebi kneeling in front of a tree, shouting worried words. She had approached her... and now, Celebi told her that the human was hiding.

Celebi blushed.

She couldn't tell Mew about her ‘game’...

Instead, she opted to lie.

"Y'see... I only wanted to taste him again... I-I put him in my mouth... he got scared and-" she interrupted herself.

Mew was wearing a stern look.

"You shouldn't have done that Celebi..." she scolded with an unusual frown, before it changed into a concerned expression.
"... But I can talk to the human..."

Celebi moved aside to let Mew lay belly-down on the ground, next to the hole.

‘Human?’

A telepathic assault made you perk up. Mew was talking to you.

"Mew..." you whispered.

‘Listen... whatever happened between you and Celebi, can't we just talk about it? Come out, please, I promise nothing will happen to you.’

She was speaking in a concerned voice.

Before you had a chance to respond, something pink and long slid inside the hole... you recognized it as Mew's tail.

With her around, it'd be easier to handle Celebi... but you were still very afraid of even seeing the fairy.

But Mew... wanted to help you... and you certainly couldn't remain in here forever...
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.title: Feared fairy

choices: "I c-can't Mew... C-Celebi wanted to eat me..." you stammered in response
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.content:
"Damn it..." you mumbled as you stepped forward, placing both your hands on Mew's tail, your fingers gripping it.

Feeling your hands gripping her tail, Mew pulled it out of the hole, you along with it. The pink giantess smiled and brought her tail to her paws, holding her tiny palms beneath you.

You sighed as you let go of the tail, falling on Mew's pink paws.

"Bii..."

You didn't have any time to turn around upon hearing this cry, because two strong, green paws grabbed a hold of you.

Your back was pressed against a smooth, warm wall.

Needless to say, you started struggling to get out from Celebi's hug.

The fairy tried to keep you still, but the more she tightened her hug, the more your struggled.

Until, like bar of soap, you managed to slip out of her grip and fell down.

Only to be almost immediately caught by a psychic force.

"Ehm... maybe it's better if I hold him for a while Celebi..." you heard Mew muttering, although you couldn't understand her when she didn't use telepathy.

"Fine..." Celebi replied dejectedly as she watched you flying up in Mew's paw.

The legendary fairy shot a sorrowful look.

"Human... cutie... I'm sorry for what happened..." she started.

You ignored her, mostly because you couldn't understand what she said, but also because you had no intention of talking to the unpredictable patroness of Ilex Forest.

"Please..." Celebi tried once more.

She leaned forward, intending to kiss you, but the mere sight of her mouth approaching made you shiver as you backed up in Mew's paws.

Celebi pulled back, looking at you with pity and sorrow.

"I-I... I-I'm sorry..." she whispered brokenly.

Mew sighed.

"I'll talk to him," she muttered dejectedly, hating every second of this situation.

Celebi couldn't do anything but meekly nod her head in agreement. Maybe Mew would be able to convince the human to forgive her...

With another sigh, the pink giantess holding you fluttered past Celebi and back to the shrine.

Carefully, Mew lowered herself and gently set you down at the foot of the shrine. You let her - you blindly trusted Mew.

The pink pokemon laid belly-down in front of you, her sapphire eyes towering above you as she looked at your tiny body.

There you were, sitting on a patch of grass in front of her, meeting her gaze, knowing the she wasn't going to hurt you.

For a brief moment, Mew thought what would have happened if she was the one finding you instead of Celebi.

Would she have eaten you too? Would she have fallen in love with you like her green friend did?

Her head moved imperceptibly as she shook of the thought, before inhaling deeply.

‘Human-’

"I don't want to talk about it." you interrupted.

Mew sighed. She knew how scared you were of Celebi - Synchronize mirrored your feelings.

‘But you need to talk... you'll feel better... and we can discuss about it if you tell me what actually happened,’ she said kindly, cracking a smile.

You shook your head.

"There's nothing to say," you replied, irritated and scared at once.
"Celebi tried to eat me... I don't know why I'm still here talking about it... and I have a pretty good idea of what she was doing before pulling me out,"

Mew smiled.

‘It's because she loves you,’ she explained, causing you to blush,
‘Trust me, Celebi only wanted to mess with you... but she didn't want to eat you. She would never do that,’

You huffed loudly, looking at the green fairy in distance; Celebi was looking straight at you, but you avoided her gaze.

"... It didn't seem like it when she ate me the other night." you bluntly recalled, the mere memory making you shiver while causing you to inhale sharply, frustrated.

Mew gave a dejected look.

‘I know that... but let me ask you something: you think she would have brought you back if she wasn't truly sorry about it? Do you think you'd be still here if she didn't truly love you?’ she asked.

That was a cheap shot, Mew was deliberately making you feel guilty.

"I-I... what?" you asked.

The pink psychic-type giggled.

‘See? Celebi's done something good for you after all,’ she said, now smiling cheerfully.

Somehow, that smile had the extraordinary result of making you feel reassured.

"... Y-Yes," you said nonchalantly.
"She brought me back to life... oh, and she was about to kill me again,"

‘I'm telling you she wouldn't have eaten you again,’ Mew repeated patiently, showing no signs of being tired of this one-sided conversation.

Celebi stared at both Mew and you from behind, hoping that her friend was going to make her precious little human feel better... she didn't know what she was going to do if her human wanted to leave her...

One thought lingered in the fairy's head: why wasn't the human afraid of Mew?

The sudden sting of jealousy was added to the raging storm of emotions inside the patroness.

‘And that's why you should forgive Celebi,’ Mew continued.

You stared at her dumbfounded.

"Forgive...?" you weren't able to finish the sentence.

Mew wanted you to forgive Celebi after said fairy attempted to eat you for the second time? Not all the words Mew could telepathically speak were going to convince you that if Celebi wanted to swallow you, you'd be already digested and traveling across her intestines right now... the thought was disgusting, and you quickly discarded the line of thinking to focus on Mew.

One thought persisted in your head though: you briefly wondered why Celebi didn't actually swallow you.

Maybe... she only really wanted to play? Was that her way of playing with shrunken humans?

For a moment, you looked at the green giantess; she was looking at you pleadingly, the word ‘please’ written all over her face.

For the briefest instant, you felt genuinely bad.

Mew smiled.

‘You do trust me, right? I'll have a word with Celebi later... but, forgive her,’ she chimed.
‘... If not for Celebi, for me?’

You looked up at the pink giantess.
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.title: A true legendary friend

choices: Celebi gives Weavile a chance to explain herself...
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.content:
"I think we should talk to Celebi first," you say.
"She... has feelings for me... if she finds I'm missing, Mew would tell her about you, and they'd hunt us down..." you tell.

Weavile nods.
"But... how would they take it? Our friendship... the fact that I'm helping you..." Weavile ponders.

You sigh.
"If they truly like me, they'll have to accept it." you respond.

--

Celebi was peacefully sleeping beneath her shrine. She was having sweet dreams - the human's presence improved those as well!

However, those good dreams were not meant to last.

The green guardian is suddenly bothered by someone calling her:
"Celebi... Celebi..."

The fairy opens her eyes to look up, noticing a familiar small human standing on top her belly...

"Cutie...?" the legendary asks, before yawning.
"What is it? Can't sleep?" she says with a teasing smile.

Right before she noticed something right past you - a figure. A bipedal figure staring at her from the shadows.

A more accurate look revealed Celebi that it was a Weavile.
"... A... Weavile...?" Celebi mumbles.

"It's alright," the weasel tells while walking closer.
"I'm a friend," she explains.

"Yes. She's my friend, Celebi. We need to talk about something really important. And we need to talk right now," you say. Celebi blinks a few times.

"... Your friend...?" she questions, confused.

Suddenly, bothered by the sudden chat, Mew starts to move in her sleep, before her eyes open as she wakes up.

The pink petite legendary sits up and rubs her eyes.
"What's the big-" she opens her eyes, noticing Weavile. Her black fur partially covered in blood.

"You!" Mew cries in alert while getting up. Weavile takes a step back, suddenly feeling pain in her face, where Mew slapped her earlier.

"Mew... what's going on?" Celebi asks as she too gets up.
"That Weavile... she stole the human away earlier!" Mew confesses, deciding that this is a good moment to say the truth.

Celebi looks flabbergasted.
"What?! When?!" she asks.
"While you were asleep..." Mew recalls, before gazing away, looking ashamed.

"I... I wasn't able to protect the human... I rescued him later..."

Celebi's dumbfounded expression changes into a frown as she eyes Weavile.
"WHAT?!" the fairy cries.

"... I ‘stole the human away’?! You started attacking me all of sudden!" Weavile snaps.

In response, Mew's paws glow azure as a sphere forms in between them. Before Weavile has time to react, Mew shoots the sphere at the weasel.
"Mew! No!" you shout, sliding off Celebi's belly and uselessly trying to stop the legendary.

To your surprise, Weavile rises a claw and slams it against the Aura Sphere, tearing it in half. The sphere explodes, crafting a cloud of smoke.

That's when Weavile dashes forward, striking Mew with her claws, sending her flying into a tree.
"Mew!" you shout as you watch the pink legendary sliding onto the ground, laying motionless afterwards.

"That's for the slap of before." Weavile says.
"She was the one who moved you into the cave! You'd be dead if it wasn't for her!" you shout to the dark type.

"Huh?" she asks, turning her head to look down at you, wearing a confused stare upon her face. However, a menacing ‘Biii’ makes her turn her head again.

Weavile notices Celebi glaring daggers at her, her fists clenched in ire.
"First you steal my little human, then you hurt my best friend!" she spits venomously.

Before Weavile's eyes, the grass type fairy floats over her, her open palm slamming against Weavile's cheek as Celebi slaps her across the face.
"Ow!" the dark type cries in pain, before shoving away Celebi with her claws.

"Bi!" the legendary cries, feeling something wet and warm on her body. She looks down, a single drop of blood rolling down her body.

"Oh... Sorry?" Weavile says upon realizing that she just hit the patroness of the forest she lives in.

"Celebi..." you say, taking a step back, knowing what comes next.

"BIIIII!" the grass type legendary shouts, her paws forming a large, green ball, which she throws at Weavile.

The dark type dodges, the ball colliding in a tree and exploding.

"You're so dead!" Celebi cries as she floats forward in a menacing manner, wishing nothing more than to get a grip of her opponent's throat.

However, Weavile dodges.
"Cut it out! What kind of guardian are you?! You should be protecting this place, not try to kill its inhabitants!" she shouts.

"Protect?! You came out of nowhere, kidnapped my human, harmed my friend and me! Do I need anymore reasons to attack you?!" the fairy shouts, throwing another energy ball at her adversary.

"I meant you no harm! You and your friend started it! Now stop it!" Weavile shouts, dodging yet another green ball of energy, which explodes behind her.
"You meant us no harm?! You were the one who hurt the human earlier, weren't you?!" Celebi retorts, remembering the cut on your arm.

"Yes! And I apologized! Because we are friends!" Weavile snaps back.
"Friends don't hurt friends!" the legendary fairy states.

"Says you - you ate him!" Weavile retorts.

At this point, Celebi stops.

How did the Weavile-

The fairy growls as she glows green, a thousand, razor-sharp leaves encircling her.

Weavile starts to glow blue, and the atmosphere suddenly gets chilling.

You watch the scene, feeling useless. They'll end up destroying the forest if you don't do something... but what?

Then, to your horror, Celebi and Weavile unleash respectively Leaf Storm and Blizzard. You finally manage to think of something that might stop this nonsensical battle.

"ENOUGH!" you shout, throwing yourself in between the two deadly attacks. On one side, thousands of razor sharp leaves; on the other, a wave of frosty air.

Both aimed directly at you!

You close your eyes, hearing two shouts:
"BI!"
"NO!"

Then, the attacks collide, causing a huge explosion.

And by now, you're sure that you're dead for good...

...

Your eyes open.
"Am I... Am I dead?" you ask yourself as you notice that you're cowering in pure darkness.

You look around. You should be dead... and yet your feel very alive.

What happened...?

"Human!" the familiar voice of Weavile calls you, while a few, heavy steps shake the ground beneath you. You look around again, noticing the dark type rushing to you.

But your whole being is filled with shock as you notice Celebi laying on the ground beside you, looking extremely weak. Her closed eyes open up into two tiny slits.

Upon seeing you alright, she smiles.

And you realize what just happened: Celebi saved you.

"Y-You... you saved me..." you say, walking up to her. Suddenly, all your frustration towards this legendary fades away.

Celebi responds by leaning forward, pecking you, causing you to blush. But you pay it no mind.

As if your body is moving on its own, you move to the giantess' face and hug her cheek.
"Thanks..." you whisper.

The fairy moves a paw on her cheek, pushing you against it, nuzzling you.

Then, she gazes up at Weavile, who had been staring at both her and the human, flabbergasted.

Celebi had shielded the human with her own body from a collision that would have given him death. Perhaps, what he said earlier was true: she DID have feelings for him.

"Why...?" the grass type weakly asks. You too rise your gaze to look at Weavile.
"Why... are you trying to hurt us...?"

"I'm not, like I wasn't before," Weavile huffs.
"And I didn't steal the human away earlier today - I was trying to save him! We... he's my friend... I'm only trying to help him..." Weavile awkwardly explains.

"That's true," you chime in, drawing Celebi's attention.

The legendary closes her eyes and sighs, deep in thought. Your world shakes as she suddenly sits up, still pinning you against her cheek.

The grass type fairy keeps thinking.

Was the Weavile lying? Or should Celebi trust her and let her explain herself?
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.title: A violent misunderstanding

choices: Celebi eagerly nods her head. She's willing to help!
Celebi slowly shakes her head... she disagrees...
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.content:
"Alright," Celebi says, her eyes opening as a serious expression appears upon her face.

The fairy removes you from her cheek and gently places you on the ground, in between herself and the Weavile, who sits down as well while breathing in relief.

Celebi had given her the chance to give an explanation. Seriously, if the legendary wouldn't have protected the human, she would have been still able to fight, and would have quickly overpowered Weavile.

She doesn't wish to know what her fate would have been afterwards... although the human did mention what Celebi did to the Zoroark he told Weavile about.

The dark type shivers at the thought.

"Well?" Celebi impatiently breaks the silence as she waits for either you or the Weavile to talk.

"Well... uh..." Weavile sheepishly mumbles, trying to find a way to start.

"Mew told that you stole the human..." Celebi recalls while pointing at her fainted friend. Weavile sighs.
"That's not how it went!" she exclaims, the memory of herself running from a legendary whose intent was to blow her up still fresh in her mind.

Celebi wears a confused expression on her face.
"I was starving, and I was sleepy. I wasn't really thinking straight, okay?"

"... She noticed me and grabbed me," you chime in.
"... Yes. That's when Mew started attacking me. I ran, not even noticing that the human was with me. Then, I managed to give Mew the slip and-" Weavile stops, knowing that this is an important point.

The part where she tried to eat you.

"... There was a major misunderstanding," you recall. Celebi's attention shifts on you.
"Bi?" she asks, titling her head. You have no doubt about what the question was, ‘What?’

"And then... I was so hungry... delirious..." Weavile continues as she looks away, almost looking ashamed.
"... What happened?" Celebi asks, not quite sure she wants an answer.

However, such answer comes out of your mouth:
"She tried... to eat me." you say.

Celebi's gaze falls onto you as her expression changes into one of disbelief. Then, that too fades, replaced by an unmistakable emotion: anger.

"WHAT?!" Celebi shouts as she gets up and clenching her tiny fists, staring daggers at Weavile, who swallows nervously.

"Ca-Calm down... I was delirious, I-I needed to eat!" she justifies. Celebi's eyes close into two tiny holes as she moves forward.

However, her attention is drawn by an almost imperceptible movement beneath her.

You step in between Weavile and Celebi.
"Celebi, don't do anything you might regret later. You should hear the rest of the story instead," you tell.

The green fairy looks at you, then at the Weavile again, before floating back to her original place. However, her eyes start glowing, and a blue aura surrounds you as you are roughly lifted off the ground and are moved towards Celebi, who grabs a hold of you.

Your body is put through an immense amount of pressure as the giantess squeezes you in a protective hug.

Weavile breaths in relief.
"As I was saying," she continues.
"The human convinced me to not eat him. That because..." the Weavile looks away as she blushes.

"What?" Celebi inquires.

Weavile looks back at Celebi, though her eyes don't fix on the legendary. Her gaze lands upon you.
"... He's the only friend I've ever had," she admits sheepishly.

Celebi's gaze softens at the declaration, and her eyelids relax as the giantess assumes a confused expression. You nod.

"All true," you confirm, while sighing in relief.
"But then, Mew found us." you add.

"Yes. Me and her fought. I was still weak, and she won," Weavile explains.
"When I woke up, I luckily managed to eat, and I came here for the human,"

Celebi frowns again, but you quickly reassure her:
"She simply wanted to talk Celebi," you explain, while trying to forget the trip in Weavile's mouth and the saliva bath. Not to mention that scent of death that was overwhelming.

The grass type looks down at you and nods.
"What did you talk about?" she asks, although you can't understand her.

"About a solution," Weavile speaks for you while also making you understand what Celebi's question was.

Celebi tilts her head.
"Solution?" she asks, confused. Somehow you manage to understand her this time.

"Yes. A solution. To grow me back to my original size," you bluntly say.

Celebi's mouth opens.
"Wh-Wha...?" she asks in disbelief. She was the one who refused Arceus' help with this problem, because she thought that she could ‘protect him better’!

"B-B-But..." Celebi is interrupted when she hears a noise behind her. A quick glance backwards revealed that it was Mew, waking up.

The pink pokemon looks at the three of you. You and Weavile have serious expressions, while Celebi looks flabbergasted.
"Alright, what did I miss?" Mew asks while floating beside Celebi.

The fairy ignores her to look back at the Weavile, who rubs the back of her head with a claw.
"I offered my protection. At least until we figure out how to help him..." she admits.

Again, Celebi's attention is drawn by you.
"Celebi, will you and Mew help me too?" you beg.
"I hate being this size! Everyone and everything is a threat to me!" you then shout, frustrated.

You then fix a pleading expression on the green fairy.
"Please... do it for me..." you plead.

Celebi gazes at you sorrowfully, and her paw finds its way on your head as she gently caresses you, seemingly thinking.

Mew is still trying to figure out what I going on.

Your attention, however, is all figured on Celebi as you wait for a single movement of her head, which would answer your question.

In the end, Celebi looks back at you...
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.title: A chance

choices: "I'll... I'll stick with Celebi and Mew..." you say. Better safe than sorry...
"I'll... I'll stick with Weavile..." you say. You want your size back!
"I'll... I-I don't know!" you say, unable to decide
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.content:
Before your eyes, Celebi gave a sad look, before her head started moving, first to the right, then to the left.

Her answer was clear.

"... No?" you asked, surprised, while Weavile's mouth hung open behind you.
"W-Why not?!"

Celebi stared at you with her sad expression painted on her face.
"Because... I like you at that size... you're easier to protect, and I can always keep you with me..."

Even though your desperation was rising, you blinked in confusion.

‘... She likes you the way you are now...’ Mew helpfully translates.

You look at her, then at the green fairy holding you, shocked.
"C-Celebi..." you stutter.

"That's egoistical." Weavile chimed in a lecturing tone, causing the legendaries to look at her.
"The human hates being that size, and you want him to remain like that only because of your wish."

Celebi frowned.
"What do you know about this?" she hissed.
"I... caused harm to this human, and devoted myself to make it up to him... I love him..." Celebi admitted shamefully as she recalled how she ate you just one day ago.

Weavile didn't respond.

The fairy sadly looked at you.
"I know what I did to you... I was foolish, alright? But I... I simply want you to forgive me... to stay with me..." she said, her grip on you tightening.

"But you... don't know what's it like to guard this forest... I'm all alone in here. No pokemon wants anything to do with me, and humans threaten to enslave me... but not you. That's why... I like you the way you are now..." she explained.

You sighed as you fidgeted in her grasp, uncomfortable, before looking at Mew.
"Translation?"

The pink pokemon giggled.
"Celebi just wants you to stay with her, because she wants to make it up to you... and because she doesn't want to be alone... how cute you two are~" she explained.

You ignored Mew's last remark to look at the fairy.
"... Celebi, you've already made it up to me, okay? You... you brought me back from death..." you say, recalling that Celebi actually traveled across time to save your life... although she was the one that ended it in the first place.

The fairy looks down, blushing.
"... Sorry about that..." she says glumly. You needed no translation to understand what she said.

You nod.

"But... This isn't about that Celebi... I want my size back! I can't... I can't bear living like this anymore!" you shout in frustration, before quieting down, breathing heavily while the three pokemon around you stare at you intently.

You look down.
"What am I reduced to..." you murmur, your gaze glued to the ground.
"I... I can't do anything on my own. I can't get food, I can't sleep safely because I could become food, I don't even know how I ended up in here in the first place!"

You felt your entrapment shrink as Celebi hugged you even more tightly.

Mew floated forward.
‘... You're scared because you're helpless? Buddy, you have us!... Me and Celebi I mean...’ she telepathically said as she glanced at the quiet Weavile for a brief moment, before looking back at you.
‘We'll do everything we can to protect you!’ Mew continued.

You look up.
"... Protection, Mew? Zoroark stole me, Weavile stole me, I ended in two different stomachs in less than a day! I don't exactly call this ‘protection’!" you shout.

The pink legendary looked down, ashamed. It was true, she let Weavile take you away...

"I didn't actually ‘steal’ you... more like rescued you..." Weavile chimed, scratching her chin with a claw, uncomfortable with the whole thing.

After your last outburst, Celebi looked at you with an undecipherable expression.

"You're right... we let you get captured, but we tried! We tried our best to protect you! And we managed to take you back!" she said, sighing in exasperation.

‘... That's right. We did manage to save you!’ Mew chimed gently. She knew what you were going through, and she couldn't really blame you for feeling the way you felt... but she and her friend were starting to grow pretty tired of the argument.

"... You rescued me, only to expose me to another danger! How many other times will this happen?!" you shouted, before looking down and sighing.

Then, you looked at the legendaries.
"You know... I only wanted to tell you... but I think it's my choice to make." you tell.

Celebi opened her mouth, but you interrupted before she could even speak,

"Celebi. If you truly... love me like you say, you'll understand how I feel... and you'll let me choose what I think it's best for me." you tell.

Celebi went silent for a moment... before she quietly nodded her head. Gently, the fairy leaned forward to give you a small kiss, before pulling back.

The pressure around you loosened as the green legendary released you from her hug and gently set you down on the ground, in between her, Mew and Weavile.

And you understand that it's the moment to make your choice, whether to stick with the legendaries or with the Weavile...

The response seemed pretty obvious but... you find that it was harder than you thought. Sticking with Weavile, or with Celebi and Mew... each of these two things carry advantages and disadvantages, you find.

On one side, the pokemon that granted you her protection and the promise to give you back your size... but, for what you knew, she was completely clueless about how to restore your original height... and plus, she had attempted to eat you earlier. You couldn't ignore the possibility that she would try to make you her next prey if you chose to stick with her... plus, she had no idea of how to grow you back, no? What if it took months? Or years? What if there was no remedy and you were damned to live your life as a dustmite?

The perspective was horrible.

On the other side, Celebi and Mew. The first declared her love towards you, and was willing to protect you... but unwilling to help you restore your size. Sticking with her would mean having to remain in the forest with her for the rest of your days as a shrunken human... but, you guessed, the protection of a legendary was better than the protection of Weavile... plus, Weavile was an huntress... if she ran into some prey stronger than her, you'd lose your protector and, possibly, your life...

Not to mention the fact that the dark type was a living weapon.

If you got too near her claws, or fangs...

You give a sigh of exasperation as you look in between the three titanesses staring down at your waiting for your last say.

And you finally make your choice.
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.title: An argument and a choice

choices: ‘... Yeah. Really.’  Mew nodded with a smile
‘Ehm... forget I said anything...’ Mew shook her head dejectedly
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.content:
You didn't exactly know what was going in your head, but you knew for sure that the protection of two legendaries, even if playful and a bit mischievous, was way better than the protection of a huntress.

"I..." you looked in between the three giantesses, wondering what you should have done.

Weavile had spared your life, called you her friend, offered her help... but the possibilities that there was no remedy to your shrinking were too high.

And, in that case, you would be doomed to live at this pitiful size, constantly in danger because of Weavile's nature.

You gritted your teeth.

If you had to live like this... it was better to live under a good protection. And, as much as you hated to admit, the legendary duo were the ones that could grant you that.

"I... I'll stick with Celebi and Mew..." you stated hesitantly, taking a few steps back from Weavile and closer to the two legendaries.

In a single moment, three different things happened: Celebi smiled massively, Mew breathed in relief and Weavile hung her jaw.

"What?!" the dark-type shouted, throwing her arms in the air.
"I thought you wanted your size back!"

You blushed.

"I do!" you retorted,
"But there's a good chance that there's no cure to my shrinking!"

"It would have been fine! I would protect you anyway!" Weavile retorted.
"Ehm..." you replied, unsure about how to tell her that her protection was the equivalent of you committing suicide.

But, apparently, she got the gist.

Her arms hung, her claws dangling dangerously close to you as she sighed.

"I understand." she said, not bothering to conceal the disappointment in her voice.

Without adding another word, the dark-type weasel turned around, defeated, and started walking away.

"Wait! We can still be-" before you got to finish, she had already disappeared into the thick, dark forest.
"... Friends..." you mumbled to no one.

You gave a deep sigh as you sat down on the ground, arms wrapped around your knees as you realized that you just lost Weavile's friendship.

There was a chance that she was coming back, but your mind told you that if she did, it was probably to eat you like she originally intended to do.

You glanced backwards, at the time-traveler sitting on the ground behind you, at the floating pink cat next to her.

"... And here we are then..." you mumbled.

Celebi stared at you, blinking, still processing what had been going on. She felt sore - not because of the fight, she could have taken Weavile down with ease; no, she felt sore because she had shielded her human with her own body and, while Blizzard wasn't a problem, her own Leaf Storm certainly did a number on her.

Aside from that, she was tired, and was sure that Mew was in the same state as her: after all, she was thrown into a tree and was knocked out.

Celebi smiled a bit. At least, her precious little human had ultimately opted to remain with her.

Gently, she reached forward and scooped you up, hugging you. You sighed, leaning against her chest, seeking for any kind of comfort after losing the pokemon that had offered to help you.

You thrown away the only chance you had, but the risks were too high and you were far, far too helpless to take them.

At least, you were safe... you hoped.

"So... a friend, huh?" Celebi casually asked, trying to change subject, but failing poorly since you couldn't understand what she said because of an annoying language barrier.

You stared at her blankly.

‘I'm sorry, but what actually happened after she took you away?’ Mew telepathically asked.

You looked at her,

‘She... wanted to eat me at first,’ you thought. It apparently worked, because Mew glared in the direction where Weavile went,
‘But she didn't! She was being nice to me after that... she wanted to help me getting my size back...’ you admitted.

Mew looked at you sorrowfully; Celebi looked at both of you with annoyance, bothered she was left out of the conversation.

The fairy gave an exaggerated yawn, before looking at you.

"Let's go to sleep you two." she said.

Shortly after, a pair of lips touched the right side of your head.

You sighed.

--

You stared at the sky, laying on top of Celebi's chest, her paws wrapped around you as she slept.

You wished you could sleep too, but you simply couldn't: you had too much to think about

‘Still grumpy about it?’

You looked at Mew, who was sitting upright, staring at you.

"Yes." you replied bluntly.

‘Want to talk about it?’ Mew asked again.

"No."

Mew smiled warmly.
‘Come on... I mean, it's not so bad! I bet being so tiny has some great advantages!’ she chimed.

"Like?" you inquired.

‘Ehm... giant food?’ Mew said, but you huffed again,
"Berries," you corrected,
"What else?"

The legendary smiled, pointing to your green bedding.

"She's-" you sighed.
"Mew, I honestly don't know why I'm still here right now. If there was one chance to grow back... I wasted it."

The pink giantess tilted her head, embarrassed.

You went quiet, and the telepathic silence lasted for a while, until Mew spoke in your mind again,

‘Well... if you really hate that size... I might help you somehow...’

You looked at her, eyes shot wide open.

Mew immediately regretted speaking: Celebi had expressed her opinion, and you were technically hers...

Still, friends help friends, and you were easily one of her best friends...

Legendaries don't have many friends, all the pokemon are afraid of them, of the power they possess. Mew was no different; Celebi was no different.

You were one of her few friends, and her first human friend...

But Celebi was her friend too, like she had been for ages. They used to live together, until one year ago, the fairy had left to go to Ilex Forest because ‘things are getting awkward Mew...’

"R-Really?" you asked hopefully after a while of simply staring at the pink giantess.

Mew looked at you.

Which one of her two friends was she going to listen to?
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.title: Lost friendship

choices: You decided to take the risk! You wanted to be big again!
You decided not to risk it...
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.content:
In the end, Mew's internal conflict died down.

Perhaps Celebi was going to be upset about it, but it was the right thing to do if you really hated being like that. She was going to try to fix you.

With a bit of a smile, the pink legendary looked at you.

'... Yeah,' she replied,
'Really.'

You felt your heart swelling as hope settled in.

A chance to finally grow back to your original size was finally presenting itself to you, and you certainly weren't going to miss this opportunity.

"We-well, what're we waiting for then?" you asked,
"Let's do it!"

Mew yawned and gave you a drowsy look.

'Can't it wait until tomorrow?' she telepathically asked.

"Er... no, Mew. This is sorta important..." you replied.

"Meeeew..." the pink giantess huffed,
"Fine."

You didn't understand what she said right now, but when you saw Mew lazily lifting herself off of the ground, you guessed she had accepted.

You watched as the pink legendary hovered close to Celebi, who gripped you tightly in her sleep.

Carefully, Mew grabbed a hold of your legs and with one quick tug, you were out from Celebi's grasp once more; the forest guardian let out a feeble cry in her sleep, as if sensing the lack of you, but she stayed asleep.

Mew lingered for a couple moments to see if her friend woke up. Then, seeing that Celebi wasn't showing any signs of wanting to wake up, Mew looked down at you.

'Let's go.' she spoke to you through her mind.

You were perplexed.

"Go... where?" you whispered from Mew's furry arms.

'Somewhere else. I don't want Celebi to wake up.' she explained.

You nodded in agreement and became quiet as the pink giantess began hovering away from the forest's guardian, who was left behind.

Mew quietly fluttered into the thick woods, not making a single noise, careful not to draw unwanted attention towards herself. She couldn't afford fighting when she had you with her.

Luckily, the trip for the pink legendary was lot less... 'exciting' than she anticipated, which was good.

For all she knew, that Weavile from before could have tried to strike her in the back to take the human she was holding again.

That was why Mew carefully watched where she was flying.

In the meantime, you were left entirely to yourself as Mew was seemingly paying you zero attention.

You couldn't believe the answer to your biggest problem was right under your nose for the whole time, but you guessed it was better late than never.

Growing big... who knew what would happen afterwards, since Celebi was probably going to be pretty upset, but that wasn't the point.

Surely enough, you did not wish to live in a forest, but even more surely that green legendary who had claimed you as hers wasn't going to let you go so easily.

The thought worried you.

Eventually, the flight came to a halt when Mew reached a small clearing illuminated by the moonlight. There were no traces that any Pokemon or human had ever been here, so it was perfect for a task this delicate without the fear of anyone interrupting and/or interfering.

"This should do just fine." she spoke to herself, fluttering to the middle of the clearing.

Without moving, Mew brought her tail close and coiled it around your waist, before lowering it to the ground, where she gently let go of you.

'There we go,' she spoke in a very serious manner, which was unlike her,
'Now, I'm going to try to grow you, but I guarantee nothing. And there a few things you should know before we start.'

You didn't know why, but seeing her with that look worried you.

Sure, she said she guaranteed nothing, but you shouldn't have worried about it too much. After all, Mew was a powerful legendary capable of anything, no?

"What is it?" you asked, not losing hope despite the worry that was starting to spread within you.

Mew looked away for a moment and blushed lightly.

Then she sighed and looked back at you.

'The chances this is going to work are pretty much the same chances it won't.' she informed, before continuing,
'I've never done anything like this before. Sure, it can work and you go back to our original height. That's the best case scenario. The worst... you shrink smaller. "

You felt the blood draining from your face.

Mew noticed it.

'B-But it's not really necessary! You could also not shrink and not grow at all! You would just... stay like that, I guess...' she quickly 'reassured'.

The perspective wasn't any better than the other alternative.

"Mew..." you muttered to the flustered legendary, who now fluttered above the ground in a flustered manner.

A minute of silence passed.

'... Point is,' Mew resumed, pointing her eyes on you,
'I don't know which other effects my psychic powers may have on you, so the risk is real. What I want to know is: are you willing to take it?"

After the question, the legendary went silent, giving you time to think.

You weren't much thrilled about the idea anymore, but there was still a chance you could grow back to your size.

You just had to take the risk...
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.title: Doubtful solution

1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.content:
In response to what both you and the Weavile are saying, Celebi removes her paw from her cheek, releasing you. Only to grab a hold of your body again, pressing you against her chest in a protective manner.

"Why... Why should I trust you?" Celebi weakly asks Weavile, clearly not fully trusting her yet.

The dark type sighs.
"The human just confirmed what I told you. If you don't trust me, trust him," she says, frustrated. She didn't mean any harm to Celebi or Mew - alright, maybe she held some hard feelings for Mew, but she didn't mean to hurt her or Celebi.

She just had to defend herself.

"... Trust her, Celebi," you say in a whisper, trying to convince the fairy that Weavile isn't an enemy.

Celebi looks at you.
"Bi..." she mumbles, still extremely weak from protecting you.

You glance downwards, noticing the fairy bruised where the sharp leaves and the frosty air hit her. You sigh, not daring to imagine what would have happened if Celebi didn't shield you from the attacks.

Quite certainly, you'd be dead. And, if by any chance you were still alive, your body would have received irreversible, permanent damage.

You look up to Celebi, noticing her staring down at you intently, her eyes half lidded as she struggles to not faint. At least, not when the Weavile is still around.

You sigh as you slip out of the fairy's hug, earning a curious stare. You stand on top of her chest and look past her as you glance over Weavile, taking notice that she sat down, staring at the wounded fairy in silence.

You assume she feels guilty.

"Weavile," you say, drawing the giantess' attention. The dark type weasel looks at you as she fixes a curious look from her.

"What?" she asks.

"Go... go get me some stuff, please. We need to heal her," you say, motioning for Celebi, who looks at you surprised.

So does Weavile.
"What, exactly?" she asks skeptically.
"Don't you humans usually carry stuff to heal pokemon?"

"... I'm not even one foot tall. How am I supposed to carry anything at all?" you retort. Weavile looks away, not quite knowing how to respond.

You swear you can see a pink shade starting to spread across her cheeks.

You sigh.
"Herbs. Berries. Whatever you find that might help, bring it here," you instruct in a calmer voice. The Weavile looks back at you.

You see her nodding silently as she stands up, before turning around and leaving the clearing where Celebi's shrine is situated.

Your gaze travels down to Celebi, who stares right back at you.
"So... here we are again..." you mutter, recalling how she was wounded after her fight against Zoroark.

Only, this time, you haven't got Mew to help you gather things...

Speaking of Mew, you look back at her, noticing that she's still fainted, laying motionless at the feet of a three. You can't help but feel guilty. If someone meant to protect you throughout the whole day, that was Mew.

"B-Bi...?" your attention is drawn by a weak cry from Celebi. You look down, wearing an exasperated expression.

"... Why, Celebi? Why didn't you listen?" you ask with a sigh.
"None of this would have happened if you just listened to Weavile. She isn't an enemy," you tell.

Celebi shakes her head.
"She took you away... She hurt Mew..." she retorts, though you can't understand her.

"... She's my friend, alright?" you repeat, before sighing again.
"I already told you, Celebi, I like you. But, if this... relationship has to go on, you should listen to me more," you scold, expecting her to be offended by your words.

Right before remembering that you actually need to tell her that you want to return to your normal size. You're not quite sure of how Celebi would take it. After all, she seems to be enjoying you doll-sized...

Against your predictions, Celebi smiles a little. Then, she slowly rises her head, resting it against your body. Sighing, you spread your arms and hug her, showing that you don't actually hold any hard feelings against her.

And how could you, after she protected you with her body?

A sudden noise breaks the silence that has fallen between you and the fairy. You break the hug, and glance past Celebi.

Much to your relief, it's not any hostile predator.

It's Weavile, holding a few herbs and berries. She carefully moves up beside Celebi, putting the things she's holding down, before looking at you.

"Alright. What do we do now?"

--

One last berry disappears into Celebi's mouth. The green guardian chews it slowly, before swallowing and giving a satisfied sigh.

Then, you find two fingers from a large, green paw getting a hold of your shirt as Celebi stands up. The wings on her back start to move as she hovers in midair, holding you in front of her face, smiling brightly.

Celebi leans forward, briefly placing her lips on your face.
"Thank you~" she chimes.

Then, her gaze travels down to Weavile.
"Thanks..." she mumbles, deciding to trust her.

At least a little bit.

Weavile smirks.

"So...? You had something to tell me, right?" Celebi recalls as she floats down.

Weavile's smirk fades as she nods sheepishly.

The giantess looks at you, not quite knowing how to start. You sigh, understanding that this is the moment to explain yourselves to Celebi.

Something tells you that this isn't going to be easy...
1352112121112122112111221122112112111112.title: Mistrusted

choices: "... He... he g-got kidnapped by a Weavile..." she admits
"... We... we're playing a game. Could you help me find him?" she lies
13521121211121221121112211221121121112.content:
"... Why don't you leave me here? I mean, you can't focus on hunting if you have to keep me safe, right?" you say, trying to persuade the weasel to leave you in the cave.
"Right. But, what if some other pokemon attacks you?" she asks.
"I'll be fine. I'll hide in a dark corner or something. Now go, before you become delirious and try to use me as food again." you state, getting her to snicker.

"Alright, I guess. Don't move until I return." she says, her voice becoming much less of a snicker and much more of a warning. Perhaps she really cares about your well being.

"... Alright." you reply. She gives you a quick nod, before exiting the cave, soon disappearing, hidden by plants and darkness. You hold your breath for a minute, before deciding she isn't around anymore. You allow yourself to sigh as you walk to the entrance of the cave as well, ready to get out of here and run right back to the shrine.


Meanwhile, Mew makes her way back to the shrine. She spent hours in an unsuccessful 'hunt', trying to find Celebi's little human and his new dark type host. And the worst part it's that it was her fault. She literally let a random pokemon kidnap her best friend's human. And, although she did give chase, she lost the Weavile's tracks. And now, only Arceus knows what she might be doing with him right now! Not to mention what Celebi is going to do to her if she finds out about the whole thing...

And now, exhausted, worried, bored and nervous, Mew flies into the clearing where her friend's shrine is situated. And the first thing she notices is a certain grass type sitting there, stirring.

Celebi opens her eyes. She just woke up from her nap. She feels much better, and it's all thanks to her tiny human, who had been taking care of her earlier.

Taking a deep breath, Celebi looks around, spotting her legendary friend Mew floating a few meters from the shrine she was sleeping beneath of.

Giving out a warm smile, Celebi quietly flaps her wings, getting in midair.
"Hi there!" she approaches Mew.
"Hey Celebi. How do you feel?" Mew asks, concern adding to the storm of emotions raging inside her right now.
"Oh, so much better! And it's all thanks to little guy!" Celebi replies cheerfully, before glancing around briefly.
"Hey, speaking of, where is he? I want to thank him~" Mew starts fearing. She hadn't thought of an excuse to justify the human's absence. She really expected to find him before Celebi woke up.

And, of course, she didn't. She's in trouble now...

"Mew?" Celebi calls out.
"Uh?" Mew says, snapped back to reality by her friend's voice.
"Where is little guy? I don't see him..." Celebi says, a light hint of worry in her voice.

Gulping down, Mew takes a deep breath, before answering.
"Uhm, you see...
13521121211121221121112211221121121112.title: Weavile leaves you in the cave, giving you a ch...

choices: Celebi decides to have her own 'fun' with you.
135211212111212211211122112211211211122.content:
"Uhm, you see... uh..." Mew desperately tries to come up with something. Celebi notices her friend's disease.
"Is... Is something wrong, Mew? Did my little one get hurt?" she asks, starting to worry.
"N-No... Not at all... He's perfectly fine... In fact, we're just playing a game! Yeah, we're playing... uh... cat and mouse!" the pink legendary lies.

"Cat and mouse?" Celebi parrots back.
"Yep! Little guy is hiding... Why don't you help me out? I can't seem to find him. He's good at this." Mew hastily replies.
Celebi stares at her for a few more seconds, before flashing her a smile.
"Alright! I'm in!" she cheers, starting to fly away. Mew gives a deep sigh of relief, before floating right behind Celebi as the two venture into the forest.


Meanwhile, you are sprinting through the thick woods, occasionally stopping to hide whenever you hear a noise or simply to catch your breath. Reaching the shrine seems like an impossible task for someone your size, as there is no source of light but the faint moonlight, but you don't give up... especially with the thought that you might unluckily catch up with Weavile while she hunts, in which case you would probably be dead... and, although it's a very low possibility, it still scares you into running right back to your two pokemon companions. Sure, they could easily hurt you as well, but, at least, they're nice to you. And they're the best chance of survival right about now.

You stop. You heard a noise. Looking around, you notice plants shaking... and, not losing an instant, you dive into the nearest bush you find.

Peeking through the leaves, you spot a certain, mythical time traveler and an as-well-mythical pink cat floating there, looking around.

Without even thinking, you poke your head out of the bush. And that's when Celebi casually looks in your direction and spots you.
"Bi!" she chimes happily as she flies to you. She extends her long, green arm to get a hold of your body, literally squeezing the air of you as she pulls you in a hug.
"Bi!" she repeats.
"Celebi, I can--" you're interrupted.
‘H-Hey little one, what an amazing game! You're good at this!’ Mew speaks through telepathy so that Celebi can't hear her.

"Game?" you ask confusedly, trying to look at Mew from Celebi's (mostly) gentle embrace. And, when you finally manage to get a glimpse of the sapphire eyed giantess, you see her waving her short arms frenetically, and a look that screams 'play along' on her face. It takes you a few moments to realize Mew's intentions.

"Oh... yes... good match Mew!" you state, faking a smile, getting the pink giantess to giggle. However, Celebi begins to feel cut out. She pokes you. Your gaze shifts to the bright blue eyes of the green time traveler.
"We have some unfinished business, little one." she says softly, a smile adorning her face.
"After all," she moves you closer to her face.
"I owe you one. Let me show my gratitude." you can't understand a word of what she said. And you don't have much time to think about it, because Celebi quickly puckers her lips, and pushes them on your face, which instantly flushes bright red.

Mew watches the scene with a smile.
"You know, you both are just adorable." she comments as Celebi pulls off, letting you breath again. She looks at Mew with red cheeks.
"Come on then, let's go back. It's dark already." she says, moving you to place on her head. But, as she does so, she notices something.

"Bi?" the grass type moves you back down. She picks your arm in her paw and examines it. Mew flies over to look as well. And her heart skips a beat when she notices your arm partially cut up.

"Bi?" she inquiries upon noticing it covered in dried blood. You mentally slap yourself. So focused avoiding to get eaten, you totally forgot about the arm that Weavile had accidentally scratched. And, seeing as Celebi is obviously waiting for an answer, you come up with an excuse.
"Ehm... you see, the bush I hid in had thorns." you lie.

But Celebi seems satisfied with your answer. Nodding, she places her gigantic paw on your arm. You wonder what she's up to.

You get your answer when the grass type glows green, and so do you, as the wound disappears from your arm.
"There!" she says, stopping glowing.
"Er... thanks?" you say. Celebi smiles, placing you on her head.
"Come on, let's go." she says, floating off. Mew laughs as she follows her friend. She was relieved that she and Celebi managed to find you. But she couldn't help but wonder about the Weavile. What happened to her?


It takes the duo just a few minutes to get back to the shrine. As soon they arrive, your stomach growls. It's been hours since you last ate, and now your stomach is claiming its last daily meal.
‘Hungry?’ Mew casually asks. You glance up at her and nod.
‘So am I.’ she says with a giggle.


In just a few minutes, your two companions gather a small amount of berries. They settle them on the ground and sit down. Celebi places you on the grass and settles a single, although very big, berry in front of you.
"Eat up!" she cheers. Then, both pokemon dig in their own meal.

One by one, the pile of berries disappears, gulped down in the stomachs of the two legendaries.

Finally, you finish your berry. Once again, Celebi picks you like a common toy and lifts you in the air.
"Ready to go to sleep?" she asks to both you and Mew.
"Oh, I sure am," Mew replies.
"I'm exhausted." the two float toward a tree and lie down, heads against the trunk.
"See you in the morning." Mew says, rolling on her side, wrapping her tail around her waist.

Celebi looks at her, before gazing at you with a sweet smile.
"For being such a good little human," she says, giving you a light peck on a cheek
"You get to sleep on the best place in Ilex Forest." you blink, as you obviously didn't understand her. Giggling, she starts lowering you towards the darker green side of her body, right where her belly is situated. You finally understand what she's up to.

You start struggling, trying to free yourself from her firm grip. You only just met Celebi, like, yesterday, and she already wants to sleep together? No way. But, obviously, you're totally powerless against her paw.

In response to your struggles, Celebi giggles.
"Didn't know you were shy." she comments, placing you down on her grassy belly, while your legs slide past her pubic area and hang a few feet from the ground.
"Bi." you hear Celebi say, as her two paws enclose your whole being in a hug.

You close your eyes, trying to recollect the events of the day.
For your first day here, you've already been eaten by two pokemon, enslaved by another and almost turned to food by a fourth. Some day this was. Sleep would be a great way to end it right now.

Sadly, you don't seem to manage to get sleeping. You try to shift position, but Celebi's paws keep you in place, forcing you face down on the dark green landscape of her belly.

Ten minutes pass. Twenty. Half an hour. And yet, you still can't sleep.

Unknown to you, Celebi couldn't sleep as well. She had to delay her... 'private playtime' with you because of Mew. But now, her friend is asleep, and she's starting to feel... needy. Maybe this could be the chance to finally try out some of the... 'ideas' she's been thinking about since morning.

Back at you, you finally start to feel drowsy. You let a yawn flee from your mouth as...
135211212111212211211122112211211211122.title: Back with the two.

This time, she has time to carefully pick you up with her paws and float you just on the entrance of her pussy being opened by her psychic powers. Slowly but surely, she inserts you inside her vagina until your back on her cervix. With you inside her muscle, she closes your only exit and begins using her fingers to masturbate herself.
1352112121112122112111221122112112111222.title: Celebi decides to have her own 'fun' wi...

choices: Take your chances, run and hope you don't come across any predator!
Decide to help her and try to get food! Somehow...
135211212111212211211122112211211212.content:
Weavile looks at you for another moment, before moving you away from her mouth and gently putting you on the ground, next to her.
"Little guy... Groan... You're right... You're my only friend... I won't eat you... But still... I need to eat... Groan!" she weakly mutters.

Her stomach growls in confirmation of her words, getting another groan from the dark type pokemon.

Then, suddenly, she stops groaning and moving. Alarmed, you rush to her. You have to climb her body, but you manage to get on her belly.

You make your way to her chest and lower your head, your ear touching the soft, black fur, awaiting to hear something.

You sigh in relief as the comforting sound of her heartbeat is heard. Weavile's not dead, she just fainted from the hunger.

Carefully, you climb back down and look at her humongous form. Her titanic body looms over you, filling all of your view. You notice the gigantic belly you were about to go in rising and falling along Weavile's breath.

After a few minutes of complete silence, interrupted just by Weavile's breath and the occasional, loud growls of her stomach, it hits you.

You can't tell that when she wakes up she still won't eat you. She's dead asleep right now, but surely it won't take long for her to wake up again, again awakened by the complaints of her empty stomach.

You could take the chance that you had before and run away from her. But... Can you really leave with the thought of someone that considers you her only friend dying from hunger? You could always try and somehow get some berries for her to eat. She's a predator, so that won't satisfy her for sure, but at this size, it's impossible for you to kill even the smallest pokemon. And you don't want to anyway. Berries could at least give Weavile some energy for her to go hunting. The slowly disappearing of the sun over the horizon confirms your thoughts.

Then, suddenly, her snoring stops. You start to sweat. Time is running out, she's going to wake up! What do you do?
135211212111212211211122112211211212.title: Friends again

choices: She's not here, maybe hunting... might as well sit down and wait for her.
1352112121112122112111221122112112121.content:
Before Weavile can wake up, you flee from the cave. You feel guilty for leaving her when she is starving, but Mew is probably looking in the whole forest to try and find you, and you really don't want to worry her nor Celebi too much. You decide that maybe you're going back to Weavile nighttime, hoping she'll be fine.

Lost in your thoughts, you run through the forest, heavily sweating and as well heavily panting to catch your breath.

Deciding you are far enough from the cave, you stop to catch your breath. Just then, a bush rustles before you.

Fearing it's another predator, you cower. But instead, a pink cat like pokemon with blue eyes flies out of it. Even though you were almost eaten not too long ago, you find yourself smiling. Mew, on the other hand, doesn't seem so happy right now. She has a somewhat distressed expression on her face.

"Aww, I've already been here! Damn, where that Weavile could have gone?" she asks herself.
"Mew?" you call out to her.
"Where could the little guy be now? What if she ate him?! Poor little guy!" Mew says worriedly, completely ignoring you.
"Mew." you call out again, a little louder.
"What I'm going to tell Celebi now? 'I'm sorry, I let a fellow pokemon kidnap your little guy'? She'll never talk to me anymore and-"
"Mew!" you shout.

This time, you manage to get her attention. She turns her head to look at you. Her signature smile returns as she bends to scoop you up.
"Little guy! There you are! I was so worried!" she hugs you tightly.

Blushing slightly, you give a little smile.
"Where have you been? Where's that Weavile?" Mew asks.
"Well, she brought me to a cave and then she suddenly fell asleep. I guess she was tired. I decided to run just then," you lie, sure that if you tell the truth, there will be no more Weavile to visit tonight.

Mew nods.
"At least you didn't got hurt. Except that little cut on your arm. Here, let me fix it," Mew says, placing a paw on your arm. Her own arm glows as a pink aura flows from it.

Removing her paw, the cut Weavile did you is gone.
"Wow, thank you." you thank her. She gives a warm smile in response.
"Come on, let's get back to our friend." she says, before flying in direction of the famous shrine of Ilex Forest.

Getting there, she finds Celebi stirring, maybe just waking from her slumber.
"Hey, remember-" Mew's voice is heard in your head.
"Not a word with Celebi about what happened.".
You look at her and nod.

Celebi yawns and opens her eyes. Looking around, she spots her lifetime friend and her newly found lover. Smiling at your sight, she gets up and flies over you.
"Hey there you two. How much time I've been asleep?" she asks.
"More or less, five hours. You were exhausted." Mew acts like nothing happened.
"Yeah, that Zoroark really gave me a fight. Good thing she's not here anymore!" Celebi giggles.

"But what did you two did while I was sleeping?" she asks, snatching you from Mew. You feel like a doll every time she does that. Your thought is empathized by Celebi squeezing you in a bone crushing hug, even though she's being as gentle as she can.

"Um, nothing special. You know... playing..." Mew lies.
"Playing? You played together? Aww, every time I want to play with my little guy, something bad happens!" Celebi pouts.
'Trust me, I know it now.' Mew thinks, recalling your recent 'adventure'.

You sigh. Not able to understand Celebi and not able to understand Mew when she doesn't talk to you through telepathy, you clear your throat, getting their attention.
"Soooo... Is someone hungry? I'm starving." you say.
"Is that so? Then, let me get something nice for my little guy," Celebi smiles, gently depositing you on the ground and flying up to snatch some berries.

Celebi hands you a small berry, that is the size of a watermelon to you. She then hands Mew a bigger one and helps herself with another.

You eat silently, while the two pokemon before you make conversation. And a hilarious one, judging by their laughs. You finish up your berry. Then, you remember about your plan. You tap Celebi's leg. She turns her attention to you.
"Bi?" she asks.
"Um, excuse me Celebi, could you get me another berry? I'm still hungry. Maybe a big one?" you ask.


Celebi smiles kindly.
"Bi cele bi! Bi!" she says. You assume it means 'yes' as she glows green. You wonder what she's doing. A green light glows to your side.

You are amazed to see a flower blooming, then becoming a full mature berry. Celebi picks it and lies it before you.
"Here you go. Dig in!" she says, before turning her attention to Mew again. At the moment, they're paying you zero attention, so you take the chance and push the berry into a nearby bush. You will need it later.

Much later, Mew gives a loud yawn, declaring she's worn out. Celebi nods.
"Well, bedtime I guess." she says.

Within a minute, you're laying down on Celebi's chest, her arms wrapped around your body like a blanket, Mew next to her. You don't even know how she convinced you to sleep there. Oh right. Puppy eyes. You could never resist them, even when you were normal sized. Your mom used to do that whenever you didn't want to do something. So it was pretty easy for her to incapacitate you.

You wait for a while, trying to not fall asleep. Finally, after a few minutes, both pokemon are asleep.

You take the opportunity and slip out of Celebi's hug. You slide on her side and get on the ground. You look up to see if she woke up in the process.

Celebi is indeed asleep. But she felt your absence, she needs you back in her sleep. So she waves her arms in a useless attempt to find you anywhere on her body. Not finding you, she gives up and resumes snoring softly.

You sigh in relief. Then, you head for the bush where you hid the berry and start pushing it, making it roll out. Even with all of your strength, you don't manage to lift it of an inch. So you give up and start pushing.

You push the berry through the forest, stopping every once in a while to see where are you going, catching your breath in the meantime.

Aided by the darkness of the night, you finally spot the cave you've been in with a certain dark type pokemon just a few hours ago. You push for another while, before finally reaching the cave. Wiping away some sweat, you peek into the cave, hoping to find Weavile still there...
1352112121112122112111221122112112121.title: Take your chances, run!

choices: one of the two death options
one of the four surviving options
13521121211121221121112211221121121211.content:
Weavile is sitting down holding her stomach, which is growling loudly. She sees movement out of the corner of her eyes, and sees a berry rolling torwards her. Although the berry is big enough that she can't see you.
"A berry." She said as her stomach growls some more. "Did it just roll in here on its own?"
She was interrupted by her stomach growling even more. "I'm too hungry to care it's food." With that she rushed forward and grabbed the berry in her hand and stuffing the berry in her mouth and swallowing without even bothering to chew. Before sighing in pleasure as it filled her up.
She put her claw on her stomach and said. "Now I have enough energy to survive tonight. Now to take a nap while it digests, hopefully without dreaming about a shrunken human like I did earlier."
With that she laid down and went to sleep.
Meanwhile you were in trouble. When she grabbed the berry you were still pushing it, and she was so hungry that she didn't realize that shhe had grabbed both the berry and you. Onn top of that since you were pressed into the berry by her grip she never noticed you in her mouth as you were swallowed whole with the berry.
As you landed in the stomach you were finally able to call out to her, but she could not hear you over her stomach. Suddenly the stomach acid started swirling around, as Weavile's stomach started the digestion process. The question is what happened to you, since there are four options. One you are digested two you somehow manage to survive untill you come out the other end. Three the energy Celebi used to create the berry mixed with the energy used to shrink you, and kept you alive, but trapped in Weavile's stomach while she shrinks to your current size (you shrink in proportion), fourth the energies mix like number three, but instead of keeping you allive, you are digested. Fifth the energies mix like number three and four, and you are still digested, but you mentally merge with Weavile so that both of you share her body and can communicate with each other. and finally the same as number five but Weavile does not shrink. So which is it?
13521121211121221121112211221121121211.title: She's still there, still hungry.

135211212111212211211122112211211212111.title: one of the two death options

135211212111212211211122112211211212112.title: one of the four surviving options

choices: You live, but are trapped inside a Shrunken Weavile's stomach
You somehow survive, until you become her poop.
1352112121112122112111221122112112121121.content: So which one?
1352112121112122112111221122112112121121.title: non merger options

choices: Leave, you have nothing more to do
1352112121112122112111221122112112121121.content:
You're still trapped in Weavile's stomach and, judging from the sounds coming from outside, the dark giantess is fast asleep.
'Great, now how do I get out of here?' you think to yourself.

You look around. Even though the darkness of the stomach, you manage to notice a small passage; most likely it leads to Weavile's intestines... though you will never willingly take THAT exit.... so, you guess, your only way out is the giantess' mouth.

You think of how you can reach it though. Weavile is laying down, so it should be easier for you to climb through her throat... at least you hope.

But, before you can think of anything else, the berry beneath you starts to melt, consumed by the acid.
"I need to get out of here, NOW!" you think out loud as your feet start to sink into the digestive juices.

Just then, date seems to shift in your favor. In fact, the acids around you suddenly start to gurgle, as a few bubbles start to float upwards; one of them takes you inside itself and brings you upwards as well.
'Please don't pop please don't pop please don't pop!" you pray as the bubble reaches the esophagus.

On the outside, Weavile lets out a small burp, finally freeing you from her dark insides.

The bubble containing your small body suddenly pops, letting you fall down. Luckily, you fall on Weavile's furry belly and sigh in relief.
"That was close..." you whisper, trying to calm down your racing heart.

Finally, when you manage to relax, you look at the gigantic pokemon's face.

You did what you had to do, you can leave now... but you weirdly feel like you want to stay for a bit longer. Maybe you should wake Weavile up and inform her of your latest 'escape'.

You yawn loudly. Sure, you could also go back to the shrine and go 'to bed'.

After a bit you decide to...
1352112121112122112111221122112112121121.title: You manage to survive.

choices: Stand still and let her pick you. Maybe she won't hurt you.
1352112121112122112111221122112112121121.content:
You decide that, since you're awake now, might as well wake Weavile up. You don't feel like going to sleep right now, as the 'adventure' you just went through left you fully awake.

Carefully to not get hurt, you climb on Weavile's metallic claws, that are laying on the ground next to her, and you make your way up to her belly.

You stop right on the thing you were in just a few minutes ago and you look up to the sleeping giantess, who snores softly, making her chest rise and fall in front of you.

You start poking on Weavile's belly.
"Weavile, wake up." you say, hoping she'll be able to hear you. Unfortunately she doesn't. So you call out to her a bit louder.

Still no reply.

You keep poking on her belly until you get tired.
"Weavile!" you shout. Apparently, it was loud enough to wake the titaness from her slumber, you can tell by her breath suddenly stopping.

The ground beneath you starts to shake as Weavile sits up, letting you slide on the cold ground.

You land right on your behind while Weavile rubs her eyes, then looks down at you.

The dark giantess' eyes widen.

It can't be.

The little human! But... wasn't he a mere dream? Or at least an hallucination provoked by her hunger?

Since pinching herself wouldn't end so good, Weavile decides to pick you up instead.

You notice the dark type moving a clawed paw to grab you. Fighting the instinct to cower, you let her pick you.
"You... you're real?" she asks.
"Already forgot me? I was here not even three hours ago..." you state.
"No, I didn't forget, but... you were really here? Weren't you a dream?" she asks again.
"Again, yes. You even attempted to eat me!" you exclaim, somewhat irritated.

Weavile lowers her head.
"Sorry..." she apologizes.
"It's fine." you reply.
The successive moments are followed by an awkward silence.

You spend the following hours talking with Weavile. When you decide to return 'home', it's almost dawn.
"You sure you don't want to rest for a bit? You look sleepy." Weavile notices.

In effect, you could use a good rest. But you figure out you'll sleep when you go back to Celebi.

After leaving Weavile with the promise you'll return, you walk into the depths of the forest.

You though you could make it to the shrine without any problem, but you were wrong. Yawning, stammering, constantly bumping into trees or roots, you walk towards the shrine.

Your vision soon becomes blurry from drowsiness, but you just keep walking, you're almost there.

But, suddenly, a figure comes out of a bush. It has long ears, two tails and it's white and blue in color. A Meowstic. And a female one, you judge from the red and yellow eyes fixed on you.

Curious about the little bug so similar to a human, the Meowstic lowers a paw to pick you. Fearing about what this pokemon could to you, you quickly try to think of what to do...
1352112121112122112111221122112112121121.title: Stay, and wake Weavile up.

choices: The Meowstic likes your taste, and swallows you.
The Meowstic dislikes your taste, and spits you out.
1352112121112122112111221122112112121121.content:
Too tired - and scared - to move, you just decide to let the Meowstic pick you up in her furry paw. Running would be useless since this Meowstic would certainly catch you in no time. You wonder something though. Something horrible. If a Meowstic can crush a truck with its powers, what could this one do to you?

Lost in your thoughts, you didn't notice the Meowstic is already holding you in front of her face, staring at you intently. Most likely she's wondering of how a human could get this small. Or maybe how a bug could look so similar to a human.

Curiously, the cat pokemon moves you to her nose and sniffs you a couple of times. From your smell, she can tell the little thing she's holding isn't just some bug after all.

You notice the Meowstic suddenly lowering you towards her mouth. Knowing how this is going to end, you start to struggle in a futile attempt to free yourself. The huge mouth of the white and blue pokemon opens, two sharp fangs shine as of waiting for you.

Ignoring your struggles, the Meowstic quickly dumps you in her mouth and shuts it close, sealing you in darkness. You once again get to experience pure terror as the Meowstic tastes every inch of your helpless body. She decided, since you're so small, that she could find out a human's taste.

Terrorized, you try to fight the red muscle, which obviously overpowers you easily.

Too tired, you decide to give up and let the giantess taste you, hoping she wouldn't swallow you, sending you to her stomach where you would meet an horrible doom.
"Please don't swallow..." you whisper, out of energy to talk anymore.
1352112121112122112111221122112112121121.title: Stand still and let her pick you. Maybe she won...

1352112121112122112111221122112112121121.content:
You'd been getting tossed, squished, slurped, and suckled on by the lady Meowstic for several moments now, even smushed against the roof of her maw. You were exhausted, panting, and worst of all.. She wasn't letting up.

Suddenly the whole of the maw vibrates as you make out a soft purring.. An approving one at that, which sent a shiver down your spine. That indicated to you that she was enjoying your taste quite substantially.. And that was bad!

"Mreoowh..~" you made out from the back of the feline's throat, as the tongue nudged you towards the waiting tunnel, stirring a bit of adrenaline rush into you, squirming futilely, begging her not to swallow again, but it was no good, you dipped over the edge and..

*Gulp.. Glurp.. Gluck..* she swallowed, sending you squelching down her throat and to her awaiting stomach, you'd whine and nearly choke into tears, feeling every swallow, oozing further into the heated, wet folds, making out the gurgles of the waiting belly below.

"I'm gonna die.. I'm gonna die as nothing but cat food.." you whimpered to yourself, squishing against the valve leading into Meowstic's stomach, where you were held for several moments until another gulp squished you through, plopping you with a squelch into the pit of the feline's gut. A deep, elated purr and sigh coming from your predator, followed by a short, soft "Breelllllch..~"

Your hopes were at an all-time low, the odds of you making it out were slim to none, the stomach folds groaning and already starting to churn in their motions around you. With nothing to do but await your fate..
1352112121112122112111221122112112121121.title: Psychic Kitty Chow

choices: Celebi woke up, noticing Weavile! Uh-oh!
Celebi remained asleep, allowing Weavile to put you back and leave. Phew!
1352112121112122112111221122112112121121.content:
You simply sat on the bottom of the stomach of the Meowstic, resigned to your impending digestion.

The colorless, steaming gastric juice was now up to your neck and it began growing hotter.

It wouldn't be long before it melted your skin, leaving a lifeless corpse in the tummy of the pokemon who ate you.

You couldn't believe this was already the fourth time you've been in a stomach, and all in a single day! People out there would give everything to be in your position, to study a pokemon from their inside, but you didn't find your current, smelly entrapment so amusing.

Dreadful, if anything.

You sighed to yourself as the stomach acid rose up to your chin, starting to make your skin prickle.

You wanted to cry, shout for the Meowstic to let you out, anything that might have pulled you out of this horrible situation. But you knew that all your struggles weren't going to make the Meowstic spit you back out as she seemed to have enjoyed your taste.

This was, undoubtedly, the end...

--

On the outside, your psychic-type predator rubbed her belly as she sat at the foot of a tree, satisfied by the small snack she had just swallowed.

The taste of the little creature was unique. She wondered if she would have ever found more of your kind, a human shrunken to a pitifully small size who would have been a cute little snack for her to enjoy.

The mere thought made the dual-tailed feline purr. Now she was free to take a nice little nap, she merrily thought.

However, her train of thought was rudely interrupted as a bunch of bushes began to shake.

"Meow?" she muttered quietly as she looked around, scanning the area around herself.

The female Meowstic let out another soft cry, before she closed her eyes and rose her ears, doing a psychic scan to detect any eventual presence.

But she found nothing, aside from a few pokemon far away.

The Meowstic relaxed, began to purr softly as she felt the human in her tummy yet again.

She was alone.

Or at least, that's what she thought.

--

She knew she did good following you.

She wanted to stop you, warn you about the many many dangers this forest had during the dark hours, but you were simply too hasty and didn't let her speak.

And now, you became a victim of a random Meowstic wandering around the forest.

"Why didn't you just listen to me?" Weavile sighed as she stared at her future prey; the Meowstic couldn't have detected her, she was a dark-type. And psychic has no effect on dark-types.

Still, there was nothing to be relieved about.

If she wasn't quick enough, for her human friend was going to be too late.

Hastily but careful to not make any noise, Weavile sneaked behind the tree where the Meowstic was resting.

Silently, with the typical agility of her species, Weavile began climbing up on the lowest branches of the tall tree.

She wasn't going to kill the Meowstic unless it was necessary. She would have simply knocked her out and tried to make her spot the human out.

A chill crawled down Weavile's spine.

If she wasn't able to take you back out, she would have to gut the Meowstic with her bare claws. The thought was a hideous one... but she was going to do so if needed, she thought with a newfound determination.

Without anymore hesitation, Weavile jumped off the branch she was on and fell down.

The Meowstic was enjoying a nice rest, when she felt the wind blowing and something big approaching.

Her eyes shut open, but the feline barely had the time to glance upwards before Weavile landed straight on her, full strength, causing her victim to fall unconscious immediately.

The Meowstic's head laid limp against the tree as Weavile jumped off her, repressing a smirk.

Instead, she focused on the unconscious pokemon's tummy.
