You shout, waving your arms, summoning all of your courage and all of the strength your vocal chords can muster,trying your best to get Hilbert's attention before he can leave. The colossal tween's expression immediately changes from one of curiosity to one of surprise and intrigue. You feel a chill down your spine as he eyes you,and you think back to what you saw just moments ago, his sneakers, pounding down onto the doormat just to wipe the dirt out from under his feet. You could be next. The boy interrupts your thoughts by expressing his own. "wohhhhhh, cooool!" he says, showing enough interest in you to terrify you. He slowly lowers his enormous hand down towards you, his palm casting a shadow over your tiny body . His sweaty fingertips grip firmly around you,and you find yourself before his inquisitive eyes.He breathes out onto you, the scent of a cheeseburger and fries hanging over his breath. Suddenly, his lips spring into motion as he speaks up. "Hey lady!" he shouts , causing the daycare lady to turn around."Where'd you get this toy?" He asks, resting his elbow on the countertop and holding you out in front of the woman. She steps towards the boy, briefly glancing at you before turning back towards his face. "Oh, that? Found it in the donation box today. Isn't it something else? I've never seen a toy move quite like it does. It's like a real person...in fact, sometimes I like to think it is one."

Hilbert tilts his head back, scratching his chin and glancing over at the daycare lady.Can I have 'em? he asks, actually referring to you as something other than an 'it!" Jugding by the expression on the boy's face, it looks like he doubts the woman will say yes. The woman responds, confirming his suspicions. "Oh no...whoever donated this toy donated it for a reason,and frankly it's the best toy I've ever seen. This toy also already means a great deal to a little Pichu, and , well...Pichu is certainly a bundle of energy. Having a good toy to entertain him always helps" She laughs, rolling her eyes. She continues. "it would probably make him cry,too,and I wouldn't want to disappoint him."The boy tightens his grip around you instinctively as she speaks,and you can hear him sigh in disappointment. The woman holds out her hand "Can I have him back now?" she asks.

The boy hesitates, slowing bringing you over towards her hand, but hesitates. Finally, he speaks up,stopping just short of handing you over. "You know ...what if this little guy really were a little guy?" He asks, tapping a fingertip against your hair. The caretaker ponders this before speaking up "Well..I would still keep him. There would be so many uses for him,and it's not like he'd be doing better anywhere else. At least he could be useful with the baby Pokemon. Wouldn't you want to keep him, too?" The boy kind of guilty replies. "Yeah..I guess I''d keep him too. Keeping him as a pet would be a lotta fun." The conversation continues down this frightful avenue for a bit more, until Hilbert...
152131.title: Meet Hilbert

choices: over towards the fence of the outdoor  Pokemon pen.
1521311.content:
"Hey..." the boy's voice booms over you, cracking slightly in his excitement. "I'll give you two thousand Poke Dollars for him!" he says, offering to buy you...for a price that wouldn't even buy a video game. The caretaker tilts her head, looking at the boy in confusion, surprised he would so quickly offer to part with his money over what amounts to an a chew-toy, even if it is a top-of-the-line one. She sighs before nodding slowly. Looks like Pichu will just have to deal with the disappointment. "Well,ok. If you really want to. I can just buy another one, I guess. " She says, not wanting to deny the boy something he very clearly wants. Hilbert hands over the currency,and the woman doesn't even bother to count it. He steps out of the store, bringing you at last into the bright light of day, though your view of the world is extremely limited. In fact, in your current position,all you can see is the cobblestone pathway leading to the daycare's doors.

Suddenly, the giant boy's hand rushes upwards, still clinging tightly around you. You are brought before Hilbert's enormous face once more, breath gently puffing out of his nose and onto your tiny body, his lips curled up in a smile. He rotates his hand and releases his grip on you, at last allowing you to move. Before you can actually move, though, you hear his voice again. "Stand up, little guy." He says, matter of factly, though his excitement is obvious. Realizing that he already knows you're alive, you can see no harm in obeying. You push your hands against his soft palm and clumsily stand up, nearly tumbling to the distant ground.Finally free to move on your own, at least as far as his palm goes, you look out at the world around you. The terrain is unfamiliar, but you seem to be on a walking path near a small town."Wohhh....you really ARE a small person...this is so cool.." the boy mutters to himself, interrupting your thoughts.

You turn towards his face. He responds by grinning an awkward, toothy grin and waving his hand about frantically. "Hiya little guy! Can you say something?" He asks, his massive eyes fixated upon you."Hey." You respond, waving your arm back to him just as awkwardly. The boy extends a meaty fingertip down towards you and mashes it down onto your face, clumsily petting you. "You can talk,too...oh man, this is great. I have the world's first mini-dude!" He says, clearly impressed. You push your hands up against his finger, impotently trying to deflect it from your head. You try to explain to him that you aren't a toy, that you're scared for your life,and that you want back to normal. You innocently ask the boy if he will help you get back to normal size. "Maaaaybe. Let's take you back to a hotel or something first My name's Hilbert, by the way..," he says in the same way that a boy might lie to his mother. You feel a pit in your stomach. That means no. You protest, but he cuts you off. "Dude. I just saved your life. I can give you back to the daycare if you want. Wanna play with that Pichu?" He asks. You immediately shake your head. Gods no, anything but the horrors of that terrible, terrible, noisy room. Hilbert brings you before his face, scratching his chin, clearly feigning contemplation...though what he's actually planning, you can't tell. "Hmm...I duuuunoooo. Maybe I need to teach you a lesson, mini-dude. Or maybe I don't. Hmmmm...what should I do...?" After a brief pause, Hilbert evidently comes to a decision. He starts walking...
1521311.title: Property of Hilbert.

choices: Girafarig manages to get you free from Hilbert's grip.
Hilbert snags you out again, then takes you back to his bike.
15213111.content:
"Ok. Sorry, little guy, but think I need to teach you a lesson before I can take you home" Hilbert says, speaking to you with a hint of indignation, even if there's a clear playful tone in his voice. He reaches his other hand towards you and gently pinches you between his fingers, the enormous fingers locking around you and trapping your arms in place. You are carried you towards an enormous wooden fence. You look towards the distant, enormous field. The heat of the summer morning beats down upon you, and a less than pleasant odor clings to the air around you. A series of sounds much like cannons being fired echoes through the air, and you soon realize it to be the clopping of an enormous Girafarig's hooves. The boy holds you steadily in place, wrapping his fingers tight around your body.

You kick and squirm, begging for help as the enormous Pokemon's face draws nearer and nearer, but none comes. The Girafarig finally arrives in front of you and gives you a good sniff before opening its mouth wide. Whatever you felt about the boy's breath, you can agree that the Girafarig's breath is ten times worse. Suddenly, her head rushes forwards, her enormous tongue headed straight towards you. She locks her muzzle around the boy's fingers,your body included, and begins to assault you with its squishy, tongue. You squirm as it pushes against you, rubbing against your face, dragging up and down your body, occasioanlly bumping into the fingers that bind you in place. You squirm with all your might, something that merely entices the Girafarig to pursue you more aggressively..but you ultimately give up your struggle when you realize that breaking free from the boy's grip would spell certain death. Saliva seeps around your body, ruining your clothes inside and out, soaking your body in spit.

The Girafrig begins to push her teeth against your back and tug at you, trying to rip you out of Hilbert's grip. Hilbert quickly reaches into her mouth with his spare hand, managing to part it just enough to pull you out. The Girafirig trots back, spinning in a circle before turning back towards you. Hilbert brings you back over the fence,the the Girafarig approaching slowly, eyeing you skeptically.She clearly wants you back, almost certainly because it wishes to devour you outright. Suddenly, the Girafarig lunges for you, only for Hilbert to swiftly pull you away. "Wow, you're fast, little guy!" Hilbert says, taunting you. The boy continues to jerk you about here and there, toying with both you and the Girafarig...to the boy, who likely doesn't appreciate just how cruel he is being to you, it's a simple game. He's probably a 'good kid' as far as kids go, too. Maybe somewhere in there he appreciates the idea that Girafarig could eat you, but for now he's lost in the fun of the game. It's no fun for you,however...it's a life or death struggle!

To the Girafarig, of course, it's a potential meal. After five more pounces, the Girafarig finally gets you in its maw once more, much to Hilbert's surprise.
15213111.title: Punishment: used like a petting-zoo treat.

152131111.content:
Girafarig's enormous maw lunges straight towards you once more, opening wide and engulfing Hilbert's hand before you can even respond. Her teeth lock around Hilbert's fingers and swiftly tug back at you, yanking you free from his grip with ruthless efficiency. You tumble forward, onto the Pokemon's squishy, slobbery, smelly tongue. You almost immediately scramble back, using your newfound freedom to attempt to escape from the gigantic Pokemon's maw. Before you can even try to part her lips, however, the Girafarig jerks her head to the side. Her hooves slam down against the soil soon thereafter,and you realize that she has just managed to walk out of Hilbert's reach."AW CRUD!" the boy shouts, realizing with horror that he's lost his little find. You're 'free' from Hilbert, alright...and a free meal for the Girafarig, to boot.

         Girafarig's tongue suddenly pushes you forward, right towards her waiting teeth. Two rows of flat chompers pound around your body, applying a huge force all around you. You scream in pain as you're struck by the teeth, your body barely able to take the pressure without getting crushed. Desperate to get out of this mess, you push forward the moment the rows of teeth part, and you manage to shove your hands between the unsuspecting Pokemon's lips. The Girafarig attempts to chomp down on you again, but just barely misses your lower body. Struggling with all your might, you force open her maw and tumble down to the distant soil, striking the surface with a thump. You struggle to get to your feet, your body beaten,bruised, and sore, your clothes soaked and torn, and your legs hardly able to hold you. You push your way between blades of grass that are just as tall as you are, trying to put as much distance between the Girafarig and yourself as you can. You turn your head back to check up on your predator,and find that she appears to be holding her head in place near the ground, eying you, but not moving. You make a beeline for the fence, your heart pounding, your little legs about to give out. Just a bit more...a peaceful life as a gradeschool boy's property awaits. You got Hilbert's message loud and clear. Defying him lead to the scare of your life...surely this is fate telling you not to defy him again. You can practically feel it. You're going to be safe...you'll live to see another day...just a bit more...

         As you near the fence, you begin to feel a bizarre sensation overtake your body. You find yourself getting drawn back by an unseen force, as if pushed by a strong wind. You step forward still, fighting with all your might to make it past the fence. You continue to step towards it, but find that with every step, your motions slow even further, almost to a halt. Your hope begins to die down before vanishing outright. Suddenly, the force intensifies dramatically, flinging your body over the blades of grass and back towards the Girafarig, your body landing on its back. Right...she has psychic powers, you forgot. All you managed to achieve, in your flight, was to drain your own energy, making the Pokemon's job all the easier. Suddenly, you feel a FAR more painful force smashing down onto you. The Girafarig's hoof crashes down onto you, jamming down into your legs and almost immediately snapping your bones. You yell out in pain and terror, but earn no recourse from the gigantic predator. In fact, she actually decides to drag your body beneath her hoof just a bit, pushing your body against the soil firmly enough to leave an impression wherever she drags you. You are helpless, able only to watch as the Girafarig's enormous face descends towards you again. Her mouth opens wide, and she clamps her teeth around your upper body, using her hoof to hold your lower half in place as she roughly yanks and twists at your upper half. Your body can hardly stand the trauma. When resistance finally becomes impossible, she releases her hoof's hold on you and hoists her head up into the air, your legs dangling from her mouth. She pushes you inside, trapping you in the darkness of her maw once more.

         This time around, Girafarig has no trouble pushing you between her teeth. They aren't as viciously sharp as those of some of the more carnivorous Pokemon, so she has to put in a bit of additional effort to pound you into submission. She smashes her teeth around you again and again, slowly but surely pulverizing you. By the time she finally sends you plunging down into the depths of her belly, you're hardly alive. A pain courses throughout your entire body as you lie there, trapped in the darkness, forced to listen to the sounds of the creature's internal processes, accompanied by the distant stomps of her hooves. Your body is sloshed and shaken around as she stomps about. Soon, an avalanche of chomped up leaves begins to tumble into her belly, burying you up to your neck beneath the rest of her meal. Stuck beneath the bed of leaves, afforded only a tiny portion of oxygen, and cradled by the shaking of Girafarig's belly, you slowly fall to sleep for the last time. Death finally claims you as Girafarig's stomach goes to work on her meal.

         Lizza the Girafarig thinks back to the interesting little vermin she gobbled down a few hours earlier, idly trotting about within the pen as she does so, occasionally pushing a toy ball about with her nose. She had used her psychic powers to read a bit into its mind earlier, just enough to know that it apparently thought itself to be a human. An amusing thought, a human only barely bigger than a PokeBlock. That'll go down in the record books as the most arrogant prey she devoured. Then again, maybe it WAS a human. Wouldn't that be something. She of course loves her human owner, but she's always wanted to completely overpower a human being. It was a shame that her meal fought so hard. She would have loved to have spent a bit more time delving into its mind, to see what it was thinking before it couldn't think of anything beyond its current agony. It's always a guilty pleasure, reading the thoughts of her meals. Speaking of her meal, she finally feels ready to be rid of it . She digs a hole in the ground and promptly puts it to good use before kicking some dirt over it, covering her tracks. She trots off, wondering when her owner will be back. A cute Growlithe sprints between her legs, giving Lizza a much wanted distraction for the time being. She playfully gives chase, returning to her usual routine.
152131111.title: A treat for Girafarig

choices: Stay in the bag...how bad could Hilbert be?
15213112.content:
Hilbert's fingertips press firmly around your head, locking it in place. You begin to squirm around as best you can, fearing that his grip might tighten at any moment. Suddenly, the boy opens his mouth up wide and blasts you with a powerful,though clearly forced, belch. He purses his lips together almost immediately and breaks out into a giggle, amused by his boyish antics. "Ah, don't worry. I was just teasing you little guy The gigantic boy says, loosening his grip around your head. He grins before speaking up once more,"Thouuuugh...." he says, lifting you up over his head, tilting his head back in the process. "You DO look kind of tasty" He adds, opening his mouth wide, sticking his tongue out. He swings his tongue left and right as he slowly lowers you down towards his cavernous mouth, his breath washing over you once more. Right as your feet barely touch against the tip of his tongue, he yanks you up again and tickles you in the chest. "Aw. Why are you so afraid! I wouldn't eat you!" he says, and while you're sure that he wouldn't dare devour you, the fact that he doesn't see anything wrong with these games is just as scary.

"Come on. Home's too far away for tonight, so I'm gonna take you over to the nearest town, we can spend the night together in a hotel! Just as the giant finishes speaking , he starts sprinting off away from the daycare, your tiny body getting flung about madly in his grip. He carries you over to an enormous bike and stuffs you feet-first into one his pants' front pockets, your body winding up mashed against his wallet. He plucks you out a moment later and brings you over to his enormous carrying bag, a blueish plastic bag with a half-Pokeball logo emblazoned onto the side. . He opens his palm out, hovering it in front of the opening, then he lowers his hand over towards the top of his bag, your body stumbling around in the process. "Ok little guy! Hop on in!" he says, as if he were inviting you to join him in a pool. A thinly veiled command that he wants you to obey. You peek down into the bag, hesitant about diving in. You feel a sudden force against your back, his fingertip jabbing you forward towards the edge of his palm. Getting the message, you suddenly dive forward into the bag, tumbling down to the bottom, landing atop a wadded up receipt and a rolled up bag of candy. The bag is shaken about for a brief moment, and you hear a terrifying grinding noise as the zipper is sealed shut , well..mostly shut. A tiny crack of light pours into the bag from an opening in the corner

The bag shakes into motion as the boy hops onto his bike and starts riding off, carrying you along with him to...well,wherever he is going. You keep hoping that you'll be able to persuade the boy to help grow you back to normal,or at least to knock off with his petty games...another part of you fears for the worst, that things are only going to escalate from here. Whatever the case, you're bound to be with him for a while. You manage to pry a piece of candy out of the candy bag, and you begin nibbling on it. Though it's too sweet for your tastes, and it's not really nutritious, you could use the extra burst of energy. As you nibble on it, you look up at the light coming from the corner of the bag. The opening is big enough for you to slip through! You feel your heart skip a beat, both excited and afraid.You can make your escape if you want...but what if escape isn't the best option? Hilbert will probably toy with you and belittle with you the first chance he gets, but is the outside world really any better? At least Hilbert seems to want to keep you alive. You mull over your options carefully before making your decision.
15213112.title: Carried along on the road to adventure.

choices: Attempt to get up and flee to safety.
152131121.content:
You lie within the bag for about a minute, listening to the sounds of his feet pumping the bike's pedals, thinking about your current status in the world. You were sold as a plaything to a giant 5th grader,and while he clearly knows that you're alive, you're almost sure that he views you as a pet. You've seen how kids usually are with their Pokemon. They might view their pets as friends, but they expect them to be at their beck and call constantly. Your situation is much worse than that of a Pokemon, though...you'll be the first addition to Hilbert's collection that is incapable of fighting back. A Pikachu could zap him if it felt abused,it wields enough power on its own to put the boy's authority into perspective, and would be a visible enough victim for the boy to get into trouble if he mistreats it too badly. The best you could do would be to give the boy the middle finger, which would really achieve nothing more than giving him an excuse to try out a new form of punishment on you. If you stay with him, you're going to get degraded and overpowered until you really are nothing but a toy. You can't accept that.

         As tempting as it is to stay within the bag indefinitely,you decide to make your escape. You approach the edge of the bag and hastily grip at the cushy wall beside you. You fight your way up, your body getting constantly shaken by the boy's motions. A chance motion causes you to nearly fall off, but you just barely manage to grip tight enough to avoid having your progress reset. After a minute of climbing, you finally make it to the edge. You take a look around you. Aside from the boy's jacket, a massive tower of blue fabric to your side, the world is a blur,the dirt path beneath you included. Before you can make any attempt at trying to descend, the boy's motions force your hand. The bag swings to the side just a bit, just enough to cause you to tumble over the edge. You manage to grip your right hand against the side of the bag, your body dangling like a keychain ornament.

         You swing your left hand forward, managing to get it around the side of the bag, reinforcing your position even though your hands are starting to feel sore. You make an effort to shimmy towards Hilbert's enormous pants, hoping to work your way down to the ground. Eventually,you arrive at his waist. You fling yourself onto the bottom of his jacket, gritting your teeth. The cool air beats against your body, and you are subjected to even more force than before. The gradeschooler's legs push up and down, back and forth as if they were part of an enormous engine. It becomes apparent that you probably won't be able to climb down, but you're going to have to try anyway. You wait for the right moment before releasing your grip on the jacket, and you manage to cling onto the side of his pants, near his knee. Unfortunately, the boy's motions are simply too violent for you to handle. You lose your grip on his pantsleg and plummet down tot he dirt path, landing awkwardly on your right leg, immediately tumbling onto your back. You pant in and out, your arms sore, your right leg overtaken with a throbbing pain,and the rest of your body not feeling particularly well either. Still, there's something relaxing about hearing the sounds of the biking boy fade off into the distance. You just managed to save yourself from becoming a 10 year old's action figure.

As you lie there, you begin to grow nervous. You aren't really safe out here, but your body is tired as all else. You're not sure if your leg needs any more rest,but the soreness all over your body is definitely telling you to rest. Ultimately, you decide to...
152131121.title: Escape!

choices: There's no way you could fight it...you have to flee.
There's no way you could flee from it... You have to fight it!
1521311211.content:
Your body is sore from head to toe, and you’re still shell-shocked from your previous encounters. You’re not even sure if you can properly run in your current state, but you can’t just lie here and do nothing. You are completely exposed to man and Pokemon alike, and you have seen what they are capable of. Even if you manage to avoid detection, you’re still in the middle of the road. Just lying here, you would face a substantial risk of getting stepped on or worse. Summoning all of your willpower, you get to your feet, a pain shooting through your leg, but not one so severe that it prevents you from moving.

         You head towards the closest side of the road, which, at your size, is over a quarter of the length of a Unovan football field away from you. Clumps of dirt the size of your head lie scattered about the path here or there, a fine detail you would have likely ignored if you were at your normal size. At the far end of the path lies an enormous stick, stripped of any jutting branch, aside from a short one near the base. A sizable trench of dirt lies beside the discarded stick. Perhaps a boy was here earlier, playing with the stick as if it were a sword, scratching at the ground just for fun. Whatever the case, the ‘trench’ would be deep enough for you to lie down inside, just another reminder of your small scale, and how the most insignificant of actions on the part of the ‘giants’ could have an impact on your surroundings.

         You stagger over an ankle-deep tireprint that’s almost as wide as you are tall, in awe of its scale. You’re getting close to the edge of the road. However, before you can arrive at the patch of grass, you hear the beating of wings, followed by a loud squawk. Turning towards the noise, you see a shadowy figuring descending right towards you, wreathed by the brilliant light of the sun. Your movements must have drawn the attention of the flying predator. Seized by your primal drive to survive, you sprint to the side at full speed. You apply too much pressure to your injured leg in the process, however, and you collapse forward, scraping your hip and elbow, just barely avoiding getting pinned beneath the incoming hazard.

         Rolling onto your back and swiftly scooting back, you get your first glimpse of the new threat. An enormous reddish-brown talon with long, white claws. You can see the many ridges lining the toes of the talon, and are almost immediately reminded of a dinosaur. Indeed, the avian beast that presents himself to you might as well be one, given his scale. Looking up, you see the underbelly of the huge Spearow , but are soon met with the more intimidating sight of his enormous beaked face, gazing right at you. His beak is parted wide, his eyes glare at you cockily, the confidence of a prize fighter going in for the kill…or a hunter quite literally going in for the kill, in this case.

         The Spearow parts his wings dramatically, revealing his truly impressive wingspan, roughly eight times as wide as you are tall. He lifts one of his talons into the air dramatically, a downpour of dirt flakes tumbling to the ground underneath, before slamming his sole down onto the soil with a mighty thud. He drags the talon back, a shrill grating noise sounding out as it cuts into the surface of the soil. He repeats the process, slamming and scratching his talon into the soil again and again, getting stoked for a chase. The entire sight is enough to send you into a panicked state. You’re almost certainly going to die here.

         Just as you manage to get to your feet once more, the Spearow finally decides to take initiative. He charges towards you, his mighty talons scratching against the ground, his face hovering just above the ground, his beak open wide, ready to snap you into his eager maw. It’s fight or flight, now. A battle for your survival, with a humiliating death as the quarry of a bird being the cost of failure.
1521311211.title: Spearow arrives.

15213112112.content:
You make a brief effort to back away from the Spearow, but it quickly becomes apparent that you won't be able to outspeed him. Hastily surveying your surroundings as you retreat, you spot a basketball sized chunk of dirt nearby, something that could be used as an improvised weapon. You rush for the dirt,the Spearow quickly drawing closer and closer to you. Gripping at the surprisingly light chunk of dirt, you hurl it straight at the Spearow's forehead. It strikes the giant bird right between the eyes and bursts into a puff of dirt,momentarily blinding the creature. Using this distraction to your advantage, you circle around the enormous bird, moving out of his field of vision. You spot a twig and grab at it, clumsily holding it as if it were a spear. You cautiously retreat towards the fence at the side of the road, mostly to gain some distance between yourself and the bird, who is already shaking the dirt of, getting ready for another charge.

         The enormous Spearow turns around, letting out a mighty squawk and spreading his wings once more. He leaps up into the air, noisily flapping his wings at a dreadful pace. He swiftly advances upon you,attempting to attack you from above. His enormous talons swiftly rush towards you, threatening to catch you in his grip. Whatever he intends to do with you once he has you in his clutches, you can be sure that it would spell the end for you. You rush the creature head on, narrowly avoiding his gripping talons, and hit his underside with your weapon, actually managing to produce a small scratch. The Spearow's talons slam down onto the soil immediately thereafter, the gigantic Pokemon clumsily stomping forward, carried by the momentum his failed dive. He swiftly turns around, one of his mighty wings smashing into you in the process. You are flung back by the force of the impact, knocked onto your back, your weapon cast aside. You rush over to the twig, the Spearow's talons swiftly chasing behind you.

         You dive for the stick, the Spearow's beak slamming down right behind you, just narrowly missing your legs. The Spearow flicks his beak forward, knocking you away. You roll as you hit the ground, this time around able to hold onto your stick. You get back to your feet, just in time to see the Spearow resume his charge you, his head hovering just about the surface of the ground. He's showing no signs of tiring, beyond merely being annoyed at your resistance. You realize that if this keeps up, you'll eventually run out of steam and get hopelessly savaged. With his head so low to the ground, you should be able to hit him in the eyes. You charge towards the Spearow head on, in a desperate attempt to strike at his most vulnerable point. You leap up a full body height into the air and prepare to thrust your weapon into beast's eyes. Suddenly, the Spearow jerks his head up. He opens his maw wide and slams his beak down onto the stick, leaving you hanging from its tip. Having no choice, you abandon the stick and step back, feeling a dull terror as the Spearow effortlessly breaks your weapon, crunching the stick in half with his mighty beak. You desperately search for another twig, but the closest one is located on the opposite end of the road, the formidable Spearow blocking your path. Instead, you decide to attempt to climb onto the creature's back.

         You rush around the Spearow as he spits up the remaining chunk of the stick, hoping to outmaneuver the lumbering titan. You manage to round his flank, his tailfeathers in sight. You leap forward, managing to grip onto a tailfeather right as the Spearow whips his body around. You are flung several feet away, your tiny body smashing into the dirt painfully. The Spearow squawks angrily, realizing that you might have given him the slip. He quickly scans the area, taking all of five seconds to spot you. He chases you down again, and this time you lack the energy to truly evade him. He slams his beak right down,and it is all you can do to dodge the blow. He slams it down again and again, forcing you to roll past it left and right. After dodging ten pecks, you feel a shooting pain throughout your body. You are hoisted up into the air,the Spearow's beak having managed to seize itself around your chest. Your upper body dangles from his beak, providing you with one last glimpse of the outside world, albeit an awkward one. He pushes his beak against the ground and growls as he pushes you against the soil, forcing you deeper into his beak,until only your head is exposed. He lifts his beak up and forces you down into his maw, the partly cloudy sky vanishing from your vision as you are pushed down, his beak noisily snapping moments later.

         You are easily forced down into the darkness of the enormous bird's belly. You listen in terror,hearing the muffled sound of the Spearow SQUAAAWKing as noisily as possibly, crowing in triumph. You give a token struggle, not wanting to die this way, not wanting to die as vermin in the belly of a beast. But it's all to no avail. The fight is over. You have lost. The Spearow leaps up into the air, sloshing your body about. Soon enough, you give out at last, reduced to mere nutrition for the bird.

         Spearow stands atop the fence, peering down at the path, occasionally flapping his wings about, or pecking at the air to deter a random fly. It's a somewhat boring hunt, but the path is a good fallback when his usual hunting grounds prove barren. Usually he only find discarded bits of food from the humans, but from time to time he finds a real prey. He's already forgotten the little battle he had. He remains stationary for another hour before a burger-toting-trainer finally spills a sizable scrap of bread. The Spearow dives for it, snagging it up and gulping it down quickly. He flies off, heading back towards his nest.
15213112112.title: The early bird gets the worm.

choices: Get the hell out of dodge
1521311212.content:
You can feel yourself throbbing all over, sore from your previous encounters. Your arms ache from the difficult climb, your leg hurts like hell from the drop,your chest is sore from the rough treatment at the hands of the giants,and the sounds and sights of the daycare's interior still haunt your mind. You simply don't have it in you to get up,at least not yet. Instead, you opt to lie down and simply absorb the environment around you as you recover. It's a bright day. The warmth of the summer noon's sun bears down upon you,and the scent of soil is thick in the air. The chirps of birds echo noisily through the air, though thankfully the chirps are easier on your ears than the chaos of the daycare's interior. You lift your head just a bit and look around, surveying the area. The daycare is far away now, the outdoor pen just barely in your view. The distant calls of Pokemon sound out from the area...you don't want to go back. A large patch of grass extends alongside the path, cut off by a deep,pristine river. On the opposite end of the road, the same white fence you saw earlier towers over the roadside, separating the path from a grass embankment. Beyond the embankment lies a forest.

Shifting your vision upwards , you catch a glimpse of the talons of a bird Pokemon,resting on one of the fenceposts. Looking up just a bit, you see a Spearow peering down at you, curiously. The humongous bird Pokemon tilts his head left and right,trying to get an idea as to what you are. You feel a cold chill pass down your spine, a paralyzing fear gripping your body. Your life could depend on whether or not the Spearow decides to examine you. You remain as motionless as you can, trying to pass yourself off as a discarded plaything, something unworthy of the Pokemon's time. Your heart pounds as you stare up at it. You're afraid to even close your eyes. As you lie there, you hear the sound of a rumbling coming from a distance, growing louder and louder. The Spearow averts his gaze from you for just a moment, giving you a chance to turn towards the rumbling. In the distance, you see an enormous bicycle headed your way, a mud splotched black rubber tire dragging rolling against the dirt path, headed right your way. looking up, you see the crimson framework of the bike,and the smooth, feminine legs that work at it. A pair of black, skintight exercise shorts rests atop the seat, belonging to a woman in a pink vest. Beads of sweat cling to her legs. She looks to be in her 20s, certainly more mature than the boy from before. Whatever the case, this could be your chance!

You manage to get up, pain shooting through your right leg, but not enough to prevent you from walking. Watching as the enormous bike draws near, the rumbling growing louder and louder, the scale of the enormous tire becoming more and more apparent, you decide to...
1521311212.title: Cyclist, incoming!

15213112121.content: You make a bold attempt at getting the attention of the gigantic cyclist. However, your odds of actually getting seen are quite low...a coin toss at best, in fact.
15213112121.title: Can you get her attention?

152131121211.content:
The sounds of the woman's pink sneakers pounding against the pedals continue to grow louder and louder, booming out like a series of cannons, loud enough to be heard over the grinding of the bike's chains and the rumbling of its treads against the dirt path. Dirt spews forth to either side of the monstrous machine, pushed aside by the gigantic wheel. You can hear the constant roar of the wind against the bike, a wall of air torn asunder, displaced by the enormous advancing machine. The wheel spins at such a fast pace that the pattern of its treads is nearly a blur, but you can still make it out. Five rows of rectangular knobs bulge out from the surface in a checkerboard pattern, some of them more worn than others. The soles of the woman's sneakers jut out over the sides of the pedals, a splotch of dirt caked to her left sneaker's sole. Your split second observations are enough to tell you that your odds of getting the giant woman's attentions are slim, but it's a risk you will have to take. Maybe, just maybe, you'll be able to get those enormous soles to stop peddling. You rush in front of the enormous bicycle, your heart pounding out of fear and determination.

          "HELP! HEEEEEEEELP!" you call out as loudly as you can,your voice just barely audible over the sounds of the enormous bike. You wave your arms frantically, fear increasingly taking hold of you. The wheel shows no signs of stopping, though it does wobble left and right slightly. You continue to shout for help with increasing desperation, the hopelessness of your efforts become more and more obvious. You get a brief whiff of the scent of the rubber of the tire wheel as it plows against the ground. The pedals move out of view,and the wheel quickly eclipses your world, the numerous treads smashing into the road, threatening to grind you out of existence. Your life flashes before your eyes as the bike draws nearer and nearer, and you briefly freeze up, too horrified to move, though only for a split second. You leap away from the wheel as quickly as you can.

         It's too late. The enormous tire falls down upon you. The rubbery surface pushes you onto your side, knocking you against the dirt path you so freely walked upon before. The treads of the tire smash down onto you, pulverizing your body the moment it hits you. Your body squishes to the surface of the tire. Thanks to your jump, you manage to survive with your upper torso and head intact, the world fading into an agonizing blur in the process. The bright crimson framework of the bike passes into your vision, its brand emblazoned onto the surface of the bike, in white, though you can't quite make it out given your current situation. It's flanked by the smooth, toned legs of the lady cyclist, beads of sweat tricking down from them. You just barely catch a glimpse of the crotch of her microshorts as the wheels rolls upward, and you catch an even briefer glimpse of her face. Earbuds. She's listening to music on her phone. You never even had a chance of getting her attention.

         Your body remains plastered to the surface of the tire as you're sent hurtling to the ground. The dirt path rushes towards you as the tire's wheel advanced relentlessly,as if it were part of the wheels of fate. You're smashed down into the ground, this second impact proving to be your undoing. What little of you that survived the first loop around the bike's wheel is squished like a grape, dragged into a little smear, and much of THAT smear is ground out into a streak of blood along the path.

         The cyclist felt a slight bump as she traveled down the path, the third she's felt during the day's work-out routine. The area in front of the daycare is usually somewhat poorly kept after, so it's hardly a surprise. She doesn't even bother to glance back to check what exactly she road over. She pauses after ten minutes, the bike slowing to a halt. She kicks her bike's break to the ground and pulls out a bottle of water, gulping it down. She wipes her mouth clean and puts the bottle back into place, then resumes her journey, heading over to the nearest town. Days later, she winds up washing the wheels of her bike clean, getting rid of the stain for good.

         As for the streak on the bike trail...a Zigzagoon discovers it. He sniffs at it briefly before licking it up, then trotting off, not even leaving a trace.
152131121211.title: Roadkill!

choices: Head  up or down the path
Head off of the path before doing anything else.
15213112122.content: The pounding of the cyclist's feet against the pedals, the grinding of the chain, and the sound of the earth trembling beneath the treads of the bike's wheels are all you need to realize that getting her attention will be all but impossible, and that your attempt may well cost you your life. You stagger away from the bike, but it's gaining on you far too quickly. Desperate and terrified, you dive forward, the cyclist's peddling sounding like canonfire all the while. The enormous bike shoots right past you, the treads of the wheel just narrowly missing your left foot, the force of the air being displaced from beneath the wheel alone pushing you back. Plumes of dust shoot out from beneath the wheel, shards of dirt scratching at your skin, the smog of the dirt choking at your lungs. You get back to your feet and sprint as quickly as you can,frantically looking skyward for signs of the Spearow. You quickly realize that the bird must have flown off, either afraid of the bike or no longer interested in you. You're safe...for now. You pause for a brief moment to catch your breath, your close shave with death fresh in your mind.
15213112122.title: A narrow miss

152131121221.content:
Though the grass could provide you with valuable cover, you're also more likely to encounter a Pokemon there, and the numerous blades of green would severely impair your movement. You decide that heading down the dirt path would be the best course of action. You're faced with another decision,however...which way shall you go? You're unsure about your location,and have no reason to believe that safety is more likely to lie in one way than the other. You could theoretically take shelter beside the daycare if all else fails: it would likely be a destination for many trainers, some of which could be helpful. You have no intention of staying there, of course, but it could be a fallback if you don't find anything worthwhile down the road.

On the other hand, you're really hesitant about heading back that way at all. What if the daycare lady spots you again, after all?

Ultimately, you decide to head
152131121221.title: Back toward the daycare or forward down the path?

choices: Right, towards the embankment and the forest beyond.
152131121222.content: Thinking about the Spearow from earlier, you realize that you're really far too exposed , standing in the middle of the dirt path. You decide, instead, to head down one of the patches of grass to the side of the road. To the right lies the grass embankment, at the other end of the fence. Beyond the embankment lies a wide field, and a forest lies beyond that. To the left lies a slightly more narrow stretch of green, a flat surface resting at the edge of a beautiful river. You briefly weigh the pros and cons of each side before deciding to head...
152131121222.title: Left or right?

choices: To try and rush to the tree
1521311212221.content:
The recent Spearow encounter has made you wary, so you decide to spend as little time in open field as possible. The grass on the left side is tall enough to conceal you and that fence makes you think that something is being kept inside of that particular pasture. You begin your trek across the dirt road, and reach the other side without much hassle. Now before you is a forest of grass, each blade like a palm tree casting shade down upon the dirt and occasional boulder. Or as they would be known to most normal people, medium sized pebbles. Worry flashes through your brain for a moment, but then vanishes. You would be worried that Pokemon may be roaming this tall grass, but in reality it's only tall to you. Still, in your current situation it would be best to be cautious. You steal your nerves, shake out your leg, and start the trek.

The walk is fairly uneventful, at least until you get about halfway to where to grass shortens again near the riverbank. While you walk, storm clouds start to fill the sky, and at the halfway point it starts to rain. Water pours from the sky, maybe a heavy drizzle for you a time ago but now each drop is a gigantic bullet of water. You find yourself dashing from blade of grass to blade of grass, several times almost being smashed into the now soaked dirt by a rouge droplet. You can't stay very long. Each blade bends under the weight of the droplets and a second hit on one you were under would be a cold falling blast. Fortunately though, you find that this has greatly increased your pace of motion, and it takes you about ten minutes to clear the last half of the rush, where the grass begins to shorten again.

Suddenly, you're faced with a new question. Originally you were just going to the river and figuring it out from there, but now you need to find cover from the rain. There is a fairly large tree (by normal standards, not just your new perspective) that would cover you from the rain and give you a bit of needed shelter and rest. Unfortunately, it would require dashing a fairly large distance in which you could be hit by a droplet and probably get hurt a fair amount. On the other hand, you noticed a fairly tall pink flower just on the edge of the grass that could supply cover as well, without you having to be in shorter grass.

Another thunderous splash comes from above, causing the blade of grass to almost touch your head. You've been thinking too long, it's time to move. In the heat of the moment you choose...
1521311212221.title: Down Came the Rain

15213112122211.content:
You decide not to go for the tree. With your leg injury, you don't feel like you could dodge any sudden raindrops, and honestly, you've taken too many risks for one day. You decide to take the safe route, slinking along the edge of the tall grass to reach the pink flower. It takes you a few minutes of dashing, but soon you fling yourself against the yielding, dark purple stem of the flower. Rain pounds down above you and you let out a sigh of relief. Finally, after this crazy, nightmare of a day you have time to rest. You stretch out your injured leg and lean back against the rather large stem. Stem is a bad word for it actually, it's more like a tower. It's odd, you feel like you've seen flowers like this before, with this color and shape, and this stem almost like a...body.

There is a loud and sudden bang. You've realized your mistake too late.

The air around you is filling with a yellow fog, too quickly for you to hold your breath. As you inhale, you're wracked with cough after cough, and can feel your body start to lock up. At first, your fingers and toes, then your arms and legs, finally you're stuck, posed slightly curled and completely paralyzed by the Stun Spore cloud. As the yellow fog dissipates, the "flower" begins to stand. Behind you the ground rumbles as a Vileplume slowly rises, a Vileplume the size of a hotel building, red dot eyes staring at you. The normally cute Pokemon that could barely come up to your waist loomed over you with a curious simile. To an outside observer, this is just a cute little Pokemon observing its well earned catch. But to you, this was a terrifying god, deciding your fate while you could do nothing to fight back.

Vileplume took a step forward, so that the bug she had caught was between her feet somewhat. Even though this was dumb enough to get caught in her stun trap, you never know when the paralysis could wear off. The bug was the most interesting she had ever seen though, very unique looking if not the brightest thing. "Vileplume?" She asked, wondering if this was some kind of Pokemon she had never seen, but it didn't respond. Her hand grabbed it roughly and tightly so it wouldn't squirm out, and opened her mouth. A bug isn't any good if it doesn't taste as unique as it looks.

You want to scream with pain within the giant flower's hand but can't. It's grip is too tight, causing your bones to creak and the air to be forced from your lungs as it held you before its gaping maw. Normally it could barely eat one berry at a time but you would be pitiful compared to a berry, so it will have no trouble with you. You can't move or scream, you simple are tossed into it's mouth like a pellet of food, directly onto its huge tongue. Around you you can see a few small teeth. Funny, you would have never thought Vileplume would be a carnivore. There is no time to muse however. It's mouth shuts and you're slammed against the roof in an instant as the Pokemon starts to suckle on you, like hard candy. Its tongue conforms to your body, coating you in thick saliva and rubs against every part of you. Your face is ground against the roof of Vileplume's mouth, with occasional huge increases in pressure when Vileplume sucks. The Pokemon knows you can't do anything and is going to milk you for all your flavor. Just as the spores start to wear off, you're tossed onto a row of teeth. Facing upward, you watch the enamel above descend.

Vileplume was impressed by this bug! Not only did it look cool, but it had a unique and delicious taste too! It had both sweet and salty notes, culminating in one of her favorite tastes to date! As she suckled on her treat, she closed her eyes and smiled, feeling the sun come out from behind the rain clouds. What a great day for her! She got to indulge in a tasty new kind of bug, and the nasty weather broke too! After a few minutes of sucking, Vileplume felt the bug twitch a bit, and tossed it to the side of her mouth, bringing her teeth down a few times. New bursts of flavor came from the critter, which gave an excellent finishing note as she swallowed. Vileplume plopped back down on the grass, smiled, and began singing. Maybe more of those delicious easy catches would come along. That would make her day perfect.

You didn't get to be the very best Pokemon trainer, but you got to be the very best food for this Vileplume, and that counts for something at least! For you, this is...
15213112122211.title: A Vile Mistake

1522.content: You are speechless at the sight of where you are. You're outside and it's a bright sunny day. You see grass all around you that rivals you in hieght. In the distance you see a massive lake, the water glittering the sunlight. You close your eyes and take a deep breath. It's almost peaceful out here you think. But you know that you have been mistaken for a toy and that if any pokemon show up they might eat you or play with you roughly. So you decide to try and find a place to hide until you can figure out how to escape. However, before you can start looking for a good place to hide a massive shadow looms over you. You turn around with a yelp to see...
1522.title: Outdoors

15221.content:
You stare, terrified, at the poochyena that has come over to play with you. This bad you think, after all you know that poochyenas can play roughly and will ocasionally eat creatures your size. With that in mind you quickly turn around and start running away. However, you don't get very far when the poochyena pins you down with its paw. You think that this is the end when the poochyena lifts its paw off of you. You stand up confused but decide to run now and ask questions later. As you start running again the poochyena again pins you down with its paw. It's then that you realize that it's playing with you. The poochyena ends up playing with you like this for several minutes.

Eventually, you have enough of this and when the poochyena lets you back up for the umpteenth time you turn around to face it planning to tell to stop this. However, before you can say anything the poochyena brings its tongue out and licks you. The poochyena smacks its lips and then licks you again. You don't like where this is going. The poochyena looks at you in different way, one that you don't like, and likes its lips. You realize with horror that the poochyena is going to eat you. You turn back around and start running for your life. Unfortunately the poochyena easily pins you down with its paw like it had done so many times before, but instead of letting you get back up this time it slurps you into its mouth.

You find yourself lying down on the poochyena's massive tongue as saliva pours over you and you are blasted by the poochyena's hot smelly breath. The poochyena licks you against the roof of its mouth and rolls you around on its tongue. This goes on for quite a while as the poochyena savors your taste. Eventually, the poochyena's tongue settles down and starts to push you towards the back of the throat. You scream as the poochyena tilts its head back and swallows you whole. You struggle in vain as you slowly travel down the esophagus. Eventually, you land in the stomach with a plop and continue your futile struggles even as the digestive jucies start to flow. You eventually pass out from exhaustion and lack of air which saves you from the painful process of digestion.

Meanwhile, outside of the stomach the old lady in charge of the daycare gives the poochyena a stern lecture about eating the toys. However, the poochyena isn't listening to the old laby. It's to busy wondering in the back of it's mind whether or not all of the new toys where as tasty as you.
15221.title: Poochyena and the Tasty Toy

choices: She wants to play with you (friendly)
She wants to play with you (cruel)
152231.content:
A voice shouting inside your head begged you to stare straight ahead, disregarding the massive form that was looming behind you. however, your body seemed to have a mind of its own, as if the curiosity was too much to pass off. Slowly your neck turns behind to gaze upon two massive amber orbs gazing down at you. A yelp escaped your mouth as you stumble back from the shocking sight before you.

"Vul!" the pokemon says in a rather cheery tone as six orange furred tails wag behind in unison. You couldn't believe just how this situation took a turn for the worse as you stood in front of the massive vulpix's face. "e-errrr e-easy now." you stammer in hopes that this giant fox was able to understand you. The vulpix curiously tilts it's head to the right as if attempting to acknowledge your gesture and request. Within moments however it closes it's eyes and lets out another happy yip as its head began to loom downwards straight for you.

Stricken with fear, you simple huddle up in a protective ball hoping with all your might that whatever was to come wouldn't be so painful. To your ultimate surprise, there was no sense of pain at all. no broken bones, no crushing, though you did manage to feel an extremely soft, warm surface huddle upon your side slowly moving rhythmically. As you shakily look upwards, to your shock the ginormous vulpix was gently nuzzling your tiny body with her left cheek. A long sigh soon escapes your mouth realizing that this pokemon meant no ill will towards you. As your body slowly began to lose its tenseness from earlier, the great vulpix continues to nuzzle your side while giving out low yet audible murrs.

"h-hey now." you say as you couldn't help but chuckle and gently attempt to move her huge face away from your body. Within seconds, it soon returns it's head upwards to gaze down at you. As it continued to stare, it almost looked as if it had a smile on it's face though whether or not it was of mischevious intent was beyond your knowledge.
152231.title: Yes!

1522311.content:
"Vul!" shouted the Vulpix in an obvious giddy tone, as she gives a small playful leap in the air. Upon impacting the ground, you nearly manage to fall flat on your rump from the force of her paws, though luckily manage to keep a steady footing. "What's with the leap?" You ask in utter confusion as you try to steady yourself up again. The Vulpix immediately lowers her head, as her six orange tails wag feverishly behind her. In seconds, her huge black nose stands before you as her hot breath blows past you in a rhythmic fashion. Just by the expression on her face, it was clear she was filled with an unprecedented happiness. Though, the reason for said happiness was still a mystery to you.

"What is it?" you ask, unsure why the Vulpix lowered her head down once again. "Vul!" she cries out once more before quickly turning tail and running off. "h-hey!" you shout watching as she makes off to the far side of a grassy patch. At first, you were contemplating whether or not you should run off in search for help over your strange size problem. However, reality soon kicked that idea right out of our head, when you remembered all the dangers lurking about. Even, if you did manage to avoid the now HUMONGOUS Pokémon wandering about, there was no telling what fate would await if you encountered an oblivious person.

After around a second or so, you soon manage to see the Vulpix running back with some sort of round object in her mouth. Upon closer inspection, you soon identify it as an old withered ball. Once the vulpine Pokémon finally returns to you, she opens her jaws to let the ball fall down mere yards away from you. "Vulpix." she cries as she uses her nose to slowly roll the balls towards you. Not wanting to end up getting pinned under the sphere, you quickly take a step back to the side to avoid the oncoming ball. Judging by the current state of the toy, it seemed as if this Vulpix must've found it lying about somewhere. That or in worst case scenario, she was abandoned.

As you gaze up at the ball, her intentions finally became clear. "You want to play?" you ask while gazing up at her amber eyes. "Vul!" she cries out happily once more as her tails begin to wag. A small chuckle escapes your throat, as you couldn't help but laugh at her excited behavior. "Alright then." you nod your head before averting your attention at the huge ball. As you stood before the toy, one good question pops into your mind. Just how will you move this huge thing?
1522311.title: She wants to play with you (friendly)

choices: Hide in a box of food
153.content: You were in some huge store, on a shelf with various boxes of food around you. Looking at all of them, you felt a bit hungry. But, someone was coming... What did you do?
153.title: In a Department Store

1533.content:
"Hey!"

The man who passed by stopped and looked around.

"Over here!"

He glanced your way, confused.

"Help me!"

The man got a closer look at you, then backed away slowly.

"Hey, where are you going?"

"I-I can't help you," he said, still stepping away from you. "My god they've tracked me all the way here."

"Huh?"

The man ran off screaming.

A minute later, a large woman came by. You wondered if you should ask her help, thinking she might try and eat you, but you decided to go ahead and ask her anyway.

"Hey!"

"Hm?" she looked over at you, suddenly surprised when she spotted you.

"Help me!"

"What do you want me to do?"

"Find a way for me to get back to normal size."

"You want me to..." she looked both ways and then whispered, "...rub it for you?"

"Go away."

She left. A manager returned.

"Hey, buddy, you're scaring my customers. You're going to have to leave," he told you.

"Ok. Wait, can you help me?"

"Huh? You want a job?"

"Um, sure, I guess that'll be ok."

"Good. Come with me."

He took you into the back of the store and placed you into a strange box-like appliance, sort of like a microwave. It was very cold inside and, when he shut the door, a bright light suddenly shined for a second. Then, everything went back to normal, except he didn't open the door again. You waited patiently, but several minutes passed by with nothing happening.

Then, you looked in the glass of the door and saw a slight glimpse of your reflection. You had been transformed into a...
1533.title: Wave to the person

15331.content:
Outside, at a counter, the manager was talking with a girl. Apparently, his counter was a small fast-food joint inside the store.

"Um... I'll just have a medium thing of fries and a small ice cream."

"Your total is 3.49."

As you sat in the freezer compartment in the back, you had no idea that you had just been purchased. However, at that point you were still too shocked at seeing that you had been turned into a pokemon.

Then the manager came back, pulled you from the freezer in your Vanillite form, and grabbed a pre-made carton of fries.

When you were brought out, you found yourself presented to...
15331.title: Vanillite (Pokemon)

15332.content: he transformed in a pokemon egg the men walk up seen pokemon egg the men think he take the egg to hatch thing men pick up the egg take house with he.but inside the egg the boy tires but his body trap now in the egg.2 months late your body is turn to a pokemon body and gender.the men happy to have you and smile.9 months your hatch men happy to see you.you look a your youself and you your baby eevee.now be girl or a boy eevee
15332.title: A Pokemon Egg

choices: ...loud footsteps behind you (The Kimono girls coming to rehearse a dance)
...sounds of a Pokemon nearly (One of the Eeveevolutions wandering around)
...a door opening (The Kimono girls entering to begin their day in the theater)
154.content:
A light suddenly shines from a hole that is high above you You saw that the "soda can" was not a soda can at all, in fact it's not even in a shape of a can instead it was a tiny rolled up piece of paper that was about a few times your size You looked up to see you are in a hole of some kind Trying to find out were you're really are, you try climb up out of the hole The walls were surprising smooth and slippery but despite this, you immediately climbed up all the way out of the hole after falling a few times due to the slippery walls

Looking around, you noticed that you're in a middle of a wooden floor that seemed to stretched for miles but at the horizon, however, you can clearly make what appeared to be a gigantic vacant theater of a traditional Japanese architecture feel to it You suddenly felt that you heard something like this way back when you were at Pokemon school But your mind was quickly interrupted when you heard...
154.title: In the Kimono Girls' Dance Theater

1542.content: Thinking quickly, you hid behind an old wooden chair, wanting to take in the situation before doing anything. You see one of the Eeveelutions pad in. You breathe a sigh of relief, seeing a...
1542.title: The Encounter

15422.content: Which one do you see?
15422.title: Umbreon or Espeon

15531.content:
You looked around, you were in a seemingly abandoned forest. It was really foggy, so you could only see so far. You glanced around, terrified at your current predicament. If anything were to come around, you'd have no way of defending yourself, everything's at least 50 feet taller than you!!
As if on cue, you heard a grunt behind you. You turned around slowly, and there, right in front of your face, was a...
15531.title: forest

155311.content:
The beast's hot breath blasted right in your face, knocking you on your ass. It was huge!! You stared in both awe and fear, this creature could kill you with very little force. Zor? It said curiously. It sounded female.
You backed up slowly, hoping to hide in a patch of grass, anything to get away from this pokemon. As you backed up, her paw slammed right down behind you, blocking your path. She dragged you forward, putting you in front of her face again. With this she wrapped her fist around you, and rose to her full height.
What does she have in store for you?
155311.title: The elusive Were-Fox.

1553111.content:
Your heart nearly froze as the giant zoroark blue orbs were gazing down at you. If that wasn't enough to send a shudder down your spine, then the sight of her massive tongue licking her lips towards the right surely did the trick. "w-wait! please don't!" you shout in a frantic pleading voice as the zoroark simply grins at your futile attempts at escape. With the simplest of ease, she begins to raise you upwards while even letting out some strange noises that almost sounded like huffing. Was she laughing at your at your struggles? Immediately, she parts her two jaws wide open to give you a good glimpse of the wet cave that was her mouth.

Inside you could see the sharp row of stalactites and stalagmites that were her teeth adorned on a valley of pink flesh. Her huge tongue slowly snaked its way out as if acting as some sort of bridge way to the dark pulsating cave that was her throat. Without even a warning, you she drops your body straight downwards into her awaiting hungry maw.

It only took but a second for your tiny frame to land upon the squishy, slimy surface of her great tongue as all the light around you was quickly cast into darkness, As you were crouched down upon the mighty muscle within her maw, your sense of direction was quickly thwarted as the huge tongue began to slosh you about all around the organic cave. As your body came into contact with surfaces that were both solid and squishy alike, your entire body was soon soaked within the great fox pokemon's saliva. After gasping from the dizzying set of actions, to you ultimate shock you began to feel the whole inside begin to tilt downwards. Immediately, you try and latch on to the surface of her huge tongue, though due to the huge amount of saliva adorned on top, it was impossible to even get a steady grip. Within an instant you feel your legs suddenly enter within some squishy fleshy hole that greedily begins to suck you downwards. With one final shout, your whole body was soon sent straight down the huge Zoroarks throat.
1553111.title: It's lunch time...

choices: She brings you to a cave, with other Zoroarks inside
She goes to a cave, where you're alone with her
1553112.content:
You're brought up to the Zoroark's face, and find yourself staring into her light blue eyes. You squirm in her fist, but she only tightens her grip on you. You're worried about what she might do to you, but at your size, you know there's nothing you can do to stop her.

Suddenly, the giant creature's tongue slips from her mouth, pressing against your face and slowly running along it. You squeeze your eyes shut and resist the urge to scream in fear of being eaten, since you know that would only make this Pokemon's drool get in your own mouth. When the Zoroark finishes licking you, you rub your face against her furry paw to try and get the saliva off, but when you finish and look back up at her, expecting to get stuffed into her maw, you see she's looking at you with gentle eyes.

The Zoroark growls quietly, almost like she's purring, and smiles at you. She brings up her other paw and pets you on the head a bit, then brings you close to her chest and starts walking.

You can't see where you're being taken, since your view is entirely filled by the Zoroark's huge grey/black body, but you can tell that she's not hostile to you, and that at least makes you a bit less worried for your safety. But it seems like she wants you as a sort of pet....
1553112.title: She wants a pet.

choices: She wants you to do some things for her...
She wants some other things.... maybe a hug?
15531122.content:
Zoroark takes you to her home, a huge cave. She looks at you with a smile.

What now?
15531122.title: New home.

choices: A colossal foot that appeared to be orange and scaly...
Huge black feet with a blue tail above them.....
155321.content:
It wasn't a soda can! It was an unusually large rock. You examine the surroundings and it became clear. You were somehow shrunk to an inch tall!

You try to find some answers when you walk into-
155321.title: Cave

choices: Get his attention in hope that he helps you....
1553211.content:
You get close to the foot. Yup! It's time to see who it belonged to..... oh boy.....

With a nervius gulp, you look up to see a gigantic dragon with a white belly which had lines across it. Above you was a seemingly mile long orange and white dragon tail, swaying peacefully. You were directky underneath the biggest Dragonite you have ever seen! Given that you were right underneath his enormous anus, the air wasn't so well here. You have to do something, but what?
1553211.title: A colossal foot that appeared to be orange and ...

15532112.content: You were gonna have to be brave and get his attention. Dragonite are very smart Pokémon. You look up at his tail again as it lowers down. This was your chance! You jump up and grab onto it. It sways around. You almost fall a few times, so be careful! It is a very long walk from here to his lower back. Once there, you feel some shaking. He was preparing to-
15532112.title: Get his attention in hope that he helps you....

choices: Shake it off and walk around him..
155321121.content: Everything moved and he sat down. You fall off and scream. He actually hears your scream and turns to catch you. You quickly fall into his big and scaly hand. After this, he brings you up to his face for closer examination. All you can think of is your great fear of him. He does recognize you as the human you are, but is confused over how you came to be so unusually small. Dragonite is very tired and hungry and is not sure what to do. If anything, he lays on his back and places you gently on his stomach while he thinks. You look on to see white for miles. They all stop right at the end of his super big tail. The floor moves underneath you due to breathing. You can also hear really loud and creepy gurgling sounds coming from the inside of his belly. You start to wonder... what would it be like to go in there? Hmm....
155321121.title: Sit Down!

1553212.content:
(I wasn’t sure what the previous writer was referring to, so I’m going to pick what fits best.)

You slowly look up at what you bumped into. It’s a Pokémon, with a large, scaly body with red spikes jutting out. It has blue wings that don’t look like they get a lot of use, which are made up for by powerful arms that look like they could gut a Rhyhorn.

You’ve never seen one in person, but you recognize it from books and stories.

Druddigon.
1553212.title: Huge black feet with a blue tail above them.....

155322.content: What about the Abyssal Ruins?
155322.title: Somewhere else

1553221.content: You find yourself in what seems a temple. You panic, wondering how did you got so small and also how can you return to your normal size and how you can get back home. You start to walk in circle, thinking of what could have you done this, when a beautiful sound fills your ears. It turns out to be a song. You, momentarily forgetting about your worries at the incredible sound, start walking in the direction where it comes from. After a few minutes of walking in this colossal (to you) temple, you stop to see a pokemon with a white face, long, green hair and a black 'dress', floating in mid air and singing a beautiful melody. You are literally enchanted by the music when it suddenly stops. The pokemon, that you have recognized as Meloetta, opens her eyes , that reveal to be of a greenish blue colour, and looks around. She must have felt your presence. Eventually the musical pokemon spots you down on the ground. She looks at you for a few second before smiling and flying down to you. You try to run, fearing of what she could do, but you aren't quick enough as Meloetta snatches you from the ground. The green haired pokemon brings you to her smiling face and opens her mouth as she...
1553221.title: Abyssal Ruins

15532211.content:
Before you could even try to react, the Melody Pokemon had already sent you on a one-way trip to her stomach.

Once you realized that just struggling in the murky bleakness wouldn't accomplish anything, you took a deep breath and pulled out your (mercifully undamaged) phone. There was no reception - no surprise in a cave - but there was a flashlight function, and you activated it.

Immediately, you regretted that.

Bones. So many of them. Skulls, limbs, ribs, all partially dissolved by the acids, and all recognizably human. Cleaned of all flesh, which was being used to fuel the evil little cutie of a Pokemon that you had stumbled upon.

In your last moments, you went back to screaming.

*. *. *
Meloetta giggled, hearing the intensified screams from within her. It didn't take a genius to realize that her cute little snack had just noticed the remains of their fellow people.

That kind of awareness was exactly why she only preyed on humans. It made the process so much more fun.

Of course, one human was hardly a filling meal (and the seven she'd had in the morning were long gone), and so she called upon her powers once more.

From within the cave, a tiny teenage boy emerged, entranced already by the beautiful music....
15532211.title: Drops you in and swallows!

choices: Uses Relic Song and turns in her Pirouette Form
Flies out of the temple. With you.
15532212.content: You close your eyes, fearing that the huge Meloetta wants to eat you, but it never happens. Instead, Meloetta actually nuzzles you and starts singing again; she sings a beautiful melody. The more she sings the more you feel relaxed, at the point you don't fear her anymore, but instead you look at her singing enchanted, like if it is an angel singing. After five minutes of Meloetta's singing she stops and looks at you, with a look that clearly says 'Did you enjoy that?' "It was really... wonderful" you Sat. Meloetta seems slightly happy of the compliment as she closes you in a hug "Melo e ta!" she says with a massive smile on her face. She is clearly thanking you. Meloetta then releases you from her hug and brings you to her face again, then she nuzzles you again. Meloetta then does a pose in mid air and sits you on her lap; she then starts singing again, this time a sweeter melody. For the third time today, you are completely under this Pokemon's spell. Meloetta keeps singing for ten minutes, occasionally caressing your head with her fingerless 'hand'. Suddenly she stops and look at you on her lap. You return to realty when she stops singing and look up to her. You smile at the giant pokemon; you can't even find the words to exprime your amazement "Beautiful..." is all you manage to say. Apparently, it is enough for Meloetta; she picks you from her lap and hugs you again before she...
15532212.title: Starts singing a beautiful song

155322122.content:
The wild Meloetta looks at you grasped in her small, fingerless hands, as she studies the tiny, weird 'bug' she found. It's very similar to a human. But that's impossible, she thinks, humans are much bigger than that.

"Uhhhh? Could you please let me go?" you ask, hoping the gigantic pokemon understand you. Meloetta seems to understand, since her baby blue eyes widen upon stating you just talked to her. Sure, you talked to her before, but those were whispers of fear, that Meloetta simply exchanged for mere squeaks.

The Melody pokemon looks at your tiny form shocked. This bug that looks like a human... it's actually a human! Happy about her discover, Meloetta repeats her name twice in excitement, before flying in direction of the exit of this cave, with you still grasped solidly in her hands. Although she hasn't got fingers, she's strong enough to keep you still without any problem. Not that you are struggling anyway, knowing that falling from such height could mean your end.

Meloetta flies outside the cave that, from what you can see, is actually a sort of temple situated on the sea. Meloetta flies away from the temple and into a near forest, while the structure sinks in the depths of the sea.

Still firmly hold by Meloetta, you notice her flying up on a tree and sitting down. She stares at you for a bit, wondering what to do with you. After a bit, she gives you a long lick, tasting you.
"Lo me!" she literally sings, pleased by your unique taste.

Sweat mixes with the saliva that stuck to your face as you pray that the Melody doesn't want to turn you into food. Meloetta is deciding what to do with you. Your taste is incredible, she could make a great snack out of you. But then... when the opportunity to keep a tiny human for herself will happen again? Very probably never.

After a long and hard decision, Meloetta looks at you and smiles...
155322122.title: Into the forest you go

choices: She wants to play with her new little 'pet'.
She has something different in mind...
1553221222.content:
Meloetta is very pleased with your taste. So pleased that she could eat you right then and there. But... if she eats you... You'll be gone. And when will the chance to keep a tiny human happen again? Not in a short time, maybe never. Maybe that's the only chance she got. And decides to take it. Plus, you'll be surely more useful to her as alive.

You stare at the thinking, huge pokemon. Your heart is racing, the fear of what she wants to do with you keeps you paralyzed.

It doesn't take long for the Melody pokemon to fix her attention to you. A slight smile crosses her white lips as she stares at you happily. Then, she starts moving you towards her face.

Fearing she wants to eat you, you close your eyes, waiting for your doom. Which never happens.

Instead, the green headed pokemon pushes you into her cheek and nuzzles you.
"Lo me! Lo me!" she says in a singsong voice.

Even though you can't understand a single word, you get that you're going to live... at least for now.

Sitting down on the branch, the Meloetta holds you in front of her face. You wonder what she's up to...
1553221222.title: She decided to keep you!

15532222.content: how about alola? One of the female trial masters?
15532222.title: Other

1553222222.content:
You still aren't satisfied?!



Fine....
1553222222.title: EVEN MORE!

15532222222.content: If Alola isn’t your speed, what about the Sevii Islands?
15532222222.title: Island options

choices: Five Island, home to the Rocket Warehouse
155322222222.title: Islands 4-7 are better

info.brief_description: Try not to be eaten or crushed by Pokemon and their trainers... No guarantee of survival!!
info.description:
By now, I'm sure you all know what to expect from me.

All adds are taken gratefully. I don't give out any rewards for adding, though.

There aren't any rules for my stories. If I want to delete something, I will do so--with or without advanced warning. Don't let this prevent you from adding chapters of your own, though; I've never had to delete anyone's work, and it's not something I do lightly by any means.

I'll admit that I'm very bad at responding to your e-mails. It's not something, though, that I can promise I'll get better at. But, more than anything else, I appreciate ratings (even without reviews) and gaining fans, as well as chapter additions.

Please enjoy this new idea of mine! Also, check out my other story, "Your Life: Shrunken to a Snack," and look out for more stories of mine in the future.
